body:
I was genuinely looking forward to receiving this product. There has been a lot of hype about this device. The design was sleek for a $150 phone. I figure give it a try.
The phone came nicely wrapped in a nice little box with a pair of headphones, a flip cover case, and a charger (alot to add for a $150 phone). The phone felt nice in the hand..
Then I turned it on. The resolution was OK. The screen although 5.2  was swallowed by the bezels and the size of the phone. The camera was OK. Everything was... Ok. Nothing was necessarily bad just not a superb experience as I was expecting. I would recommend this for anyone that doesn't know that much about Android or just entering the Android world or for a parent that is getting a child there first phone. But from an experienced Android user I wasn't super impressed. Will not be used as my daily driver
Beyond what I thought for the money. Package arrived a day early. I'd recommend it to anyone.
Had problems with the Bluetooth and sent it back.

I travel a lot internationally so I have been looking for a budget phone with acceptable performance. This phone gave me everything I've been looking for and so much more. Coupled with the front flash, the 5MP front camera creates amazing selfies, something my iphone 6 cannot compete with. I can go on and on about this phone. The only con I can find is the battery life and it takes a long time to recharge but life is perfect ;-).
Good quality 👍
Battery heats up when playing games
This phone works great i really love it. the WiFi is good the screen looks awesome. Their is really nothing i can complain about.

Pros:
1. Extremely good value for money. I paid $100 for this in April (no, not an April fool's joke).
2. Almost native Android 5.1. Minimal bloatware.
3. Has band 12. I have a OnePlus One and that does not give me 4G data when I am in some parts of the country. Also, the OPO had poor mobile data speeds in the UK. This phone works for those purposes quite well.
4. Dual band and the included SIM toolkit app does a good job at delegating activities to one SIM. When traveling in the UK, I had data through my T-Mobile SIM and phone calls through my Lyca mobile UK SIM
5. MicroSD expandable.
6. FM Radio - insert included earphones or your own earphones and you can listen to FM radio. This comes in handy especially when traveling or when at gyms that route TV audio through FM radio stations.
7. Comes with a very decent accessory pack including earphones and a portfolio like case.
8. For the money I paid, a brilliant screen.
9. Customer service located in the US and answers the phone.

Cons:
1. Biggest con is the battery charging ability. The included charger only goes at 1ma and this isn't changed even when you attempt to use a higher charging capacity charger. It takes me about 2.5h to go from 30% to 100%.
2. Mediocre Camera. The camera does a decent job but don't expect a flagship camera quality. The front camera does have flash though. The camera overall has poor performance in not well lit shots.
3. Audio quality is not the greatest. You cannot hear the phone when on speaker. Being that the speaker is placed on the rear end of the phone, you better place the phone on its front if you don't wake up easily with alarms.
4. Not so great battery life. My Screen on Time with Bluetooth and location on is about 3.5h which is good but not great.
5. BLU is not known to update software on their phone so I don't expect to see Android 6 on this phone. Also, these phones don't enjoy much patronage in the Custom OS world.
6. While it has 2GB RAM, it isn't as snappy as some of the flagship 2GB RAM phones like the Nexus 5X.
7. Only noteworthy OS related issue - when you restart the phone, it reverts to the Default sound settings. I have had an instance of restarting my phone during a meeting only to receive sound notifications when I had prior to switching off phone set it at "meeting" under the notifications.
Things it does not have have which I don't necessarily consider to be a disadvantage:
1. Does not have WiFi AC support.
2. No NFC
3. No front facing speakers

In short, great value for money. With a dual SIM, FM radio and support for band 12, hard to find a better phone for the frequent American Traveler.

I'm coming from an iphone 6 to this phone. I broke my 6 and needed a phone to hold me off until the end of the contract. I bought this not expecting much just something to get me by and honestly i havent really noticed that big of a difference, wifi is good, mobile data is lte, vid quality is good, speakers are meh but whatever i have headphones and car speakers lol, all in all if you just use your phone for basic things like watching netflix/YouTube, calling, texting, streaming, etc. this should get the job done just fine.
Ok for the.price but battery heats like crazy, battery lasts half a day and phone cracked at first small fall
Great phone for the price. Could use a better speaker. Other than that good phone!

I recommend that you research the review first, Google it..  I wish I had done that before. I think the people who are  commenting on this phone just received it.. But they should wait at least a month or so before rating it.. The camera is great, everything else is terrible.. Firstly the flashlight and the camera flash just stop working  whenever I try to reset the camera to see if that would help it jump right back to the home screen.. It jump back to the home screen when am in my gallery, messages & everywhere.. I cannot store picture, music  on my SD card everything is stored on the phone & that make the phone move extremely slow. If I unstalled an app the space on the phone is not freed.. Sometimes am in the middle of doing something & it shut right off.. Also it keep replacing the wallpape i put up with the wallpaper it came with.

in very happy with my new phone the only thing is that the proximity sensor does not work ive been seen a lot of people saying the same thing. since my old phone dint have a proximity sensor im accustom to locking the phone before putting it in my ear but it would have been nice to have it  working for the screen to wake up when finishing the call but o well its a minor issue that i really dont mind a lot so POCKET MODE does work also.
at first glance, a very good phone, I can not say much, just got comfortable, big screen, good resolution, really quickly opens the page, the speed at height, thanks to Amazon.

I don't believe it! Very fast phone. Quality also very good. In hands sitting like 300$ price phone. Materials soo good. I compare with ASUS ZenFone 2 Laser (199$) - this phone much better. Software clean. Only 2-3 bloatware programs but you can easy uninstall without any problems. Screen have outstanding quality. Bright and colorful. Resolution perfect. I think this is one of the best phone in this price group. Recommend for everybody.

Good phone for the price range as i got it for $99. But at times faced few connectivity issues. Overall meets the requirement but expect a marshmallow update as promised by BLU which will be a great addon
Bad touch with a lot of bugs and hanging

I purchased this phone for my wife because she has been using my old Galaxy S2 for several years now.  I read some reviews and saw that it was on sale, so I decided to give it a whirl.  She's not a phone power user, so a phone with high specs was not necessary.  We received the phone a few weeks ago.  At first I was concerned because the back cover just felt too plastic and flimsy to me.  I powered it up and started setting the phone up for her and instantly knew that I had gotten my money's worth.  This thing is terrific!  I may even get one for myself!

It's a feature rich device, is quick and snappy the most bang for your buck. However the battery life is a bit on the down side for a power user. Charging time is average as one would expect with a 2900mAh battery. Its very slim and sleek. The headset and charger are not really great quality will get damaged easily, also the included screen protector is a bit smaller than the face of the device. It makes applying it a bit difficult, since it does not line up exactly.The included wallet case is superb though, allows immediate functionality from the window (answer, end calls and toggle through music) and has the sleep and wake feature. Camera (Front is 5MP and with flash, selfie's are awesome) (Rear is 13MP and really comparable to the huge brands). A great buy and I would definitely recommend since this is the 4th BLU that I have purchased. They are getting better and better.

Update : Stopped working after a week  :(  I called Amazon customer support for replacement phone.

I bought this phone for my office since I didnt want to spend a lot of money for an office phone. For personal use I have an Iphone 6s. It has lots of features and great battery life. Screen is very crisp and bright. Its a steal for 99 dollars. Go get it !

I can't believe that I own a phone as bad ass as this one for 150$

I was skeptical that it would be junk considering the price. But i did a ton of research and everything for a budget phone pointed towards this.

I'm an avid tech nerd, and use the s*** out of my device. So many apps and widgets all over the place and it doesn't seem to slow down the device at all. I've yet to find one thing about this phone that I don't like.

I'm happy to own it. For the price especially.
I can't find a reason not to like this phone!  Prob the best phone I've had in the last 3 years!
Looks good. Battery doesn't last as long as expected. But for the money, it's a good value.
Excellent phone. Wonderful display, fast performance, good battery life. It is really the king of budget phones.
Not as fast as you would think for having an octacore processor.
Great phone

i got my phone the other day and i am impressed with it. It came on time and the screen looks amazing and the gorilla glass is a nice touch to it. The screen is very vibrant and the colors look really great. its looks like the screen is an amoled display but its not. the case it comes with is nice looking but my only complaint with that is when the cover is closed it dont go all the way to the side of the phone prolly bc of the pu leather and the way the increase is but all in all its a nice case. the downfall i have on the phone is YES the screen is very sensitive to the touch. when i am txting and i goto the mojis and i scroll through it everytime i lift my finger then back onto the screen to scroll down again it puts that moji in the text line...so yes very sensitive. To bad that i cant use it as my daily phone because my area dont have much of any coverage in my area with T-mobile or At&t so im screwed on that and i didnt know that till i activated my phone with service. It would go in and out of service alot and had to shut the phone off to reboot the system to gain service again. Ill be using it soon though due to me moving out of this area anyways. Its worth for what the price is on the phone. The camera is pretty good. Its not the greatest but its does take some good pics for it being 13megapixels. i love the 5.2 inch display on it. i also have the Blu Dash M 5.0 and the life one x beats the other phone by far.
It overheats so bad (on any usb cable or charger) that i am affraid it is going to catch fire

Overall package's tactility feels as the price would suggest, but this is a strong performer in it's class. There are newcomers to the price range though and I would suggest that you'd do you research before pulling the trigger.

This really is an attractive phone. Performance is acceptable, and the display is beautiful. Really solid battery life, wireless and cell performance. However, there are s couple flaws that resulted in me returning this phone.
1. A hissing, static noise when I connected to my car's audio input using the headphone style cord. No other phones have ever done this.
2. Data in a couple different apps would be lost between sessions. Particularly my podcasts, which was obnoxious. However my Play Music downloads disappeared (18 GB) and had to be downloaded a second time.
3. Really poor update support. Blu said marshmallow would be available end of March. Still nothing as of 4/29.

This phone is really good with specs design and overall performance camera is amazing true to its name best budget phone you can get only probably was the shipping took awhile and past my house twice!! Which was crazy but amazing product

This is a great phone... its fast, roomy, runs for days without a reboot... rarely lags, and has plenty of room for my apps, and the screen is bright and vibrant.  I use it with MetroPCS without any problems.

2 gripes... battery life is just OK and you cant swap out the batteries... so thats kind of a drag.
Also, I've yet to find a workable root method for this phone so thats kind of a bummer.
But an awesome phone for the price and I would totally buy it again/

This phone has a lot to offer for the price. However I am going to have to return it as I have some problems with it that are rendering it unusable for me.

The AUX has something wrong with it. With headphones and speakers it's fine, but when it's plugged into bigger speakers like my car stereo there is a loud static noise constantly buzzing in the background and lower/heavier sounds get distorted and poppy like a damaged record. Piano for example sounds like S***. No other device I have used with my car stereo has had this problem so it's definitely something to do with the device itself. It's not just a faulty phone either, I exchanged it and it still doesn't work. It's subtle most of the time and I could live with it but...

Time to talk about the battery. The life itself is good. But the charge time? Awful.. I'm not asking for the supercharge 20 minutes from 0 to full like the top of the line phones. But 2 hours for 50%? That was out of the box. I've been using it for about a week now and been downloading more apps and stuff is downloading over WiFi while its charging so its actually LOSING battery while its charging. About 1% per minute... I had to power it off as it was just going to die anyway.

It could be a great phone. But these two problems are making it unusable for me. Maybe somebody who does less on their phone will find a better use for it but since they're being more and more a part of human lifestyle this is unacceptable =/
It was great for a month or so then began running Hot!! Battery too short lived...

My husband has a Blue Life and is pleased with his. When my MotoX had an untimely accident, I ordered a Blu Life. Pro: Nice screen, decent camera, fast. Con: Blu tooth cut in and out, text program is third rate, unable to send to multiple recipents or send attachments

Far exceeded expectations. I was changing platforms back to an Android and didn't want to get locked in by AT&T so hunted for a decent unlocked phone. I even considered refurb. My only complaints is the apparent lack of image stabilization in the camera (or it is just not as good as others), and the fairly cheesy portfolio case it comes with (grandma might like it). Other than that, it is a very solid phone capable. The non-replaceable battery will annoy some people, but it easily gets me through a full day with bluetooth running (vivosmart)> I only wish I would have got it during the $99 sale. The pending Vivo 5 is supposed to be about $50 more and may be worth waiting for if your in the market. $150 is easier to part with than getting locked in by AT&T and ending up paying $450 for a phone I want to replace in 2 years.

Losing a star
-5 months into 2016 and that promise of marshmallow in early 2016 is fading fast. Sales talk..
-they are absolute silent on their facebook pages and other outlets other than pushing more product. Miami HQ? That is hard to believe
-the camera quality is probably the biggest let down. Images lack sharp details, motion blur is a constant issue.

To some extent I got what I paid for, a cheap unlocked Android phone. I wouldn't buy again and don't see myself buying a BLU product in the future.
Not enough options in the setting menu.
Best phone I have ever had... It's been 3 month since I purchased it and I'm amazed of what I learn about this phone and what it can. Thanks blu.
amazing phone for $99 fast great screen best selfie camera ever. i bought this for my daughter and i have an s6 and im im impressed

Phone charge ok first time. Second time charged to 70%. Third time to 45%. It's useless.
There is something wrong with the battery (non-replaceable) or the charging electronics inside, but not the external power adapter.
Hope I can exchange it for one that works!

It's an "ok" device. However GPS is complete trash. MediaTek SoC is very lackluster, Snapdragon 410 will outperform it (even though the 410 hasless cpu cores). And they promised 6.0 marshmallow "early 2016", it's May and not even 5.1.1 security updates. Over all Do not recommend
Excelente cel phone....
Outstanding phone!  Here is my video review on it: https://youtu.be/giqfLdGFAJ8

Everything about this phone is pretty good, no glaring issues, except for the speakers.  The ear speaker, as well as the external speaker are terrible, so on phone calls, expect people to sound as though they're talking into a jar, before the sound gets to you.  Really, really muffled.

That aside, everything else is fine.  Fast enough, battery use is fair, screen/picture is pretty great, camera is so-so, but expected for the price point. Daylight pictures are just fine, low light gets pretty grainy.
Very good :)

I purchased mine for $150 and I am jealous of all who got it at $99. This is an incredible phone with nice display and camera. The software is as fast as a stock android and does not come with bloat wares. It also comes with a nice case. I might buy another one for myself soon when my current iphone dies. I preferred this over the moto g as it has better display and the storage is expandable to 64G instead on 33 on the Moto G. The honor 5x had some negative reviews about performance, which is a big issue for me. The only con I found is the over sensitive touch. It cannot make a distinction between palm and finger tips. When I used to type, it would always prompt for me to switch keyboards as my palm would touch the bottom right corner. The solution was to disable one of the keyboards. This appears to be an easy firmware fix, are you listening BLU?
Its ok but the battery didn't last.

I was really happy with the phone...but after only three month of use the battery is not working. I have to shut down most of the services to keep the battery charged up. I had to uninstall facebook and many other apps to keep it from dying by 9am after a full charge. I had install a battery app to see if any app is draining my battery. I found out no app is draining my battery. Very disappointed.
Its a great phone but I don't know how to change the ringtone to one that I want, can anyone help me with that? (Songs that I saved?)
if you have AT&T be careful, this phone may not be able to receive any calls and AT&T will not be able to give you much support as they have no information about the phone.
A must buy! Don't waste money getting a $800 phone when this can perform almost if not better then them.

This is my third BLU device. My other two were the BLU Studio 7.0, and the Life 8 XL. This phone blows the previous two away. The screen is clear and responsive. I've yet to encounter an issue with this phone.
front camera not working !!
Awesome phone.
Awesome product

Fantastic phone for the money.  I got mine on sale for $100, but even at the regular price of $150, this phone is a win.  It clearly outperforms the current generation Moto G in most respects at a much better price.  The only thing lacking compared to the Moto G is water resistance, so if you want a good budget friendly waterproof phone, the G is a better choice.  If you can live without the waterproofing, this is a superior phone.

My wife and I both received these phones yesterday. The screen is absolutely GORGEOUS. It takes great pictures, and looks very sleek and high-quality. But there are some apparent issues that we didn't want to deal with:

Phone runs a little hot. I've had bad experiences with hot Android phones in the past, and just the fact that both of the phone's were running hot was enough for me to return it. My phone also came with a minor cracked LCD under the glass. Immediately I lost trust in Blu, and am returning these phones for a Moto G 3rd gen.

So to sum it all up for potential buyers:

Pros:

Jaw droppingly good screen
Great battery life
Light, but feels good in hand
4G and packed full of features
I enjoyed the added case

Cons:

Has good benchmarks, but something just isn't right with the performance. The phone glitches and freezes doing random tasks such as browsing and even in the settings menu. I didn't like this.

Both of our phones ran hot. You can feel it towards the top. Bummer.

My screen came damaged. Not sure if this is isolated, but it still isn't good.

Hope this review helps!

Got this for my wife since she broke the screen on her BLU Life 8 XL. She loves this phone. Hopefully with Gorilla Glass 3 on this phone, she won't break the screen. We'll just have to see. The screen is excellent, the phone has no lag whatsoever, the calls are clear, and she loves the flip case that came with the phone. Another great phone from BLU.
Not compatible with MMS on Cricket

Since the last update, can't change the ringtone  (i tried everything even reset the cellphone), in my country can't use 4G, so can't find an option to use just 2G/3G, that consumes the battery very quickly, finally, I found a little spot in the rear camera, as you can see in the attachment (BTW, the screen is clean), after that update..Honestly I'm a little disappointed.

Screen sensitivity is flaky, even with no protector. Keyboard response can be slow. Response time with several apps open is slow. With a minor drop (from couch to tike floor) screen has a crack. Even for a somewhat inexpensive phone, AVOID!!

BLU Life One X (4G LTE) is a great value android smartphone. The elegant design and crisp LCD screen are the two main feature that I appreciate the most. This phone also has dual sim capability which is very useful and convenient if you travel internationally or if you have two phone numbers such as personal and business number. This phone 16GB storage is expandable with microSD (which is my main dissatisfaction with iPhone that iPhone internal storage can't be expanded). This BLU Life One X phone is also unlocked so you can use it with your existing plan (e.g. AT&T, T-Mobile, etc). This BLU Life One X phone has 2GB RAM which is good enough to run multiple apps and play games (clash of clans, etc).  This BLU Life One X phone reminded me of Oneplus One+ phone which is also a great phone (albeit much more expensive). A plastic screen protector and nice flip case for this phone with a window in front to view time/date/notification is included. Adjusting to this phone keyboard (vs iPhone keyboard) will take some time (not sure if it is this phone specifically or android phones in general). Also adjusting to the android OS and interface will take time to get used to if you are used to iPhones.  There are a lot more things you can customize with android phones (widgets, etc).  One thing I haven't been able to figure out is how to turn off the vibration feature when I type on the keyboard. If anyone know please let me know. All in all BLU Life One X is a great budget smartphone.
Great cell phone compared to its price!
This phone is a steal for $150.
Really great phone impressed with just about everything

Apparently it had really good specs but touch is not as responsive as a I thought. I guess you pay and get a little bit more for what you paid for but not that much. I will update the review later.

UPDATE: One of these lost its power button.. how can this be? Satisfied until this happened and I cannot find any viable replacement!

I was very skeptic before I open the small brown box the phone came in. Upon opening the nice box the phone was in I was flabbergast, completely surprise of the architecture that was put in this phone. Nice very nice indeed. The beauty of this phone was when I took the phone to my carrier to switch the SIM card. The attendant was very impressed with how well this phone was design, they was in love with the phone. Comparing their $600:00 phone with my $149:00, and a 13mp, my phone was the total winner. BLU had done it again, your ROCK.
Thanks! BLU
so good for the price but the only thing it needs that to get a good steal or metal body

UPDATE 1/3/16: After 3 days with it i've noticed a little playback issue with music over bluetooth headphones... hopefully the software update will fix this, still gets the five stars, im happy! and I hope BLU or any other brand release cases or covers for it soon! :D

I cant have a "Verified Purchase" as I bought it trough an outside service because the item isn't shipped to Honduras.

Anyways... the phone is almost perfect! I've had it for a few hours and I already love it, its so fast, it doesnt lag for anything, great screen, perfect size and oh so elegant looks.

The bad sides at least on my unit... it overheats fast while playing games, the battery doesnt last as much as all the hype ive read, from 65% (it shipped like that) to 0% took only 4 hours... i must admit i used it a lot, but... i think it was a fast drain and finally while the screen is great, the whites have this minimal yellowish tint that even when is like almost nothing still bothers me.

Still, this phone deserves the whole 5 stars... for $99 (got it on the day it was released) i cant really expect this much of a smartphone, BLU did it great this time.

Thanks! :D
i'm from argentina, i bought this product thinking it was unlocked, but now it doesn't work with my sim card
Excellent cellphone!

This has to be the best phone for the money.  It performed like a high priced cell phone.  It is quicker reading my emails and Facebook than my desktop.  The only thing I would have changed on the phone is the camera stabilization.  I have added an app that will wait until the phone is steady before it takes a picture.  This has improved my pictures.  The battery lasts all day and still has power when I charge it at night.  My wife likes the phone so much, she had me buy one for her.  Easy setup.  Just take my SIM card out of my old phone and recognizes my carrier.  Will be looking at BLU phones in a few years when I am ready again.
I missed the sale on this phone. Now my mind doesn't allow me to consider a next phone until this phone goes on sale again. Please BLU. Please. Even if its just for an hour. Please.

Got the white one today, and was pretty impressed when I unboxed it.

UPDATE:  I installed a 64gb sd card and the os is setup to use that as the default write storage for everything.
After install I looked in storage and the internal sd was empty except for the system files and ALL apps etc was on the SD card.
That's pretty cool and is a feature of Android 6, they must have back ported that feature..

Not sure if people know a update is available that addresses the slow charging.
It might not automatically notify you so you just need to go to settings, the about phone and pick the wireless update option and check for a update.

Sure the touch screen is not as nice as a 600+ dollar phone, but guess what you can get 4 of these for cost of one iPhone 6.
The display itself is very nice and looks as good or better than my moto x 2014 and the build quality is wayyy better than the Moto g 2nd edition, actually no comparison.
Purchased this for a company associate. He is young and didn't want to be bound by a contract. For his age, it works. They like the phone. It looks expensive.
Works flawlessly. Dual SIM. All features as described by manufacturer.

Phone is fantastic and I would recommend it for anyone. My quick take
PROS:
- screen is beautiful, especially after you edit its  colors in settings
- battery life is great, around 4.5hrs screen on time
- stock android pretty much, can uninstall the 3-4 bloat apps
- easily unlockable bootloader and root, like a nexus
- cameras are great in good light. Low light is fine, nothing great
- premium feel, metal edge and leather feeling back, curved screen edges like iPhone. Feels like a $300-400 phone
- very fast and responsive. It does all the tasks I did on my nexus 6 at same speed if not a little faster. I know, it makes no sense
CONS
- no nfc, not a big deal for me since I don't use it
- battery takes forever to charge. Around 4 hours from 0-100. Thank god it lasts all day
- low light pics are not very good or visible

So conclusion: pretty much prefect phone. It's my go to recommendation now for anyone who wants a new phone and doesn't want to spend $400+. Get it, you won't regret it. I say it's essentially an android version of an iPhone 6. I got it for $99 but even for $149 its a steal.

Absolutely the best budget phone I could ever ask for. So simple to set up and absolutely unlocked. Pop the sim card, log in with Google, and you're done. Battery life is very fair.
2GB Ram is PLENTY for multitasking and the phone has little to NO BLOATWARE. iphone 6 only has 1GB RAM so go figure!

This phone has pleased me very much. The signal reception is high quality.
I love the fact that I can have an AFFORDABLE and QUALITY Phone.

Screen is beautiful. We put it side by side a Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge and the quality of the video at some points looked much cleaner.
5.2" screen is wonderful
Comfortable to fit with one hand use and large enough for two hands.
All buttons are neatly placed on one side and is distinguishable to the touch.
ULTRA THIN
ULTRA LIGHT
Under daily usage you can't tell it's a phone with that price.
This phone FEELS as if it's AT LEAST $300 dollar value.
American Made - love it because it means to me bringing jobs back to the local economy.

with all great things there are a few shortcomings:
Loud speaker has a "tinny" sound.
Bluetooth is not too strong
free headset sounds muffled to the call recipient

With all that said, there's hardly any reason why spending an auto payment and leasing a phone makes any sense.

Pictures attached have a skin installed on the phone!
Great product!

I have been looking for a great budget phone ive looked every reserched it all and this looks like the best i ordered the blu energy x plus but cancelled it as soon as i saw it i got it for a 100 bucks an 2gigs of ram and octa core processor 13 mega pixl cam best ive seen around ill give a full reveiw when i get it but best budget phone possibly out there ive seen! Thank you blu 😀

I got this phone when it was $99 but I think I would have paid the $149 for it if I had missed the sale. You get an awesome screen that is quite bright. You get almost stock Android Lollipop. I only had to remove an antivirus app that came preinstalled. There was one other thing but I can't remember but I am grateful for being able to take off what I didn't want. The default mail app is Boxer which isn't bad. Touchpal 2015 is the default keyboard and ASOP keyboard comes with the phone. It is easy enough to go to the Play store and download the Google keyboard or any other you want. I have had sporadic lag with the keyboard regardless of which one I used. That was mostly as the phone was setting up and I was downloading my apps and right now I have not had a repeat of the issue. If you type a lot it would be quite annoying if it remains a constant problem. I will update if it continues. The speaker is in the back of the phone and is quite tinny sounding. Blu had to save money somewhere on this phone and I suppose this is where they chose to do so. The screen is top notch and build quality is excellent.  People say I sound clear on calls and I can hear everyone just fine. This will depend on your phone carrier also. The phone takes two sims and you can set it up to use data for one sim and voice for another. You can also store apps on your micro SD card IF the app allows it. Some apps will not. If you don't want to spend a lot for a phone but want plenty of value for your money this phone is worth a try.

Update for 12/19/2015  There have been no more issues with any of the keyboards I use lagging now that all apps have been set up. I restarted the phone last evening after the last app I wanted to install was put on and have been using the phone quite a bit since then and I have not had a repeat of the problem so far. I do find the default keyboard not to be that great looking but I understand it is quite popular in some circles. This phone is slow to charge up to full. It took over two hours and twenty minutes from about 36% down yesterday but with intense use it has held up nicely so far today. The screen is quite bright so turning it down if not in direct sunlight will also help the battery life. Because the phone is new I am using it more than usual so it will a few more days before I know what battery life will be for me. I still think this is the phone to get whether Blu ever updates it to Marshmallow or not. This is a lot of phone  for a small price. I did not turn on encryption because it can slow down some phones. Wow, the days of donating a kidney to afford a great, high performance smartphone are over. Stumbled across this phone while looking to buy my teenage children inexpensive smart phones, and so glad I did. After a lot of research, I bought three,  2 for the kids, and 1 for me. It's now my daily driver, replacing my Galaxy S5.

--Screen is amazing.
--Beveled edges on the Gorilla Glass make my finger tips very happy.
--8 core processor is super snappy. Performs better than my Galaxy S5. Antutu benchmarks over 37,000. Mediatek challenges Snapdragon with great performers like this.
--Battery is exceptional, all day power and plenty remaining.
--Camera is snappy and has so far taken excellent quality pics.
--MicroSD expandable storage
--Build quality is excellent, looks flagship quality.
--GSM unlocked, works excellent on my T-Mobile. Also has T-Mobile LTE band 12 for better indoor data coverage.
--Near stock Android without all the bogus annoying software you get when you buy a Samsung or any phone from the carrier.

I paid $150 and it's worth every dollar. It looks and performs like a much more expensive phone.

BLU and Mediatek scored big fan points from me!  Highly recommended!
I love this phone, it works perfectly for me!
I bought this phone, but missed the start button . It came with the button broken off without problem repair. However the day was lost. I need to buy a replacement.

Bought this phone during the sale price for $99. The phone performs very well. My wife uses it as a daily driver. The battery life is great and last the whole day without needing a recharge. I did have to use SMS Pro to get the MMS working on Cricket. The screen is very crisp and I used the Adaptive brightness setting to make the phone last even longer on the battery. The phone responds very well when installing applications as well as using applications. The camera works very well as well. The only downside about the phone is that it takes longer than my Moto G 3rd gen to charge. The included accessories such as the flip case work very well. The screen protector is very small and does not fit the screen completely. I recommend purchasing another set of screen protectors. I hope my phone lasts at least one year. If it lasts one year my investment will be worth it. I also hope that this phone gets the marshmallow update.
Got this phone for only $100 bucks! Can't beat that price and the phone actually is a great phone. Happy with my purchase

For an excellent review go check out Armando Ferreira's on YouTube. It was so good that I'm giving him free advertising. In case you don't want to check it out, I will sum it up for you and add a bit I learned from other sites (Android Authority, and a few others):

Build:
Excellent feel in hand, and has a premium metal band around it, and a removable leathery plastic back (much like the Note 4's).

Screen:
Great looking budget screen, on par with either the iPhone 6 plus or 6s plus screen, just 0.3" smaller and not quite as bright.

Performance:
Great snappy all roud performance, better than this year's Moto G by double on geekbench (Single Core was around 600, while Multicore was around 3000). RAM management was excellent for 2GB RAM.

Battery:
Above average, it got somewhere around 8:30hrs on a video playback test (This year's Moto G got 7hrs for comparison).

Camera
A better camera than you would expect for the price. Both cameras (front and back) are exactly on par with this year's Moto G.

Speaker
Tiny and underwhelming volume. The phone's weakest point.

Other Notes
It has all necessary bands to work well on T-Mobile, but is missing Band 5 for AT&T (Google Band 5 for more info).
It is a dual sim device.
Micro sd card support for up to 64gb extra space.
Battery is 2900mah and non removable.
No fingerprint sensor is included.
Dimensions 149.5 x 73.6 x 8.6 mm (5.89 x 2.90 x 0.34 in).
Weight 141 g (4.97 oz).
It only has bluetooth 4.0, so you will not have the latest there.
No NFC.
FM radio is inluded.
Built in GPS.
Processor info:
Chipset - Mediatek MT6753
CPU  - Octa-core 1.3 GHz Cortex-A53
GPU - Mali-T720

Well that's all the information I could gather up, hope you found this helpful in deciding whether to purchase this phone or not.

So, great phone

I bought two of these phones the black and the white on the 11th January 2016. Generally I like the phones and what you are supposed to get for the money it would be good value for the money. The phones do have a good look and feel to them but there seems to be slight differences in feel from the black to the white. What I didn't realise was the battery was NOT removable but everything was in the box as advertised and arrived on time.

Pros:
1. The front facing camera with a flash is a great addition. Picture quality is reasonable
2. The usual dual sim that Blu has come to be known for. This model carries two (2) micro sim slots
3.The phone is GSM, unlocked and can be used with any carrier

Concerns:
1. The phone charges slowly. (takes over 8 hours to get a full charge) what makes it worst, the phone discharges quickly. WITH NO USAGE AT ALL the phone will discharge at least by 20%-30% in 2 hours. When compared to my previous Blu Life Play X this is poor battery life which carried the same apps and more than this Life One X 2016.

2. The phone does not come with the traditional silicone case which in some regards is good since it gives the phone a different look, however to put on the case you have to take off the back that the phone comes with to clip on the case. The challenge with the case is that it is not comfortable to text with and the phone only seems to be better manipulated with your right handed. I am not sure if the intention was for the user to fold the case back but I can see over time the case will begin to tear and unfortunately I have not seen any other cases for this phone. In addition, the case forms the back of the phone and offers no real protection to the sides or edges if the phone drops

3. The screen protector that the phone comes with does not cover the entire face of the phone.

4. I set the phone off time but it does not shut off even when the time has passed

Having the knowledge I do now, I would have made a different choice especially because of the battery performance.

To anyone  looking for a phone that won't break  the bank I highly recommend this phone.

(I'm leaving a 4 star review, only because I've not had it long enough to judge battery use. I'll update when I see how long that goes.)

Overall: I've been using Motos and Samsungs for several years and, this BLU Life One X gives them a run for their money.  I use my smart phone all the time, and from what I can see so far, this one can be a game changer.  I'm not a gamer and not constantly watching videos, but I do push the phone with odd applications, etc.  It seems to be able to handle these.  Excellent quality at a very good price.  16GB onboard, 2GB RAM.  OctoCore processor.  Nothing cheap about this.

Build Quality: Excellent - feels solid.
Phone - Excellent - strong signal, good sound.
SMS/MMS - Excellent.
Display - large, excellent resolution Gorilla Glass.  Very responsive.
Video - Excellent quality, no lag or chop.
Camera - Excellent - Clear & simple to use.  Flash too!
Bluetooth  - Excellent connection and sound quality.
OS - Basic Android 5.1; no lag, works just like you would hope.  No bloatware.  Just ready to go. There was an update, but done in 5 minutes.

General Observations:
- The box it came in and amenities - charger, cable & earbuds all very nicely and solidly packaged.  Feels high quality.
- The optional, but included case is a flip open "checkbook" style.  This leaves a little to be desired. The case is one where you remove the back and clip the optional one in.  It has a flip cover with a cutout to see the screen.  I'll be replacing this when more options are available, but for the time-being it works.
- I charged this up from 65% - took about an hour.  Logged on to wifi and transferred my apps and settings via Google backup and all worked very smoothly - no problems at all.
- Popped in my Cricket SIM card in SIM slot one, and it worked - no mus no fuss.  No settings needed changed or complicated gyrations.

Again, just a few hours in using it, this BLU is a winner.

This almost has the specs of a flagship phone and yet it's only priced $149!  There's a few places that had to compromise and it mostly is with the unoptimized buggy Blu software, but you will not find a phone for this price that's better.  The camera isn't anything to write home about, they claim it has phase detection autofocus that's fast but it's painfully slow and most of my pictures are blurry even when I'm still so I hope they get this working better with a future update.  The phone launched with some initial issues like custom ringtones not working, the touchscreen would be unresponsive at times and the wifi would have intermittent issues.  But Blu released a bug fixing OTA update on 1/26/16 and it seems to have fixed only the issues with the custom ringtone that I can see because I still have wifi problems mainly when trying to stream pandora over wifi.  To set your own ringtone you go into sound, hit the 3 dots, add profile, name it whatever you want, then choose your ringtone and this will now work after the latest update. The update hasn't seemed to have fixed the wifi issues or the touchscreen being unresponsive at times.  But It's good to see that Blu is listening to the customers complaints about issues and getting them fixed seeing as this is probably one of their hottest phones right now.  Overall I recommend this phone for the money, if money isn't an issue then you wouldn't be looking at this and would be getting something like a galaxy S or Nexus phone.

After almost a week with the phone, I returned it and ordered a 3rd generation Moto G. The phone was quite snappy and had some good things going for it, but ultimately its negatives weighed it down so much that I thought it would be troublesome to own. The biggest con for me was the slow charging time. The first charge from 30% to about 99% took around 6 hours and then a few days after first beginning to use it, it would either not charge up, its battery level would drop even while charging (with screen off), or its battery level would hover while charging (with screen off). I cleared the cache numerous times, as I heard that might fix the charging issues, but it didn’t. Even if the phone would charged properly, the charging time was still far too long for me to deal with. I remember times with previous phones when I needed to quickly charge from 10-30% before going out or traveling somewhere. It hasn’t been an issue with any of my previous 6 Android phones.  Here are the pros and cons of the phone:

Pros:
- Beautiful display
- Fast, snappy Android experience (I used Nova Launcher)
- Nice build
- 2 sim card slots and 1 micro SD card slot
- Long battery life when Power Saving mode was enabled
Cons:
- Slowest charging I’ve seen on any phone going back to my first in 1999
- Tinny sounding speaker which is on the underside of the phone (not ideal for podcasts or speakerphone)
- Camera has trouble focusing and requires multiple attempts to finally focus. In some cases it wasn’t able to focus
-  Limited selection of cases/covers

I looked at the Asus Zenfone 2 Laser, Alcatel Onetouch Idol 3, Huawei Honor 5x, and Motorola Moto G (3rd gen). I ultimately went with the Moto G because despite its 720p screen, it is splash/water proof, it has a decent camera, it has close to stock Android, lately Motorola has been OK about pushing out updates for at least 1-2 years after each phone release, and it has Gorilla Glass.

Only way to get around this is to go to google and hope it sends you to a sigh in page. But honestly, really good phone for a price, great camera, screen, speed for the price. I just wish i could get the speaker to work again, living without being able to hear when someone calls me or i receive notification is really inconvenient as I am a student and need to know if professors notify me.

Lets get one thing straight. Its a $100 phone and no flagship killer. Its a great value phone for $100-150.
This review is based on one week of usage.

Pros:
Light weight, easy to navigate, reasonably fast, cameras (front and back) are towards the better side. Front side flash for selfie is good thought and nice to use. Screen is gorgeous and responsive. Nice to hold in hand.

Cons:
Battery life is a drag. Drains very quickly. Takes time to charge.
Another issue I have is with the software. Phone automatically connect to any open wifi such as xfinity etc. and disconnects from the LTE. Its a good feature until you realize that not all open WiFi are free and you have to either subscribe or login. Problem is if your were using the data it does not work anymore because you are not connected to the internet. Very annoying in actual usage.

Cover that comes with the phone is nice, but it will get time to use because I keep pressing the power button for it to unlock and it actually locks it back since unlocking and locking is being monitored by the proximity sensor.

Games:
Scrabble is not an issue on this one. Previous model couldn't even handle that.
Asphalt 8 not so much. There is a you tube video comparing this phone with moto g where they show that this phone handles Asphalt 8 easily. I cant confirm that in my usage it was painfully slow to load, extremely frustrating to  play due to choppiness.

Final Verdict:
My previous phone was Lumia 920. If I wouldn't have broken the screen third time and unable to find a really good replacement screen, there was no reason to upgrade to this phone. Its actually a downgrade based on the features and performance alone, except the screen size and added benefits of more expanded range of apps on android. Anyhow, I will keep the phone. Its a nice phone for daily usage if you are not a gamer. For them this is not the phone. Overall I am happy with my purchase...until now.

About 25% of the time my texts aren't sent and I have to resend them, sometimes 2-3 times. My sim card works fine in other phones, so it's definitely the phones problem. Not very satisfied. This happened outside the return period so I can't even get a refund.

After using this phone for 3 plus months,  I must say that I have little to no complaints. As budget smartphone's go, the features and usability of this device impress me thoroughly.  While a flagship killer, it is not, it is the perfect alternative to the $700-$800 commitments currently offered by the major carriers.  I use this phone on StraightTalk with the AT&T SIM and have enjoyed great service and exceptional call clarity.  The phone feels good in hand and performs at or above the level of the Galaxy S4 (which is currently $300 unlocked) that I had previously.  If I had to nitpick, I'd  say the phone could charge faster and the speaker isn't the best, but I have enough Bluetooth speakers that it doesn't really matter. Updated review:

I had great difficulty getting MMS (picture messages) to work properly with this phone.  BLU support responded with this information:
"...set APN Type as the defalt,mms,wap for AT&T (and AT&T based carriers) or default,mms,supl for T-Mobile (and T-Mobile based carriers).  In addition, for Cricket Wireless, I had to use AT&T's MMS servers:
[...]

MANY places online advised different settings than the ones that I have found to work, and Cricket Wireless online support was not able to assist, claiming that the device was not working as it should.

Please see the rest of my original review.

Original review:

The BLU Life One X (2016) is a fine phone and well-priced.  I have owned mine for a week.

Things I Iike:
1) Size.  The phone's size is excellent.  You almost have to hold the phone yourself to appreciate how thin it is, which definitely helps when you are putting a phone with a 5.2" screen into your pocket.  And I can put it into my front pants pocket, even when wearing jeans.  This phone is a little large for one-handed operation.
2) Display.  Again, the size is good, the colors, brightness, viewing angles, resolution, all very good.
3) Price.  I bought at the $99 introductory price, but this is still a very good budget phone at the regular price (currently $149 as I write this review).
4) Android has been largely left alone.
5) Performance.  It is very zippy. I run tons of apps and this phone has taken it all without a hiccup so far.  With 16GB on-board storage and 2GB of RAM, lots of space to load your apps and lots of memory to run them.  8-core processor.
6) Takes good pictures
7) It's unlocked.  So now that even ATT has indicated that they are phasing out traditional 24-month wireless service contracts, there is more incentive than ever to go out on your own and get the most phone for your dollar so that you can shop around for the best prepaid wireless plan.  With a phone like this, you are free to move to the better plan whenever it comes up, as long as it is on a GSM network.

Things I don't like:
1) The power button is on the middle of the right side of the phone.  I sometimes bump it while just trying to hold the phone.  Annoying.
2) With the new BLU Vivo series phones announced for this month, you can actually get a lot more phone in the Vivo for just a few more dollars if you get one of the Vivo phones at the introductory price.
3) The included folio case/cover seems to be the only cover you are going to find for this phone as of right now. That is important because of #4
4) The gorilla glass covers the entire front of the phone and is installed in such a manner that if you drop it, I think there is a good chance that the screen is taking the hit.  There is no bevel or anything on the edge.  The screen is not in-set at all.
5) Battery is not removable.  So I am not sure what to do if the phone ever locks up on me.  Every Android phone that I have had has required that at one point or another, I remove the battery as the last resort when the device is in a hung state.
6) It will automatically adjust screen brightness for you based on input from its light sensor, but there seems to be a delay associated with it, like perhaps it is only adjusting it once every minute or something.  That is not really that bothersome, but worth mentioning.

Other thoughts:
I was not really in the market for a phone at the time that I saw this one at the introductory price, but a friend had a good experience with BLU phones and when I saw the features for the price, it seemed a no-brainer to give it a shot.  This is easily the best phone I have ever owned, and at $99 it is also the cheapest.  BLU has raised the bar on entry level Android phones.  This does not look like or feel like a budget phone. It is beautiful.  It would be nice if someone would manufacturer a decent protective case for this unit...my only real gripe with the phone is the position of the power button feels awkward to me.  If not for that, I would have given a 5-star review.

Update February 2016:  You can purchase a case for it now (and I did).  I bought this one:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01AVT8XZS?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s00
It is not an awesome case or anything, but there is nothing wrong with it, either, and it does resolve the issue of accidentally bumping the power button.

I hope you found this review to be helpful.

Terrific phone, high quality feel. Exceeded my expectations, especially for the price. I needed to upgrade from my Samsung S4 which was beginning to act erratically. I am hoping for the 6.0 update sooner rather than later, but Android 5.1 is running smoothly and oh yeah, did I mention fantastic battery life? No? Well I should, because it does. Great phone all around.

It seems like most reviewers these days are more interested in talking about the camera or the "feel" of the back; but first and foremost the darn thing is a PHONE and you want to make PHONE CALLS! I have wondered whether the bad audio quality I had with my Samsung Galaxy S4 was due to the phone or the network. Now I know, it's the phone. had a long long call yesterday and audio was crystal clear.
My only gripe about this phone is the battery life is less than I wanted it to be. Other than that it performs well with few bugs.

I'm writing this review on my LG Risio that came with my Cricket line. The reason for this is after having sent back my first Life One X due to a faulty proximity sensor not blacking out the screen during calls (resulting in numerous instances of muting people, putting them on hold, deafening myself by accidentally turning on the speakerphone or just hanging up on them- all with my cheek or jaw) my replacement is charging (slowly) upstairs after having discharged its battery in the space of hours, even while plugged in. This is after the battery patch Blu released and with minimal usage.

I factory reset the phone and am hoping the issue will sort itself out. Meanwhile the $30 Risio is chugging right along with over half battery after a day of moderate usage.

With all the specs this phone has on paper I was hoping that any bugs (even big-name phones have them) would be minimal. I love the features, I love the crispness of the display. I love the fact that Blu was able to keep bloatware to a minimum. The camera, while shaky, takes crisp pictures and does a decent job. These aren't enough to make up for the glaring problems of unusually quick battery drain and proximity sensor problems that render the unit all but unusable for basic functions (you know, talking to someone and having a battery that will last you through the day).

I want to love this phone. If I were to rate it solely on paper qualifications it would be excellent. As it is its on probation- if this current round of attempted fixes don't work I'm returning it also and going with the Studio Energy 2 I was originally looking at.

UPDATE:
Went with the Studio Energy 2. It only took 2 months (5 1/2 weeks of which was spent waiting for the first One X) for me to go with the BLU phone I originally was looking at. Like my original review said I wanted to like the One X but the more I dealt with it the more it seemed like a rushed, bug-prone device. Loving my Energy 2.

For the price you really can't beat this phone. Top pros: the 5.2" screen... It's great, a little warm but HD is evident and the contrast is best I've ever had with an IPs display. Battery life is wonderful with its 2900mAh battery. Slim form factor is nice, fits in pants easily and is extremely light which I prefer, but that's more my preference after 2 years with an htc one m7. And beat stock feel is great with added features that are welcome and useful like double tap to turn on the screen(though it does like to do this in your pocket at times so I've setup a pattern unlock). Oh and microSD expansion which so many manufacturers are mistakenly moving away from.

Ok so the quick cons: audio is not a strong suit, though that's not very surprising... But even audio out of the 3.5mm jack has interference/cracking(not sure if that's just my phone though).  Slight lag issues; this is not a power house phone with only 2gbs of ram and a plus middling processor, but again for the price this is probabaly more than most would expect.  Baked in apps aren't the greatest either like the phone dialer or just the stock UI, but luckily for Android this is easily remedied. And as other reviewers have noted, the screen has a tendency to turn on while you're talking on the phone and I've muted a few calls on accident which was incredibly annoying BUT now that I know about it I'm more careful(you can pull your face away for a second or two, place it back and the proximity sensor starts working properly again).

In total, wow....for all this phone lacks: nfc,quick charging, better audio, fingerprint scanner, lack of solid phone accessories(cases primarily) this phone still doesn't disappoint. Love that I can take this baby overseas and pop a SIM(or 2!)into this global/unlocked phone.  Another pro is that you can freely move around to other cell service providers(but unfortunately in the US this is harder to take advantage of) and take some decent pictures with it too boot.

If you're not looking to break the bank with your next smartphone purchase and your ok with not having all the "latest & greatest" features then this is the phone for you. Especially if you're like me and use your phone mostly for Web surfing and some YouTube-ing. Good phones are getting cheap and this is definitely a good phone.

There are many, many reviews for this wonderful phone on Amazon so I thought I'd leave those well thought out essays for you to peruse in your own time. This is strictly a How To Guide on how to root this phone and how to install Viper4Android on it.

I am creating this guide for people like me who have been searching for a while for an exact, concise way to root the BLU Life One X (2016) which is available on Amazon. I have had to piece together information from various sources as well as helpful people on XDA such as manos78, yrude and rogersa2k.

DISCLAIMER: FOLLOW THESE INSTRUCTIONS AT YOUR OWN RISK. I WILL NOT BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR BRICKED OR UNRESPONSIVE DEVICES!

Model Number: BLU Life One X
Build Number: ALPS.L1.MP3.V2.21_6753.65U.G_P11
Custom Build Version: BLU_L0070UU_V12_GENERIC 09-11-2015 18:44

This phone is similar in build to the Wiko Fever and Micromax Canvas 5 E481 so a modded Wiko Recovery is used in Fastboot to help establish root. But first the bootloader must be unlocked.

On your PC, you need to have ADB Fastboot files in order to use these commands so I'd recommend downloading Minimal ADB Fastboot. You can get that from here: http: //www.mediafire.com/download/dl43w72ko84gyb3/minimal_adb_fastboot_v1.3.1_setup. exe

Install Minimal ADB Fastboot on your computer, preferably on your desktop so it's easily accessible.

Next download the CWM recovery file from here (you can also use TWRP, but for this particular instance I chose CWM so that's what I'll provide a link to. I don't like giving instructions for things I didn't actually do myself.):
http: //www.mediafire.com/download/0tueoydk6ka80p8/recovery_mod_wiko_fever_beta3. zip

Unzip the file and place the recovery-custom-wiko-fever.img in the Minimal ADB Fastboot folder you placed on your desktop. Now hold the SHIFT key + right-click inside this folder and choose the option “Open command window here.” A CMD window should appear. Leave this open and set it aside for now.

We first need to unlock the bootloader and since the unlock process will delete all of the files on your phone, it's recommended to perform this before you even login and download apps and settings, etc.

Once gaining access to your BLU Life One X, go to Settings > About device and touch Build number seven times to enable Developer options within the Settings. Back out of this area and go into the Developer options that you just enabled and turn On USB debugging and OEM unlocking.

Now plug your device into your computer via the USB cable and wait for the device to show up under Computer by pressing the Windows + E keys. Open the device in this window and leave it at the screen where it initially shows all of the phone's folders.

Download SuperSU from here: http: //www.mediafire.com/download/gsgawcjvll6l871/BETA-SuperSU-v2.52. zip

Place this zip file into your phone's folder that you opened up previously.

Power Off your device but keep it plugged into your computer.

UNLOCK THE BOOTLOADER

Power On the device into the bootloader by simultaneously holding the Volume Up + Power buttons until you see the BLU splash screen, then let them both go.

In the CMD window on your computer, type: fastboot oem unlock and press the ENTER key.

On your phone, select YES with the Volume button to scroll and the Power button to execute it. Then select the option to reboot the phone. This erases all of the info on your device like a Factory Restore. Two reboots are automatically performed and the bootloader will be unlocked.

If you want to check and see if the bootloader is actually unlocked with the CMD window, enter: fastboot getvar all.

INSTALL CUSTOM RECOVERY

Now you need to flash the custom recovery you downloaded earlier. Ensure that you still have your device hooked to your computer via USB cable and make sure the CMD window to that folder is open.

Reboot your phone into bootloader mode by simultaneously holding the Volume Up + Power buttons until you see the BLU splash screen and then let them both go. Use the Volume Down button to select “bootloader” in the menu and press Volume Up to select it.

Within your CMD window, type: fastboot flash recovery recovery-custom-wiko-fever.img
(After you type recovery a second time, you can press the TAB key and it will fill in the rest of the filename.) Now press ENTER.

After the recovery has been successfully installed, unplug the USB cable from your phone.

Hold the Volume Up + Power buttons simultaneously until the phone shuts off then let go of both buttons. Wait a second and hold both of the buttons again until you see the BLU splash screen, then let go of both buttons. This will now boot into the custom CWM Recovery you installed.

ROOT

With the Volume keys, scroll to the option that says “Install zip” and press the Power button to select it. Scroll down and select the file BETA-SuperSU-v2.52.zip that we placed on the phone earlier. Press the Power button. Return to the previous screen by navigating with the Volume buttons and then select “Reboot Phone”. Make sure you select the option that says “Yes - Fix root (/system/xbin/su)” and press the Power button.

You are now rooted! To check, install Root Checker from the Play Store or some other app that requires root and make sure you press “Grant” when the option pops up from the SuperSU app.

VIPER4ANDROID

Now it's time to install Viper4Android on your BLU Life One X! Download it from here: http: //www.mediafire.com/download/dvg222yc22hcp77/ViPER4Android_FX_v2340. zip

Also you need to install SELinux, which you can download from here: http: //www.mediafire.com/download/n78rplbcnk6867x/SELinux. apk

On your phone, go to Settings > Security and make sure you enable Unknown sources so you can install the following programs.

Unzip the Viper4Android file and place only the ViPER4Android_FX_A4.x.apk file on your phone via USB as explained before. This is the older version that worked with KitKat and unfortunately it's the only version that will work with this phone. Install it on your device but don't open it, yet.

Next, install SELinux on your phone and open it. Select “Permissive”. This is very important or else Viper4Android will not work!

Next, open Viper4Android and install the drivers (I always choose Super Audio Quality as it gives you more audio options). Next you must reboot your phone normally.

Congratulations! You now have Viper4Android installed!

ENJOY!

So far, I've liked using the phone. The screen is really nice and the leather cover/case that it comes with is actually pretty sturdy (especially for me since I'm left handed and I have to fold it all the way back). Also, the case stays pretty compact agains the phone, so it doesn't increase the bulk at all. It receives 4G LTE on T-Mobile really well here in Salt Lake City, but it has also worked in other cities I've been in since owning the phone. The battery is able to last a whole day, and I'm a moderate to heavy user of it. It's a really nice design and seems to have a sturdy build quality to it. The camera is ok, nothing to write home about. The call quality is average for me. Some people have been saying that the speaker on the back isn't loud enough, however it seems loud enough for me, but it is a bit tinny at times. The only downsides I've found is that the screen seems to get out of calibration very, very easily where it would take a swipe as a tap or vice versa and that it takes FOREVER to charge (so I try to time it where I charge it overnight instead). Overall, I would recommend this phone to anyone who is looking for a budget smartphone.
Good phone

UPDATE (Feb 11, 2016):  Unfortunately, I started experiencing the issue in #1 below and worse.  WiFi would not reconnect to known networks.  I then could not manually connect to known networks.  I did two factory resets to no avail.  I really wanted to like this phone, but this issue is a deal breaker.  Returning it to Amazon for a refund.

======================== ORIGINAL REVIEW FOLLOWS =======================

I've been using the phone for a few weeks and am very pleased.  I'm coming from a Moto G 1st gen and this outperforms it as well as my wife's Moto G 3rd gen.  I won't repeat what has already been posted numerous times, but I will address some bits of misinformation in previous reviews:

1.  I've read the phone frequently drops wifi and switches to mobile data.  I have not experienced this whatsoever.  My wifi connections have been rock solid even on weaker router signals.

2.  There are no touch-dead spots on my screen.  Entire surface is functional and as sensitive as any phone I've used.

3.  The SMS/MMS does work with Cricket wireless.  Use the following APN settings (no root needed):
Name: ATT Phone
APN: phone
Proxy: Not set
Port: Not set
User name: Not set
Password : Not set
Server: Not set
MMSC:[...]
MMS proxy: proxy.mobile.att.net
MMS Port: 80
MCC: 310
MNC: 150
Authentication type: None
APN type: default,mms,supl
APN protocol: IPv4
Enable/disable APN: APN enabled
Bearer: Unspecified

4.  The speaker isn't going to blow your ear drums out, but is loud enough for me to hear the ringer in a crowded room and to wake me up in the morning.

5.  Google Voice/Hangouts works just fine contrary to a previous review I read.

6.  Custom ring tones can be used but they must be set in the built in system settings.  Apps such as Llama can change system volumes but can't change the ringtone itself.  The ringtones can be on the SD card, as well.  UPDATE (January 31):  V14 OTA update apparently fixes this if you were previously having issues (I was not).  Settings -> Sound & Notification -> General -> Gear Icon (next to General) -> Phone Ringtone.

7.  You can choose to install the apps in the on board storage or on the SD card.  You do not have to install them to the SD card and can change it in settings.

8.  I've had no issues not auto-connecting to stored wifi connections.  It has worked just fine and has never connected to a router which I didn't previously have saved.

9.  Asphalt 8 and other graphically intensive games do work and the frame refresh rate is high enough to make them playable.  However, they aren't as smooth as a $500 phone or my iPad.

10.  I've had no problems with the built in alarm waking me exactly on time.  I have had issues with 3rd party, alarm/timer apps waking the phone.

11.  Yes, the phone is 16G, but only has 9.46 free due to the OS.  This is typical with any phone.

12.  There is about a 1/2 second delay from pushing the power button and the screen coming on.  It was slightly annoying at first, but now I don't even notice it.

13.  Battery life is good enough to get me through an entire day.  Battery recharging time is below average.  However, I've never woken up to a phone that wasn't 100% charged if I left it plugged in overnight regardless of how low it was.  After 2h 27m of screen on time and 11 hours since I last had it plugged in, my battery is at 59%.  UPDATE (January 31):  V14 OTA update seems to have fixed some of the battery issues.  My battery appears to charge faster.

Some things I haven't checked but hope someone might verify or prove false:

14.  Can't watch movies stored on the SD card.

15.  Can't connect to hidden networks.  UPDATE (January 31):  This has been verified as incorrect.  Super Max commented that he has no problem connecting to hidden networks.

Hope this helps.  If you are encountering any of the issues addressed above, you may have a faulty phone.
Great phone for the money
Great phone at unbelievable price. Very much recommend it.

This phone has been heavily reviewed already, so I'll just cover a few points I haven't seen mentioned much.  I ordered the phone on the $99 special, it took five weeks to arrive.

Although several reviews say LTE can be used on both sim cards, only one sim can be used on 3G/4G/LTE at a time.  The choice of bands is only enabled for whichever sim is selected for data (which can be either sim).  The other sim only gets 2G, which is a bit limiting (especially in Canada).  This is normal for dual sim phones, but is perhaps unclear from those reviews.

The cell broadcasts option for emergency and amber alerts (usually under "wireless and networks / more") is missing (or well hidden somewhere else). Wi-fi signal strength (only the 2.4GHz band) is slightly below average (in other words, not as good as my other phones).  Cell reception is average, nothing special.

Main camera focus is slow and doesn't focus very close, so reading barcodes (for example) is harder than some other phones.  Really the autofocus is quite poor for indoor shots, not good enough for photographing documents. (yes, this is after the plastic cover has been removed from the lens).

Still, for the price, it's usable, but not great.

+ Great specs for the price; better than competing phones (e.g. Moto G 2015)
  2GB RAM, 1080p, 2900 mAH battery, good benchmark scores (averaged 620 single core, 2800 multi core)
  https://browser.primatelabs.com/geekbench3/search?q=blu+life+one+x
+ Excellent build quality
+ Dual Micro SIM
+ Expandable storage
+ Complimentary accessories (case, headphones, screen protector); case is leather and not half bad

- Cheap USB charger: makes a high pitched whining noise; I wouldn't trust this charging overnight; get a different charger
- Cheap headphones, screen protector is not form fitting (made for different device, does not cover screen entirely)
- GPU could be better (gaming performance is not really great)

My quirks with the phone are minor overall. I still think this phone is a steal for $150 considering the competition.

I have real mixed feelings about this phone.  On the one hand, it is a fully legitimate smart phone.  My last several smart phones have been HTC flagships.  This is my first phone I've purchased outright, and it holds its own against a flagships from a year or two ago.

The reason I can't recommend it is that within about a week of use, I notice one morning that the glass surrounding the rear camera was completely shattered.  I don't know when or how it happened.  I've had 4 or 5 smart phones before it, I treated it the same, and I've never had a lens or screen break before.

Blu support says I need to agree to $50 charge to fix it, and if they find anything else that needs fixing after I send it in, they'll charge more than that.  Replacement parts aren't available for me to replace it myself.  I don't know what 5P lens is supposed to mean, as they advertise, but I'm not impressed.

I'll list the Cons and Pros in order of importance to me.

Cons:
1) Lens either self destructs or is incredibly fragile
2) Touch screen takes more pressure to register than other smart phones I'm used to.  When playing Words With Friends, occasionally I have to press 2 or 3 times to register.
3) 3 button Android headset buttons control volume rather than track advance.  Apps don't seem to be able to correct that.
4) The edges of the screen are beveled, so tempered glass screen protectors won't fit

Pros:
1)Very usable as a daily smart phone, doesn't feel like a compromise in function
2)Has MicroSD
3)has band 12 LTE for T-Mobile
4) price
5) 1080P
6) Lightweight, reasonably thin, good size and proportions
7) Looks pretty straightforward to disassemble and repair (once parts are available)
Works perfectly in Venezuela ( Movistar) LTE Band 4.

I highly suggest this phone to anyone that is looking for a quality smart phone that will be primarily used for talk/text. The battery dies a little quickly for people that are avid app users.

Pros:

Fast. The octa-core processor more than does it's job. Very fast with no lag.
The only app I've had crashing issues with is Chrome, and that's primarily because I usually have 20-30 tabs open at once while simultaneously playing music. Even then it's only crashed twice.

Great battery life. This phone will EASILY last you through the day with moderate use.

Beautiful 1080p display. At this price point you couldn't possibly ask for more. Might be the best thing about this phone.

Cons:

It takes this phone an ETERNITY to charge. 4 hours AT LEAST. Somewhat made up for by the fact that the battery life is so long. Still, this isn't the kind of phone you can charge for 30 minutes, or even an hour and have over 50% battery.

The touchscreen itself is pretty iffy. It's fine when doing things like texting but it has a pretty noticeable problem with scrolling. Whether you're scrolling through Instagram comments or a webpage, the screen will often stick and click links your finger went over as you're scrolling. All phones will do this every once in a while, but this phone does it A LOT, to the point that it's very annoying. I switched to this phone from the LG G2 and the difference is easily noticed. If this were a higher priced phone this might have actually been a deal breaker.

Overall I think this is a very good phone, easily worth the price. It has issues, but no phone at this pricepoint will be perfect.

This is really a great phone for the price. The android operating system works pretty well. Every now and then it hangs up on something—usually if it hasn't been used in a while—but the phone reboots quickly. Call quality is really good. I like the fact that it comes with two different backs, one of which has a cover attached.

The battery lasts a while, but be warned it takes forever to charge. The long charge time is probably the biggest negative of the phone.
