I am on t mobile network, works fine. Synched up fast with my google accounts and apps loaded quickly. I was easily able to remove the preinstalled apps (not many to begin with) and set it up in under 15 min. Upgraded from an LG L90 so this feels like a night and day difference. The cameras are great and the screen is very bright and responsive. I was not worried about purchasing a BLU phone after reading and watching countless reviews from people on here and Youtube. I am so glad that I upgraded, I would not spend more than 200$ on a smartphone in the first place ever. This phone feels and looks like phones 3 times it's price so I feel like I really got a deal. I am keeping the folding case on the phone that comes with it because i could be devastated to ruin this lovely phone.

This does not feel like a cheap phone also, as many people online have also mentioned. The aluminum sides and plastic/rubber back feel great in your hands and give it that expensive feel. I really don't mind that the charging port is on the left side of the phone and not the center, that is one small thing people complained about but I don't see the big deal.

Bottom line: This phone is simple but does not feel like a 150$ phone, if you are iffy about getting this phone and you currently have something that is older/slower/and keep telling yourself to "wait it out" just do yourself a favor and upgrade to this awesome device.

Great backup phone or daily driver. I put it through my test and I got a little lag here and there but its definitely a good phone to have. If it was 200+, I'd still recommend it. Its a total win for the price.
Super cellphone for the price, works just fine with Videotron in Quebec
Fast internet connection,light weight, battery life is average & the picture comes out nicely. I love it. :)

I was looking for a new phone and found out about the BLU phones. The specs seemed really good, and the price very affordable.
Unfortunately, the phone did not perform up to my expectations.
I especially was frustrated with how bad the touch screen responded. It appeared as if the phone requires more pressure than normal for the touch event to be registered. This particularly was noticeable when swiping over the screen.
After a few days of use, the phone became way too slow.

I eventually returned the phone (thanks to Amazon's amazing return policies!), and I am currently looking for buying a different one. Unfortunately, this particular BLU phone was not the right one for me.

This is a great phone.  Comparable to phones more than twice the price.  Only major downer is the glass.  There is no way this phone has a gorilla glass screen.  I have broken 2 of them in the past 3 months. The mist recent was a minor fall that most phones would have survived .  That said I'm about to buy a third... And hopefully a better case.

It's not a perfect phone.  It's missing a gyroscope, which means it can't sense a wrist flick.  It's also missing a finger print scanner, NFC, and quad HD.  OK... but it's also $150 and frankly for me, those functions do not matter to me.  For the people it's made for, (basic smartphone functions like web browsing and apps) it's fantastic.  The battery lasts me more than a whole day of heavy usage, at least 3 hours of on screen time.  It plays all the fancy games I want to because it has an 8 core + graphic intense GPU that I could want.  Plus it's thin and light.  So if you're looking for EVERY FUNCTIONALITY that a flagship smart phone has, this phone won't meet your needs.  However, if you're a heavy smartphone user who doesn't need the missing features, well this phone is perfect for you.
it was a gift and the person who received it loves it

I love this phone.  It replaced my Cubot X6.  I stopped buying "name phones" around 3 years ago.  This is a snappy phone.  It is light and it fits well in my small hands.  The display is amazing.  Very clear and sharp.  The quality of the WiFi is excellent as well as the connection to 3 or 4g. The only negatives are the case that comes with it, does not fit the phone, and the earphones are not great quality.  You cannot go wrong with this phone.
Great phone at a great price.  Easy to use and nice to hold.

I am a previous blu life one owner and i loved it but I'm very disappointed in this new model. going to have to buy another new phone because the charging spot on it doesn't read the cord when I plug it in. Also after a week or so it started bending. Not sure how much more life it has left.

My sim card doesn't fit. My son has a sim that pops out that would fit into this phone but his came with a prepaid plan. How can I find a sim that can do this to fit into this phone and make it compatible with my TMobile account so that I don't have to rely on WiFi because I really want to keep this phone and not return it.........yet
Item as described.  Great value. Fast shipment
I've had the phone for less than a month. Any issues I had were resolved when I used Android's keyboard instead of the preinstalled one. The processor may make some apps incompatible or run oddly.

upon receiving this phone,  I was very impressed from the speed of this powerhouse! every app, text, picture message and email I sent left before I even hit the send button! with an octa-core processor I don't see why it would want to slow down. don't get me started on the visuals... whoo! the 5.2 in goes a long way and with the Miravision technology it was equipped with,  it's like holding a 1080p hdtv screen in your hands. excelled every expectation I had for a budget phone claiming to stand it's ground next to a Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime and the Motorola Moto G
Loving this phone.

(This is Ron's wife) I bought this as a replacement for my Moto G 2nd Gen... this is SO much better. I didn't have high expectations, seeing as how it only cost me $150, but the specs seemed good enough, so I gave it a shot.

I have to admit, I was pretty blown away. The screen is large and clear and the resolution is perfect. Bigger than the Moto G, but not as ridiculously large as the iPhone 6+ (which doesn't even fit in my hand properly). I don't consider myself overly techy but I guess I am, as I had about 60 apps on my SD card that transferred. Most of my apps and contacts from my SIM card transferred, only a few on each card didn't make it properly. That was a huge plus, to basically just plug and play.

I don't hardcore game, but on the couple games I do play, I never have lag. I have also never had lag on texting, typing of any kind, or any of the apps I use. It's refreshing to go to a phone with 2GB memory and not have to constantly close apps in order to make another one run properly.

Camera is good, honestly, it seems on par for all of the other phones out there. None of the selfie cameras are any good, no matter what brand you buy. I'm a professional portrait photographer, so naturally, my phone pictures SUCK.

Package came with charger, screen protectors, second back that doubles as a case, and earbuds. Pleasantly surprised! This phone is definitely good quality and I haven't found a fault with it yet. I've had it for about 2 weeks. :)
Very good smartphone for its money

I had purchased an older Blu product several years ago. It served well, but I needed/wanted an updated phone. After some looking, this Life One X fit the budget and the specs I hoped to have. I have to admit, this phone is better than I expected! Especially for the price (which really isn't part of my joy).

Let's start by saying this phone is fast. Runs any app I have, and then some, without batting a digital eye. Netflix, Spotify, games, productivity .. you name it, a champ.

The camera is really good too. Before, I had a 5MP camera. Which was decent for what I used it for. HOWEVER< the Life One X's 13MP rear camera is sharp like a tack. Great pictures, not waiting for it to work. It just .. click, done. Click done. Fast. And the 'selfy camera' is a 5MP which is a good surprise. I can take a shameless selfie, do some periscope videos, whatever I want - done. I can do skype calling with my family several states away .. all simple and fast and lookin' good. I'm endlessly impressed!

The one thing that I've yet to get used to is the sensitivity of the touch screen. While not a "con" per-say, it is a bit frustrating how many people I accidentally call when scrolling through my contacts. This is more me needing to get used to the sensitivity.

I bought two: One for myself and one for my wife (who's never used a smart phone before). We're both pretty well pleased!
I found it as I expected

Bottom line: I like everything about it but both speakers are so bad, I had to return it.

Background

I don't like spending a lot of money on a phone, I was using a Lumia 640 but decided to jump back to Android.

The BLU Life One X was impressive, it's very thin and the "leather" like back helps the grip, much more than my super-slippery Lumia 640.

The screen is fantastic, very sharp with excellent colors, way better than the Lumia 640. The higher quality photos look almost 3D because they're so sharp.

I have zero complaints about the screen, I'm not sure how any phone could have one better. Also, the screen can be made very bright, brighter than any other cell phone I've ever used.

The Life One X is fast enough, no problems for me, although I'm not a gamer.

It's nearly pure Android 5.1, definitely a plus. A couple of apps added and actually the Blu launcher isn't bad, but I installed the Google launcher.

It's very thin, it weighs 142 grams, it's also a dual SIM phone, I never needed that feature but it's there.

The touchscreen seemed sensitive but there's a setting for low, med and high and I changed it to medium and it seems better.

The phone is also very easy to hold in one hand, although I'm not a good one-hander anyway with phones. It does seem kind of tall and narrow though, not quite 16:9 when you hold it horizontal.

The speaker is in the back and the volume can't be made loud enough for me and conversations are very muffled, which is the biggest disappointment. But people on the other end say it sounds fine.

Battery life is very good, I uninstalled as many apps as I can and I use the mobile website versions, it makes a big difference.

I also uninstalled the home screen wallpaper and am just using pure black on the home screen. I miss not having the announcements that display on the blank screen on the Lumia 640 when it's in sleep mode.

The phone received an update from BLU the second time I turned it on. The only thing I notice is that sometimes if I go to move an icon, the phone won't take a long press, it immediately opens the icon. But if I open some other app, then close it and go back to the home screen, the long press then allows me to move the icon. Not sure what's up with that, I'll keep an eye on it.

I couldn't get the Android "Smart Lock" system to work correctly. This is where you can set it to not require a password when you're at home or a specific location. But it is inconsistent; sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't.

I bought a phone blocking app to block spam nuisance calls; that feature is part of the Windows phone system and it works really well, you don't need an app, it's built in. Also, Google's new Messenger texting app is nowhere near as good as the built-in texting app in the Windows phone. Oh well...

I would have kept it but after a couple of weeks, I just can not live with the sound quality on the BLU Life One X. I like to use the phone on speaker and the speaker on this one sounds so muffled that I have a really hard time understanding what the other person is saying. That's ridiculous, considering the tiny 2 mm single hole on my Lumia 640 had much better and clearer sound.

There's a much wider horizontal opening on the back of the Life One X so the speaker should be much better. BLU needs to work on that and then they'd have pretty much perfection.

I've tried it with and without the sound clarifying feature on and off and it's maybe a tiny bit better with it off. This is really the most disappointing aspect of this phone.

I mean, how hard is it nowadays to include a half-way decent speaker so you can hear a phone conversation? I have to get everyone to repeat about every other sentence, it's really bad.

I didn't want to spend the money, but ordered a Motorola Moto X Pure Edition instead from Amazon, very sorry the BLU phone didn't work out for me because I like everything about it but the sound.

So long story short this is best new Android phone you can buy for 200 or less dollars. It isn't without its flaws but overall for the money it's an amazing phone especially with the help of a few third party apps.

Now the long story... I'll start with the good this screen is beautiful performance over all is pretty good. Lte service here in Philadelphia has been fantastic and I haven't had many complaints about call quality just some light cracking that was more likely the fact I was in a busy street. Battery life is pretty good but will very much depend on  how much you use this pretty screen. Even then I've been averaging about 12-15 hours of moderate use with about 4 to 5 hours of screen on time. I'll also note without quick charging if you use the phone while it's plugged in it barely charges at all. If you leave it alone however it take about 3 hours to completely juice up which isn't too impressive either considering it comes with a 1amp charger.  I did switch to nova launcher for a bit more customization of the home screen. There can be some lag especially when first opening apps especially things like my heavily skinned gosms app. But overall the phone is snappy and an improvement over my 2013 moto x it replaced. The cameras are also a great surprise in a phone on this price range. It's not gunna replace your Dslr or even a top tier phone but for 150 bucks it's damn good especially in the professional mode you can really get some beautiful pictures. Also the smart gestures when the phone is locked to quickly launch the camera and flashlight are absolutely genius and work flawlessly except the. Music one which Now brings us to the bad my first complaint is a double edged one cuz on one hand I credit Blu for including a screen protector and case for the phone in the box. Buttttt...  The screen protector doesnt actually fit and while the included leather case is a nice touch the software that it uses lacks any customization and even in my case it often completely bypassed my phones lock screen.  It does have music controls in the small window but they only work on the stock music player. And while it gives you a small icon for a notification it also brings a pointless screen that rather than reading the notification info just tells you to open  the phone to view. And it doesn't even open to the notification if it's clicked on or opened when on that screen. It just goes to the home screen. It just seems like it was a poorly programmed after throught. Take the leather case off however and you find a pretty vanilla android experience and it was a very easy transition from my moto x. It may just be me or my device but I find the screen to ether be way to sensitive or completely dead.  For example scrolling through a Web page I often accidentally click icons but when using SwiftKey I often have to press the delete key multiple times before it registers. (this may also be due to the skinomi screen protector I applied after finding the included one didn't fit but it that gives the screen a grippy feel I'm not a fan of yet) I also mentioned the music player before that it links with the leather case app but when you don't have the leather case on the music player bar in your notification wimdow just won't go away you have to go into the setting and force quit the app. So like all of the other android  phones I've used over the years I've resorted to power amp which works great. Also for those who want that nifty notification light to actually light up for notification download blink from the app store. Just note the led only displays red and green. And the systems battery led notifications will take precedent over the notifications from blink. Outside of that there is little to complain about in this price range it certainly beats at&t prepaid phones in the price bracket.

My final thoughts I have yet to find a serious problem with this phone other than some of the software should be updated to give you more preferences. A marshmallow update was supposed to come out early this year but as of now I'm still on 5.1 so I'm very interested to see if Blu finally comes through on a phone update. There is certainly a lot of potential and I think with a good marshmallow update battery life could improve greatly I just hope they take some time to fix the leather sheath app cuz it does give the phone a nice feel.
Five stars

Initially I would have given this phone five stars. I've owned it for a little over a month.

After almost a month of use I pulled the phone out of my pocket and noticed a crack across the screen. I thought this was weird, as the phone had been in my possession since I unboxed it. It had never been dropped, or had any any kind of impact whatsoever. A little research revealed that this can happen if the screen is not installed properly or the glass has any internal flaws. When this happens your screen normally won't shatter, instead it gets a hairline crack that usually runs from one edge of the screen to the other. That's exactly what happened to my phone, as you can clearly see in the picture.

So now I got a cracked screen on my phone but I thought "no big deal, it still works" and moved on. Then a week later it appeared to download an upgrade and rebooted, and immediately got stuck in a boot loop. The phone would boot until it reached a screen that said "Android is starting.... optimizing app *** of ***. " It would hang there for a minute and then reboot.... and repeat this until the battery died.

So now I have a cracked screen AND a non-working phone. Still, I though "no biggie, this phone is clearly defective and BLU has a one year warranty. I'm sure they'll stand behind their product and just replace / repair my phone, right?"

WRONG!!!!!!!! I emailed their support team, and got a reply with a phone number. When I called them I spoke to Anthony, a CSR with BLU, who informed me that my warranty was void because the phone was physically damaged. I informed of everything I've said here, and referenced the same picture I've included in this review. he informed that they basically only warranteed software problems (his words, not mine). I replied that is the same thing as not having a warranty, since any defective piece of hardware could be considered physical damage. He apologized, but still refused to consider replacing my phone.

Long story short, this phone worked like a champ for a month, then the screen cracked spontaneously (I believe it was defective) and a week later the phone bricked during an OTA upgrade. BLU refused to replace it.

Maybe this is an isolated case, and BLU makes a great product. However, don't expect them to stand behind it. At all.

BTW. Amazon is awesome. Their customer service department, after learning of my troubles with BLU, refunded my purchase price. I will not be purchasing another BLU phone.

If this phone got Qualcomm quick charging 2.0, it would basically be the perfect phone.  It is currently the only phone in North America that allows you to use 4G LTE data on either sim (though not at the same time of course).  Contrast that with phones like the Zenfone 2 or p8 lite that only allow data on 1 specific sim or cripples the data connection on the secondary sim.  My face is pretty much glued to my smartphone even at work so saying I dislike the battery life is not entirely fair.  If you use your smartphone like an average person, this phone will last you fine throughout the day.  I created a shortcut to the dual sim setting so I can switch data sims fairly quickly when one carrier gets better than the other.  Love it, but keep it secondary to my Zenfone 2 (which disappointingly only allows data on Sim 1 of the 2 sims) that has quick charge 2.0. Got it for 99 and absolutely blown away after owning many flagships

Love everything it comes with, it's a bang for your buck cameras are both great and the front flash comes in very helpful.  Lately though I've been getting this annoying pop up from the Google Chrome app I believe saying I have a virus though I have scanned my phone with various antivirus apps and nothing comes up..

I got this phone to replace a Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime, which I hated.  Before the Grand Prime, I used a Samsung Galaxy Note 4.  While I really like the Note 4, I like this BLU phone better.  The Note 4 has better specs and costs a lot more money, but my BLU is the winner!  BLU also has great customer support.  I had issues with my Cricket Wireless MMS (photo - video messages) and called them.  They were very helpful.  They have earned a loyal customer in me!

For those of you with Cricket Wireless, you will want to know this:  I thought there was a problem with my phone because I could not send or receive picture messages.  I changed my APN settings several times, using various settings I found on here and the internet and none of them would work.  Then I found out that you cannot have WIFI enabled when sending or receiving MMS.  You have to use the connection to Cricket's network (their data).

AGAIN, something everyone with Cricket Wireless will want to know:  MMS will not work for sending or recieving MMS messages if you have WIFI enabled.  WIFI must be turned off to send or receive MMS messages.  If you have WIFI enabled when an MMS message comes in (a photo for example), you will have to disable WIFI in order to download it.

The APN settings for Cricket Wireless are -  Name: Internet -APN: ndo - Proxy: Not Set - Port: Not Set - Username: Not Set - Password: Not Set -Server: Not Set -MMSC: [...]- MMS Port: 80 - MCC: 310 - MNC: 150 - Authentication type: Not Set - APN type: default,mms,supl

My MMS messages (photos, videos, etc.) work just fine with these settings.  The default APN settings when inserting a Cricket Wireless SIM card (MMSC:[...]) should work just as well.

The phone lacks in battery. With moderate use (facebook, watching a few videos, syncing email, etc.) the phone dies after about 12 total hours off the charger. Even on days where it sits idle, the battery gets eaten up by phone idling by 40% and it still dies by 8pm when I take off the charger about 7am. I've turned off wifi, bluetooth, turned the brightness all the way down and every app I can think of to help battery life and it still doesn't even get me through the day.The camera is listed as pretty good MP wise, but it actually takes far worse pictures than the blu life 8 I had previously (which had a lower MP camera). Amazing device overall!

Pros(as of posting): Easy to root,
snappy and responsive,
the touch panel is great,
colors are what you'd expect from an IPS(I can't vouch that's the same for people who aren't red-green colorblind),
great stock ROM,
useful false leather case(optional, comes with a standard backplate),
dual SIM(for those who actually need it),
supports micro-SD card,
Corning Gorilla Glass III,
speakers are loud and clear,
the cameras are a huge improvement from my old mobile device, and so far I have no complaints,
and probably many more that I have not mentioned here!

Cons:
Not very simple to unroot once rooted,
short battery life(so far), compared to my NeuTab G7 phablet,
battery is not removable,
stock OTA update has some issues from what I've noticed(you can update to the latest version from Blu as of posting this),
and probably some more that I have not mentioned here.

For $149.99 this device is entirely worth buying.
If you are wanting something for work and home use-seperation(using the dual-SIM slots) then this device would be ideal.
If you are just needing a phone for basic to semi-advanced needs, then this would probably be a great option(as far as my needs for a mobile device go).
If you are someone who wants to play games, I wouldn't know if this is a great option as I've never tested games on it.
If you are someone who streams videos for long periods of time(1 hour or more) this will probably not be a very good option as the battery drains quite fast when watching YouTube from my testing.
This device works well with Ting as a provider, although I'm not sure if that is relevant.

I would highly recommend this device if what I roughly described above is your average daily use/demand for a mobile device.

Happy shopping!

Regards,
Cole

BLU Life One X - 4G LTE Smartphone - GSM Unlocked - Black
I had high hopes for the BLU Life One X after reading & watching positive reviews from PC Magazine, CNET, Android Authority, Android Police, Android Headlines, Android Guys, Phone Arena, Phone Dog etc. While waiting a month for the phone to arrive; I watched & read every review available. My high expectations were instantly deflated, when I tried to perform the simple task of making a hands free call using my Plantronics Voyager Legend Bluetooth headset to make a call. I pressed the call button on the Bluetooth headset and the voice dialer would not activate on the phone. I made sure that the Google voice setting for using the service with a Bluetooth headset was activated. I went through all the setting to no avail. I gave up and called BLU tech support. I rudely got hung up on, after being told the BLU Life ONE X doesn't support voice dialing with a headset. The following day, I placed another call to Blu tech support for further clarification. This tech support person told me that the BLU LIFE ONE X only supports Bluetooth 2.0 not 4.0. This is false advertising, since all the promo material and reviews state the phone supports Bluetooth 4.0.  Furthermore, I also called Plantronics tech support for confirmation. During the call, I  encountered a more professional customer service rep. He went over all the proper phone settings with me and verified that they were all correct. He determined the problem was with the phone not the headset. I've used the same headset with an LG L70 & Samsung Galaxy Avant and never had any issues. In addition, when just using the handset to make calls, the screen intermittently turns on. I had read previous comments about this on Amazon & confirmed it. It seems the proximity sensor is defective or malfunctions.
This is the first time I stray from buying a brand name phone. I will never make the same mistake again. I am disgusted with all the Android media outlets & Youtubers who sold out by giving positive reviews for a free phone. I find it hard to believe that people who make a living reviewing Android phones, off all price points, didn't notice these basic flaws. Instead of offering consumers a service they performed a disservice. If I could save at least on person from the trouble & disappointment I went through, it will be worth it. At least I only paid $99 for this sorry excuse of a phone. However, I will be returning it for a refund, since I can't comfortably using it for its primary purpose as a phone. All the other bells & whistles (screen resolution, RAM, ROM etc.) are secondary.
In Summary:
Don't believe the Hype!!
Pros:
Can't tell you because the phone didn't fulfill the basic purpose of using the phone hands free with a headset & screen turns on when using the handset.
Cons:
1) False Advertising: Although all the promo material states the BLU LIFE ONE X supports Bluetooth 4.0, according to their tech support currently (1/14/2016) all their phones only support Bluetooth 2.0.
2) Phone doesn't work with Bluetooth headsets.
3) Phone screen turns on while using handset causing you to accidentally press numbers/ characters during a call.
4) Menu settings and options are very limited in comparison to other brand manufacturers. For example, the call setting menu.
6) Battery drains oddly. Within first few minutes of use your down to 90% battery left. Battery standby seems decent.
I really like this phone. It doesn't ask anything from Samsung, Sony or Apple. The camera could be a bit better but it's still good.

The camera is not as good as an iPhone and the speaker is a bit tinny. But for the price this is a fabulous phone. It works well on my AT&T network and the call quality (and volume) is good - which is important as I use this devise first and foremost as a phone. After a couple of full charge cycles, the battery is also working well and easily last me through a day (and up to three days) of use. The screen is sharp and crisp and the build quality is solid.

My only complaint is that I can not get individualized ringtones to work. Although I can set them under contacts, the default ringtone is what comes up for every number. This may possibly be a glitch in the software related to the fact that I have a 64GB card installed (as other reviewers have noted). I'll update if I find a resolution.

Great phone for a ridiculous price. Web browsing and apps are all very fast with no lag at all. The battery lasts me all day, even with me constantly texting and using snapchat. The front-facing flash is nice and the cameras are pretty good. This phone should cost $400 or more. The fit and finish is as good as, if not better than, the Galaxy S6. The back of the Life One X actually feels higher quality when you hold it I think. Also, the screen is amazing. This phone hasn't brought any new features to the table, but what it has done is offer a superb experience for a ridiculous price. I would recommend it for anyone who doesn't want to spend $900 for a new IPhone but still wants most of the great features of a flagship phone. I'm running this on AT&T and it's worked great so far.
Everything was OK. Thanks

Wow, for the price, really can't complain about anything. I have always bought phones through my wireless carrier and ended up paying $400 or $500 over 2 years...I'd had enough of that! Also in addition to having poor life it takes about 4 hours to fully charge. With this phone expect to spend half your day sitting by a wall outlet. The phone gets very hot during moderate use, and the colors are slightly off.. they do look vivid, but in an off kinda way.

Lastly, my overall experience with Amazon was also terrible. They charged almost $7 for shipping and still took over a week to arrive. As a reference, I bought a Dell computer last month online. Dell did not charge shipping, and was able to get my laptop withing 48 hours. Bought it on Monday and had it by Wednesday.

It takes forever to charge and recently draIned even while plugged in.  I have owned many android phones and dropped them more times than I can count and never saw a scratch. The screen on this phone is extremely fragile.  If it is in fact gorilla glass,  it is very poor quality.  I did a lot of research before buying this phone.  I decided to try this new company. Very good phone for the price.
In general, the device perform very good in general tasks like videos, web browsing and other common apps, as good as a Samsung Galaxy S5 Active, a LG G4 Beat or a Sony Xperia Z1. The performance in games is average like a HTC S728e One X. (Source and comparison scores from futuremark.com)
The screen quality is good, not as good as a galaxy or a nexus but still impressive for the price.
One vey nice feature is the flash of the frontal camera, for people who takes selfies at night, or with low light, is very convenient and useful. Also the camera app itself has a few very useful modes for taking the right picture at the right time.
FM radio is a nice to have. A led color notification indicator is very welcome, is similar to the one in the Galaxy S5.
Audio is good, not great.

If you want a good phone for a good price, this is it.

The included flip view case (which the display responds to very well) is s a nice bonus, slim (it replaces the phone back) and looks good.

Purchased this phone several weeks ago.  It's taken some time to get it set up properly with email, etc.  Was able to transfer contacts from my old phone using an app from the store. I ordered one from Amazon when I ordered the phone but is was cancelled for some reason.  Ordered another that's supposed to be here March 10. I tried the flip cover provided for a while, but just didn't feel comfortable when texting,  etc. So far so good. Hopefully it will last for a few years.  A good alternative so far to other overpriced options.

Keyboard is slow to register input. Power button came off after 3 weeks, and Blu wants me to pay shipping to have it repaired.
Do not buy. Lousy product and less than stellar customer service.

When I first heard about this phone I thought it was great; great look and great price for someone on a budge. I checked on Amazon and discovered that there was a two week waiting period between ordering and delivery before I can actually get the phone. I bought the phone nonetheless and decided to wait since I had another phone that I could use though, it was not 100% functional.

I finally got the phone in January 2016 and it looked and felt great. I was glad that I had made the purchase. The construction felt sturdy and the metal body and slim design, plus its features just made the phone feel like a premium phone. Unfortunately though, less than a month after receiving it, it suddenly went dead. It was being charged and I had to put it down to take care of some other matters. When I returned to the phone, it was completely blank and dead. I tried turning it on and nothing.

I figured the battery was really drained, although I didn't know how or why, so I went to bed that night and plugged the phone in to charge hoping that by morning it would come back to life. I got up during the night and tried turning the phone on again and nothing. Tried again when it was day light and nothing. I then tried several other chargers other than the one that came with the phone to see perhaps if it was the charger that was at fault and still nothing.

At this point I was getting frustrated. I tried a local technicia who said it might be the battery, but that meant that I would have to source a brand new battery for a brand new phone. In addition, the phone has a tag that says if the battery is removed or tampered with, you void the warranty on the phone.

 I contacted Blu's customer service and they sent me a list of this that I should check or do and I followed them to the T.....and the phone was still unresponsive. I sent back a response to the Blu Customer Service, to the advice they gave and  all I received back was what I got when I contacted them in the first place asking for proof of purchase of the phone and some other things.

After all that, I decided to put the phone back into its box and leave it for a couple days. When I returned to it...there was a funny scent coming from the phone. I opened the back cover of the phone and upon examination saw what looked like spots of some liquid or substance and a strong odour, which I would assume is as a result of the battery being corrupted. I eventually got rid of the phone.

All in all this was a waste of money and I am very disappointed. This may not be the experience of everyone and I am not sure if this has happened to anyone else, but this was my first Blu product, and it is highly unlikely that I will be buying another one.

I used the Wifi hotspot as soon as the phone was activated and it worked well. I used my wifi hotspot for my wife's phone until her phone was up and running with no issues. Very little bloatware. Had the phone for 6 weeks and the battery completely stopped working. I've used the enclosed charger since purchase and the battery has continued to decline to the point the phone is now unusable. I had my settings correct, display turned down, screen shut off after 15 seconds, etc. Two days ago it wouldn't charge past 40% after being on the charger for 12 hours. Unplugged and within 1 hour and zero use it was down to 20%. One hour later after using for about 5 minutes, it completely shut off. Plugged in phone for 4 hours and it wouldn't even turn on. Left it plugged in about 3 hours longer, finally got it to turn on and it had 4% battery life. I was able to do a factory reset, plugged the phone back in to charge. Two hours later, couldn't turn it on, it was dead again. It's draining every time it's plugged in and feels warm to the touch. My husband has the exact same phone and I've tried his charger with no changes. I'm obviously past my 30 day refund window for Amazon. I've just submitted a service request to BLU, so we shall see. I'm highly disappointed since we had BLU phones before this model that worked perfectly for over two years. We decided to upgrade to something newer and supposedly better. Now, I feel I'm out $150. Hopefully my husband's doesn't go out too, as we cannot afford to purchase phones again. I loved the phone in the beginning, I wish I could still love it. Hopefully BLU will hold up their standards and help rectify the situation. If so, I'll be happy to update my review.

The moment I received this device in the mail and opened the package, I knew right away I made a good purchase. The BLU Life One X is an astonishing work of art. Beautifully crafted from Corning 3 Gorilla Glass, supposedly aircraft aluminum, and a plastic back cover that looks and feels like leather. In the hand it feels every bit as premium as a smartphone that costs 4 or 5 times more. Aesthetically speaking, the device is outstanding. And spec wise, it is equally as appeasing. With a 1.3 GHZ Octa-core processor, 2 GB of RAM, 13 MP Main Camera, 5 MP front facing camera, along with a Flash for both, it's a wonder how they were able to pack all of this value into such a low cost device.  The phone itself also holds 16 GB's of storage, which can also be expanded using a Mini SD card up to 64 GB's. Even in the storage settings, you can set it up so that all your app data and the like can be stored on the Mini SD card.
  I would go into more detail, But I have run out of time for now. Still, the phone gets an easy 5 stars from me. You will not regret purchasing this.

I impulse bought the black Blu Life One X on Dec 11, 2015 when it was on sale for $99.99 here on Amazon, sight unseen.  This phone is snappy fast, has beautiful thin and light design, and high hardware spec for such a very low price.  It scored 37,209 on Antutu Benchmark v6.0.1, which is slightly faster than phones with Snapdragon 615 SoC.  I like this phone a lot and agree with most of the positive reviews people posted here.

The reason I gave it 3 stars instead of 5 is because I found that the time on the clock widgets I use most often (Digital Clock Xperia, Timely, and UCCW) does not update on this phone even though they work fine on all 12 of my other Android phones, all with Snapdragon SoCs.  Could this be due to incompatibility with this phone's Mediatek  MT6753 SoC?  Don't know, but this is the only Mediatek phone I have so maybe you readers can tell me if they work on your other Mediatek MT6753 devices.  What other incompatibilities does this phone have that I don't yet know about?  Thus the 3 stars.

I loved this phone.  It had everything I wanted (and needed) in a cellphone.  Battery lasted very long time (for first 3 month), then I started noticing that it would only last for a day, then 3/4 of a day, then 1/2 a day.  Today I found it trying to optimize 172 apps in a continuous loop; it would turn off and on, try to optimize the apps again, turn off and on again. Sometimes it would just stay off until I powered it back up.  It did this for 12 hours before I gave up.  Phone is now USELESS.  I will say this, it's a great phone if you need one temporarily (ie going on vacation or need one overseas for a couple months) but for your day-to-day cellphone, its been a GREAT DISAPPOINTMENT.  I wish you knew HOW frustrated I am at the moment.  I wish I could get new phone from the company with the hope that this one was a lemon because I really loved this phone.  My fear now is that the same will happen in another month to the three other ones I bought for friends... I'll be so embarrassed it theirs does the same.

UPDATE: I just opened up the case, unscrewed those tiny screws and pulled out the internal battery.  The battery feels like a pack of gum in aluminum foil.  It pliable, not rigid. I'm not an expert on cellphones but every phone I ever owned used HARD, RIGID batteries and not a gummy bear type (perhaps other can comment on whether that is normal).

I've been using this for almost three months now with AT&T and SIMs from Globe and Smart (Philippine Telecoms) and so far no issues. The battery lasts longer than my Samsung S6 Edge Plus which kinda surprised me. But that's where the comparison ends. For a power user, this phone does lag and sometimes cannot catch up when multitasking. At times it even crashes and I have to reboot. Can't really compare a flagship phone to a budget one, but that's needless to say.

Otherwise, for general purpose use, this phone shines. I have never had a phone with a screen that never collected 'oil' from your fingertips. You can  wipe off the screen and no smudges or fingerprint streaks (for those who are OCD about these kinds of things like me). I don't know what coating they put on it but I wish they did this for every phone out there.

Bought the phone when it first came out so it was around $100 and to me, this has been the best BLU phone I have bought and used. It was money well spent. I usually donate smartphones to underprivileged teachers, but this one I am keeping for myself.

One wish... I wish BLU would make an X version 2 and put a really good camera in it and it would make this phone pretty close to awesome.

I went from a nexus 4 to this phone. The phone seemed nice at first. After a couple of days I noticed flaky screen response to typing. Sometimes not recording a touch or recording a double touch. Speaker could be better. Battery could be a little better, seemed to drain a little faster than it should.
Another issue is that the phone doesn't support added users. It's blocked. Older and current version of Android would allow you to create added users. I normally create a guest account to only allow them to make phone calls and another for my kids to only play a few games. I contacted Blu support and they said it's not supported on the device.
I am returning it today due to the issues listed above.

The phone i received first had the following issues
-The battery takes forever to charge, one time it took almost 3 hours to get to 6% and that was with wifi and bluetooth turned off and very limited use (just a few texts here and there)
-The screen occasionally becomes unresponsive and i have to lock then unlock it for it to respond to touch
-There is an intermittent dead spot in the top left corner of the screen
-It wont send or receive photos via text even with good 4G LTE
-It occasionally sends repetitive texts, one time sent the same message 14 times
-least concerning is the fact that you cant set custom ringtones which is annoying
I think the one i got is a lemon, I've had the phone a week with these issues only because i wanted to see if i liked the phone enough to try a replacement or if i just wanted to send it back and find something else. I did request a replacement tonight and i'm hoping it will not have these issues as well, i will give an update when the new one gets here.
**update**
I've had the replacement for 3 days and it's wayyy better, I definitely received a lemon the first time. The battery is much better, in comparison to other smart phones it still charges pretty slow but it has lasted through the day with moderate use.
I'm still having issues with not being able to send or receive pics via text but after much research I've found its an issue between Blu and cricket wireless concerning the APN. I've tried changing the APN numerous times with no luck, they could not figure it out at the Cricket store either. To get technical for anyone considering this phone for cricket, the apn type does not have the option of "fota" or "hipri" which to my understanding is causing the issues. Apparently some have figured out how to fix it but I haven't been successful with any of their methods yet, will try for a little bit longer but if I can't get it to send or receive pics via text it's going back.
Overall I really like the phone it's a wonderful budget phone with amazing features, the front flash is great, not sure why all phones these days don't have one. Both cameras take really good pictures (once I realized there was a little clear plastic thing I needed to remove from rear camera lol)  There isn't much bloatware, I was a little disappointed in only a 16gig memory but that's not a big deal with a micro SD. I haven't noticed any lag even with 15++ things open.

The phone itself is a great budget phone, however, the battery only lasted a couple months until it obtained a somewhat common battery drainage issue. Ordering another battery is a hassle and is one fifth the price of the phone. I have had to turn my back up phone on for $50 and then I continued payments on my Blu phone expecting the battery to arrive within a week or two. Wasting a lot of money is not fun, and I am disappointed in the company.

Performance is diappointing. It play demanding games fine but I experienced constant lags and freezes. The UI just isn't fluid and compared to my previous phone, the htc desire 510, it is nowhere as responsive. Lag can be seen especially when I pull down the notification tray. It stutters and lags for at least 1 second whenever I pull it down. I am pretty sure it's software issue because this phone has better specs than my old 510. Blu needs to fix this issue

Battery leaves much more to be desired. Average screen on time I can pull off is 4 hours on medium setting. I am a heavy user and when screen is on, i usually play games like mortal x kombat and watch HD videos i downloaded or browsing chrome. Strangely, I never have slow charging speed many users complained. My phone is 90+ in just under 3 hours. Battery is about 60+ in 1.5 hours. When I plug it onto a battery bank, it charges even faster, no complaint there. Battery life is still too short tho. Furthermore, I occasionally experienced a wakelock bug wich drains battery when idle. When this happens, the wake bar on the battery statistics is one solid bar. I have to maunlly reboot to fix this.

Now lets talk about the software. Besides the occasional lag, wakelock, and unresponsiveness I already mentioned, the operating system has tons of issues. Uninstalling an app sometimes just hang. Sometimes, when i download apps from the play store, it's the same story, download just hangs and make little progress. I try to clear the data, guess what? The app hangs on computing the size. Battery wakelock also usually begins at this point so I believe these buggy install/uninstall are behind the wakelock issue.

Final note, buy the vivo xl. This phone is too buggy and battery is just medicore. 1080p screen doesnt compensate the shorter battery life and lower screen to body ratio.

Operating system is junk. Alarms won't sound even though they are listed in operating system as "alarms are always priority interruptions." Haptic feedback doesn't work if phone is on vibrate, only if phone is on sound. Just a super buggy OS. Forget about customer support too! I contacted them about the no haptic feedback, they sent me a "response" saying I should clear the app cache...ummm, the app cache to the entire OS? Seriously minimal effort on BLU's part putting together a half-functional device. I would avoid this phone. It's honestly not worth the $149.

I love mobile tech. I am especially interested in the emerging mid-market smartphones. I was excited to test this model. At $150, it offers real value. It's thin and light and has solid build quality, offers a bright 1080p full HD display, offers dual SIM support, has expandable memory, and runs near stock Android. The MediaTek processor is snappy and the battery lasts throughout the day. (I should say that I used the phone for calls, email, web surfing, reading books, and Netflix. I didn't try games.)

Even though the phone has some great features, it has some serious limitations. The battery is extremely slow to charge. I clocked it taking 3-4 minutes to change by 1 percent. The external speaker doesn't produce much volume. The camera isn't good indoors. Photos are dark, and the phone lacks image stabilization, so photos blur easily. But the biggest problem--and the reason I returned the phone--is the proximity sensor. It seems too sensitive, or perhaps not sensitive enough. During calls, I could see the screen flashing on and off in my peripheral vision. When the screen came on, my cheek would touch the speaker phone or mute button and interrupt the call. After a few days of this, I boxed up the phone and returned it.

This is a good-looking phone at a great price, but because it can't make calls reliably, I have to give it a poor rating. It's too bad. I really wanted to believe BLU had delivered a breakthrough phone.

I have been researching this device for a few months since I have been using the same smartphone for the past 3 years and ready for an upgrade.  I bought the BLU Life One X (2016) to replace my AT&T Galaxy S4.  The S4 cost me $649 in May of 2013 when it was first released.  Since then it has been falling behind in performance as newer, faster devices were released at a rapid pace.  Now that I am on a cheaper plan with my provider I no longer get periodic "free" upgrades, so price is a huge factor in my device shopping now.  I must say I am very pleased with this device and thought I would provide some information to anyone else looking.

Look and Feel:
This is an area in which I think most budget phones are lacking.  I have handled some other low cost devices and they really do look and feel exactly like you would expect.  The Life One X however has a premium feel to it, has nice contoured edges and the touchscreen is beveled along the sides giving it a very refined look.  Plus it utilizes Gorilla Glass 3, which will help it to last longer with regular use.  This phone is beautifully designed, and is definitely not something anyone would hide in their pocket when people with their more expensive devices are around.

Screen size and resolution:
Another common place for budget phones to save money is on the screen.  Cheap phones typically have small touchscreen and low resolution.  Not this one, though.  The Life One X has a full 1080 x 1920 resolution on a 5.2" screen with 424 ppi pixel density, which is about 25% better than the iPhone 6. The screen also has very rich display which is very customizable. It is definitely a bigger device than the Galaxy S4, but not heavier and fits well in my hand for one-handed use.

Performance and operation:
This is another area that BLU has nailed.  Even though it has a slower 1.3 GHz clock speed, that comes on an 8-core processor.  This is great with multitasking and this device handily outperforms the higher clock speed 4-core processors in benchmark tests like Antutu.  The 1.3 GHz processor is also easier on the battery, and I noticed even during heavy usage the phone did not get hot.  The Android ROM that runs on this phone is very nice.  It is very close to stock Android 5.1 Lollipop, with very few changes built into it. If you like Android, you will like this interface.  As an Android power user, I was a little disheartened that it is not easily rooted, but this is not a deal-breaker for the vast majority of users.

Battery Life:
It comes with a 2900 mAh battery, with is more than sufficient for regular use.  After a couple days of use, I get about 6 hours of screen-on time before the battery dies.  If you have the screen on for more than 6 hours a day, you'll probably need a bigger battery or plug it in more frequently.  That being said, I consider myself a fairly heavy user and I don't come even close to 6 hours of screen time on a daily basis.

Overall:
I must say I am very impressed and pleased with this device.  You would have to look into phones that cost at least twice as much before you find one that is clearly better.  For $150, you cannot find a better phone, period. Honestly I don't know how BLU is making any money on this device, given the quality that has been put into this.  This may not be a flagship killer, but for anyone on a budget the BLU Life One X is clearly the phone to get.

Updated to add:
I would recommend wiping the cache partition from the stock recovery menu. A few days after getting the phone I had trouble with it no longer turning off Wifi and not going into sleep mode. This would drain the battery very quickly.  After the cache wipe, which it goes to sleep almost immediately after powering off the screen and the battery life is amazing. I have only had to do this once, but if you notice in your battery stats that the phone is constantly awake or that Wifi is staying on even when disabled, then it would be time to do it again.  I am pretty sure this is a common problem with Android Lollipop.

Also, use the included charger.  It charges from almost dead to 100% within 2 hours.  Cheap aftermarket chargers or low amp chargers from other phones will take 4-6 hours to charge.

I am writing this review having upgraded to this phone from a "Samsung Galaxy Exhilarate", which is more or less a rebranded Galaxy SII. (Disclosure: I am not marked as a verified owner of this product, because I received this as a gift from a friend)

It boots very quickly. As soon as you see the lock screen, the phone is responsive. The SD card is mounted quickly too, allowing you to immediately use apps and files that are stored on the SD card. One thing in particular that I enjoyed about this compared to my previous phone, is that the entire internal storage space is all one partition, and references made to the "sd card" truly mean the external SD card you've installed to the phone - my previous phone had two partitions of internal storage, one of which was seen as the "sd card". Their small and identical sizes made it difficult to install larger apps, and this has been a non-issue on this device. In fact, this phone allows you to choose whether the internal storage or the SD card is the default install space for apps, so you don't need to muck about with rooting it or using developer options and a PC to configure that.

As a phone, it works great. Calls are audible and clear, and the other party can hear me just fine when using this. The external speaker (which is used for the speaker phone) is of particularly low quality. It feels too loud at low to moderate settings, and when you really need it to be louder, turning the volume up only seems to add distortion instead of actually making it louder. This isn't a huge problem for use in quiet or moderately noisy environments, but you will need to skip out on using the speakerphone for making phone calls and using headphones in noisier places if you actually wanna hear anything.

Both cameras are nice. The front facing 'selfie' cam is lower resolution, but in terms of picture fidelity, they come out pretty good. There are other reviews out there which show you pictures taken with both cameras, as well as this phones performance with a variety of games, so I wont go in-depth with those here.

The phone comes with a set of in-ear headphones. They are acceptable quality; their bass response is good, but it seems to come at the expense of the mid and high ranges. Mids sound flat and the highs are tinny. To be honest, a separate pair I own that only cost me a few bucks sound nicer than these. But the pack-ins do have a built-in microphone for phone calls and apps like skype, and has a button you can press which serves different functions (muting your mic in voip apps, skipping to the next song in music players, etc.). The convenience factor of the built-in mic and ease of use has me using the pack-in over some nicer sounding aftermarket headphones.

The screen protector is....okay. It's supposed to be sized to perfectly match the phone, but it's actually too small. It uses an adhesive backing to stick to the phone, which dust was immediately attracted to, my protector has dust trapped in it which has made the touch screen slightly less responsive, and at certain angles, the slight bubble caused by the dust reflects light and can be a little distracting.

They give you a 'case', too. It is made specifically for this phone and replaces the battery cover. It feels nice and doesn't make the phone feel too much bulkier than it already is, so it still slides nicely into my pocket. There's a magnet built into the front flap which holds the case closed when you're not using the phone, and the phone is set up to detect when the case is closed, too. You can still view the time/date and use music player controls when the case is folded shut, and it wont pocket dial on you in this mode, which is quite nice. One drawback to it; I prefer to hold my phone in landscape mode so I can type with both thumbs at the keyboard. Flipping the case back on itself to hold it like this doesn't seem to be intended, it creases it in a seemingly unnatural way, and the magnet wont hold the case shut for a few minutes afterwards. Maybe it just needs to be flexed back and forth? I dunno.

It's a great value for the money. I resisted upgrading to smart phones as long as I could, because for the longest time, there were only $600+ iPhones. Even with Android being on the market, phones were still priced at $300+ a pop, unless you purchased them used. It's nice to see that a company like BLU has recognized the gap in the market and is supplying a modern smartphone running a recent version of Android at this price range. There isn't anything a more expensive phone can do that I can't live without, and I am perfectly happy using it and recommending this to others.

A very nice and stylish phone in an affordable price range. I got the white one and it looks very similar to iphone. The case is not the usual one, it is very stylish folio case with window feature. You have to open the back cover and put the case on.
The phone comes with one of the latest version of android (5.1 Lollipop) with 4G LTE capability which is almost unexpected at this price range WOW!! As usual BLU provides dual sim slots and also expandable memory which is nice to have. The battery power is also higher (2900 mah) than the similar range phones. Moreover the phone has a nice set of gesture and motion capabilities which some of the premium phones also don't have, like double tap on the screen to wake up, write the letter m in sleep mode to directly go to music player or type the letter c to directly go to camera etc,etc.
The camera of the phone is also above standard and worth mentioning, it has 13 mp rear and 5 mp front camera with flash for selfie (this are camera specs of premium phones!!). I would say the phone is a pleasure to use and nothing to complain at this price range.

Now I am not sure if reducing one star makes sense but I wish I get some of these features:
Fingerprint reader which has become very common nowadays.
NFC
Super AMOLED screen
Step detector or step counter
Better speaker

Other than these above few expectation I am totally enjoying the phone.

I had read in reviews when I was considering purchasing this phone.  I assumed it was a fluke or a user issue.  I have learned that it is not.  There are now more reviews indicating the problem and now mine has been added to them.

On top of this feature not working like other cell phones on the market, when I call Blu Support, the Support Rep indicated to me that this is how their phones are designed to work!!!  Unbelievable.  I tried several times to explain to the rep the issue and how is contrary to how every other cell phone works, she refused to budge, saying, "That is how our phone is designed.  We don't have a setting to change that."

I tried to get my call escalated, to talk to someone beyond Tier 1 support, but never got there.  I asked about their return policy and was told that it is 1 year for manufacturing or software defects.  I told her that I consider this a manufacturing or software defect.

Until they get this issue fixed, I would STRONGLY discourage ANYONE from buying this phone.

Beyond this one bug, I think it is a solid phone.

I'm stunned at how good this phone is for the price. My last two phones (Samsung Galaxy S4 and Alcatel Onetouch Idol 3) were dogs compared to this. I'm an avid hiker and when I hike, I like to track my trip (MapMyHike) and listen to music via bluetooth headphones and DSub. Of course I occasionally stop to take a picture too. The S4 and Idol 3 really struggled with this. Music would skip, taking a panorama would sometimes kill my apps (including losing my recorded GPS track). This phone handles these tasks without a single hiccup. Music streams perfectly and taking pictures while recording GPS and streaming music is no problem. This kinda makes sense based on the Geekbench multi-core scores. Single core among all 3 phones was similar but multi-core on this phone was twice as good, so this phone is good at multi-tasking.

The phone is also snappy AF. My last two phones would often slow down and just draaaaaag for no reason. This phone is quick and has almost no lag (so far). Navigation loads quickly and "OK google" works quickly. The camera is great, just as good as any phone I've used (it's probably not as good as the latest flag ship but it's also 25% of the cost).

The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because there's a couple minor quirks that hinder it. First, the battery drains extremely fast after I unplug it from the AC adapter after an overnight charge. I've found that if I reboot the phone after I unplug it, the battery life is GREAT (another user found that disabling the power saving from the notification drop-down, then immediately re-enabling it seems to have the same effect). I can easily go all day running multiple apps, GPS tracking, Bluetooth, music, etc. Just today I've recorded 2 hiking trips, streamed music, took pictures, surfed the web, and I still have 44% battery and it's almost bed time.

The other minor annoyance is that the proximity sensor doesn't work very well, and the screen will often turn on while I'm on the phone with the phone up to my ear. So far it hasn't been an issue for me but I've heard of other people accidentally hanging up the call because the screen was on and they unknowingly hit the end-call button. I usually use the phone via a Bluetooth headset so this isn't a big issue for me.

So, other that the couple small issues, I LOVE this phone, and plan on using it as my daily driver for some time.

It does not.

After trying all different imei/meid converters, calling Straight Talk, using the Straight Talk online chat option, using BOTH imei's on the phone, NOPE.  It is not compatible with the Straight Talk network. Booo!! I was so looking forward to using this phone.

My three star rating is for the misrepresentation of the phone's lack of capability to be put on a network that the product info says it is compatible with, not for the phone itself.  I only was able to play with the phone for a few hours as I reset it and packaged it back up after exhausting all attempts at getting it activated.  So, yay!! I really wanted to like the Blu Life One X and I have not been disappointed.  I did a lot of research pre-purchase since this would be my first "post-Blackberry" device after 9-years of straight Blackberry use.

First of all, the device looks and feels like a premium device.  The screen is AWESOME - bright and sharp. So far everyone i have shown it to cannot believe I only paid 150$ for it. It is not heavy at all, but also is not too lite as to feel cheap. Build quality seems very good.  It is also very slim and fits nicely in my hand.  I was afraid that the 5.2" screen would be too big, but it is not.  This is however the maximum size i'd get since I like having my phone in my pants pocket.

Battery life is very good.  To those that are getting bad battery life, make sure you do the update and also disable the location setting. (GPS) I am not a heavy user and get close to 2 days of use on a single charge.  A heavy user can easily make it through the day.  Charging time is indeed on the slow side as some have pointed out, but if you are like me and charge it every night you will have no issues with this at all.

I have noted no lag or sluggishness. Performance is very good.  Android 5.1 is probably 90% stock. I also have a Nexus 7 tablet so felt quite at home with the Life One X environment.

The dual-SIM feature is really nice to have.  I am getting 4G LTE no problem at all. Since device storage is only 16gig, I suggest you also pick up a 32 or 64 gig MicroSD card with your Amazon order. There is a 3rd slot for a MicroSD card so it will not take up one of the 2 SIM slots as it does on some other devices.

Some people have said the speaker is bad.  OK ... its not fantastic, but for your morning alarm and hands-free conversations it does the job just fine. The sound is sort of "tinny".  If you want to listen to music with it, then you may be disappointed.  My advise: with the money you saved over an iPhone, pick up a nice Bluetooth speaker to pair with the Life One X.  I read a few times that people were not able to put their own custom ringtone. For some reason the process is not that straight forward, but I was able to put my own ringtone fairly easily.  What you need to do is put the file on the phone into the folder where your music is.  Then, when you go to the area where you select your ringtone, chose "more ringtones" near the top and chose to find it with the music app.  You will then see your mp3 ringtone and can select it.

In conclusion, I am very happy with my purchase and my research was spot on.  This phone is easily worth the 150$ price tag and I recommend it.

This is my 2nd BLU, and so far, I'm either really lucky, or it's just a damn good product. Having previously owned the Life 8, the Life One X is just another step up.
-The system is fast, incredibly consistent, and very responsive, with decent standalone storage & solid, reliable connectivity across all ports.
-The camera is great, the screen is vibrant and clear, and casting/streaming/playback doesn't bog anything down.
-The interface is comfortable & simple, and similar to my Life 8.
-My only issue (just due to me being a total tone snob) is the audio. It's loud enough, but output is kind of muddy at any level; whether via speaker or connected to another audio source.
In all, I'm very satisfied, and I've recommended not only this device, but other BLU products to friends & clients.

Having switched from a much older Android, I am enjoying the new platform.  The design of this phone is excellent - sturdy, slim, and attractive.  Great images picture-wise.  Clear and sharp screen resolution.  Sound is good - not great, but good.  I do think having the speakers on the front rather than the bottom would be better.  The dual sim card feature is very helpful if you travel as you can have an international and local one installed at the same time and can choose between the two.
nice mobile

Coming from the 2014 Moto G, I ordered three of these phones for the family during the initial $99 offer. I was leery of the purchase as this is a new product and didn't have many reviews at the time. I was concerned while waiting for my phone to arrive as I read some negative reviews about battery (more on that later), wifi connectivitiy, bluetooth issues. I have not experienced any problems with wifi/bluetooth on my 3 phones. Note that I am using my phones on AT&T.
Pros:
-The screen is beautiful, though the curved glass might limit the number of cases and screen covers
-Build quality is great. All three of my phones have great fit and finish. Feels much more expensive. The flip case that comes with it is not my style so I am hoping for some third party cases. The phone feels great in the hand.
-Speed is great. I haven't noticed any lag. I don't game. Definitely faster than my Moto G
-Phone call quality is good. I haven't noticed any difference between it and my Moto G
-Mostly stock Android. You can delete whatever apps you don't want. Also, if you don't like the launcher, change it. Etc.
Some nice features that my G did not have-smart gestures and smart wake.

Cons:
-Yes, the phone does take a while to charge. But not a LOT longer than my Moto G. It might take 3.5 hours to charge fully. I tend to charge every night so it doesn't bother me.
-Rear speaker is definitely not as good as the front facing stereo speakers on my Moto G. But, it is function-able. Not being a gamer or movie watcher on my phone, this doesn't bother me much. And I rarely play music without hooking up to speakers.
-As noted by others, below 10% of battery and the battery does tick down every 30 seconds until it is dead. So, 10% of battery=5 minutes of life left. This was almost a dealbreaker for me but you shouldn't allow your phone to drop that low anyways so I'm not going to knock it too much for that.

Now, the big issue that almost made me return the phone yesterday: BATTERY. On the first day of use the battery was dropping like a rock. Even when the phone was not in use it was losing 5-10% per hour. According to the battery monitor "Phone Idle Time" was the main consumer of my battery's power. By a TON. So today I decided to download an app to check what was going on and it appeared as though "Held Awake" was consuming much of the power even though the phone was off. I shut off wifi, bluetooth, etc. trying to conserve. Then thought that perhaps Google was the culprit. I turned off Google Now Cards and recharged to 100%. 9 hours later I am still at 80%. I like Google Now Cards, but not enough to plug in my phone every 4 hours. Initially, I thought that Now Cards were "waking" my phone and draining the battery. However, after a few more days use it seems the battery is getting better. Perhaps the phone just needed to cycle through a few charges, but it is a powerhouse now. All day and still have 60+% later in the evening. Currently thrilled with the performance of this phone.

I received the Blu Life One X 4 days ago and have been testing it out. I recently had a ZTE ZMAX (another budget phone) that cost me around the same price as this one. These are my thoughts on the phone:

Build and Size:
The phone is nice and feels very sleek. I purchased the white version and it looks beautiful. The back cover feels nice. I absolutely love the golden edges of the phone, it looks good with the white. This is actually a very thin phone and comparing it to an iphone 6s, it is almost as thin. However, it is bigger than an iphone 6s. I actually thought it was going to be too big for my small hands, but I think it is a perfect size. Overall, the phone does not feel or look cheap at all. I have gotten compliments on this phone and when I tell them the price, they are in shock. This phone looks like it costs more than it does.

Performance:
The performance is great.I have not experienced any lag on this phone. I have a 32gb sd card that is almost full installed on this phone and it has not made the phone lag. I have not tried any games on this phone, so I can’t say how well it performs in that area, but all other apps work great. I have a ton of apps installed and there is no lag at all. I have a Tmobile sim card in this phone and 4g works great. Calls, texts, MMS, and data usage is great on this. No problems at all in that area.

Screen:
The screen is my favorite part of this phone. Has a resolution of 1080 x 1920 pixels. It is crisp and clear. Watching videos on this phone is great and compared to my ZTE Zmax, which had a lower resolution (720 x 1280 pixels), the screen is beautiful to me. The colors are rich and vivid. The brightness on this phone is wow. Not sure if this would be a con for some people, but this phone is super bright on the highest brightness setting. On the lowest setting, it is still pretty bright. The screen also has good viewing angles. One thing though, like others have mentioned, the screen does not register you touch or swipes sometimes. That doesn’t bother me, but some might find it annoying.

Battery:
The battery is okay. Coming from a ZTE Zmax that had a battery of 3400mAh and used to last me almost a whole full day of use (heavy usage and lasted about 17 hours), the BLU life one X is somewhat a letdown (for me anyways). Yes I know the battery on this phone is 2900 mAh, but the most it had lasted me, with heavy usage from 100% to almost dying, was about 8 hours. Yeah that is pretty good for others, but for me, not really. I guess I just have to get used to it. However, sometimes when I am not even using it, the battery drops quickly. I always make sure to close all apps, clear cache, and what not. I feel like I am constantly charging this phone. My old phone only had to be charged every other day. I do the same things on this phone that I did on my old phone.

Call Quality:
The call quality is decent. I am able to hear the other person, not super clear, but it is fine. One thing though, off topic here, but when you are talking to someone and you have the phone pressed to your face, the screen turns on sometimes. This causes you to press random buttons with your face.

Speaker:
I honestly expected the speaker to be horrible, like some reviews have mentioned. It is not terrible, but it is not good either. It is not the loudest, but I think you can still hear things with no problem. I installed an app called Speaker Boost that makes the volume a lot louder. It really makes a difference, but the sounds sometimes sounds distorted if too loud.

Camera:
I have a love/hate relationship with the cameras on this phone. I have uploaded pictures for this review that show how the pictures it takes look like. Also, some comparisons between this and my ZTE ZMAX.
-What I love:
The 13 mp camera takes great pictures in the daylight. The front facing camera takes better pictures than my old phone (8mp camera). The LED flash makes front facing pictures look better. I adore that it has a front flash.
-What I hate:
The main camera does not focus. Apparently it has Phase Detection Autofocus, but not on my camera. If you get close to something and want to focus, it will not focus at all. Also, pictures come out blurry and multiple attempts at taking a picture have to be done. In low light, pictures aren’t that great. The front facing camera adds a soft effect, making pictures look bad. I have tried everything to fix that, but the only remedy is using the LED Flash to add more sharpness to the picture.

Comparing BLU’s camera to my ZTE ZMAX, there were times when the ZTE did a better job than the BLU. Now, both phones cost about the same. I am not sure if anyone else has problems with the camera, but maybe mine is defective? I guess I shouldn’t complain for $150, but it is sad that an 8mp camera is just as good as Blu’s 13mp.

Overall, I think this is a great phone for anyone on a budget. If you don’t care too much for the camera and if you aren’t a heavy user, then this is a great phone to get. It gets the job done and it is a beautiful phone. I will keep on using it and hopefully things get better with future updates (if they ever release updates). For the price, it is well worth it.

This is my first ever review for an Amazon purchased item.

I purchased this phone as a backup to my Samsung Note 4, again not a replacement, just to back it up. If you're reading this then you probably already know plenty about this phone so I won't give you a spec rundown, just my real world use of this phone for 3 weeks.

First I'll start with the good. The screen is beautiful like many others have stated. It's crisp, it's clear, and viewing angles are good. Pictures and video look great so no problems there. I'm not a big gamer buy it seemed to handle them pretty well. Games like need for speed, the walking dead, and sim city played fine, although it did seem impossible to make purchases on sim city even on WiFi(you have to be quick in order to beat the other players to a purchase). Battery life held up all day and longer, but it would lose power rather quickly after unplugging every morning, easily dropping to the mid 90s after using the phone to scroll through headlines and emails. Expandable memory is there but I haven't used it, same as with the WiFi hotspot feature. The camera takes serviceable pics and videos, great in fact for a $150 device (purchased mine on sale for $100), but not Note 4 quality, but again you shouldn't expect that for the price you're paying. The front flash doesn't capture much unless you hold it fairly close so it has very specific and not a wide range of applications. And now to the not so good and bad parts. Swipe style typing is a pain on this phone. Tapping each button works much better but doesn't always work right either. I saw another reviewer complain about this same issue. The audio isn't very good either, placing a call on speaker is not going to do you much good unless the other person has a high pitch voice, if there's any bass in their voice it'll just be bad. But music sounds okay although not very loud. It's best used with Bluetooth or a headset. Now to the really bad... Talking on this phone with it to your ear is supremely frustrating. The screen comes on, you will be hitting buttons with your face, hanging up or adding calls, and changing settings all without you knowing. It happens ALL THE TIME. That is my biggest complaint, and it's a very valid one considering this is a phone and I want to talk to people with it. Charging is also very slow like others have stated, but I think that's the chip makers fault not Blu's. When the battery reaches 50% I immediately scale back my use so I know I'll have juice for later. Also I can't find a case for it yet, gotta have a case.

All in all it does do a much better job than my LG Leon that this phone was purchased to replace. Blows it out of the water so much that it was easier to compare it to the Note 4 than it was to the Leon. But sadly I wouldn't make this purchase again, maybe you will have better luck!
