I have had the BLU Life One X for 4 months now. I replaced my old Lumia 640 with this guy and so far I am happy I made the switch.

*BUILD QUALITY*
- A decently build phone. Back panel creaks a little bit but I don't notice with a case on.
- Upgradeable memory. I stuck a 64 gig microSD card and won't have to worry about filling up for a long time to come.
- Overall a sleek looking phone that doesn't look the price.
- 5/5

*USER INTERFACE*
- Nearly stock android. A few alterations such as lock screen gestures and a "clear all" button on the multitasking screen.
- Replaced stock launcher with Nova launcher for more customization.
- No bloatware, or at least so minimal that I did not notice it once if I hid them from the app drawer using Nova Launcher.
- Overall rating: 5/5

*RESPONSIVENESS*
- Microlags when multitasking heavily. Not enough to bog down daily experience.
- Some games do not run at full 60 FPS but over very pleased. Have a DS and GBA emulator along with Clash Royale, all running well. I assume heavier games would not.
- Keyboard rarely skips but that is often after being in my pocket for a while and sweat/oil may have accumulated. Swipe works decently.
- Overall rating: 4/5

*BATTERY LIFE*
- A mixed bag in this category. My lumia 640 would last me upwards of 3 days with minimal use, and 1.5 days easily with moderate to heavy use.
- This phone scrapes to the end of the day with 10-20%, if not dead. This runs from 9am to 11PM.
- Usage includes web browsing, youtube, checking clash royale, email autosynced, messenger force shut down in the background, occasional listening to music.
- Screen on time can be 3-4.5 hours on a good day.
- The biggest flaw to this phone is its charging time. You better charge this at night or else you'll be dead all the next day. May take up to 4.5 hours with the included charger and power brick, and even longer with USB charging through a computer or different charger/powerbrick combo.
- Signal seeking is not the strongest for this phone, so I assume it uses up extra battery trying to hold onto that signal. Turn off data if you don't need it.
- Overall rating: 3/5

*CAMERA*
- Lumia 640 had a much better camera, but that is expected as all nokia phones have very good sensors and the bundled Lumia Camera app offers amazing manual controls.
- Default app is sufficient for daytime photos. Sometimes blurry if you don't hold your hand steady.
- Indoor/macro shots are poor. Lots of artifacting and does not pick up light well.
- Video is good. No complaints here.
- Front facing camera has a flash. Bonus points here. Also has a "wide angle" selfie panorama which has come in handy.
- For the price of $99, a good camera overall.
- Overall rating: 4.5/5

*ACCESSORIES*
- Not many accessories for this phone. Best luck for a screen protector and case was on ebay searching for "Wiko fever 4g case" as it is the same model just different branding.
- Overall accessory support: 3/5

*FINAL THOUGHTS*
- As my first android phone I am more than pleased. While it lacks in super fast speeds and an amazing camera, I got it for $99. Subjectively, you cannot beat that price with other phones on the market for now. A big question you have to ask yourself when buying a phone is: what will you use it for? I simply text, call, take a few photos, browse the web, watch youtube, play a few apps. Does a $300+ smartphone to accomplish that? Yep. Does this phone accomplish the same but for a third of the price? Yep.

Final rating: 4/5

I can't say enough about how much I love this phone.  I had researched the best unlocked phones for under $200 and this one got rave reviews.  So I decided to buy it.  I actually ordered it through an Amazon Warehouse Deal.  I've had Samsung, and Blu is at least better than an S5, which is saying a lot, because I loved mine before I dropped it down the steps.  The design is beautiful and sleek.  And you know you are holding quality.  Everything feels solid and well put together.  The processor is rock solid, the screen is fantastic, and everything runs smooth.  The flip case is not something I thought I would use until I saw it.  It essentially replaces the original back panel on the phone.  I think it's great.

Only negative:  It charges at a glacial pace, and if you are really setting the phone to perform in the options, the battery doesn't last as long as other phones I've used.  However, it is not even close to being a deal breaker.

The next step up from this phone in the Blu line is the Vivo 5.  It's metal, it looks amazing, but the display is only 720, since they had to shave costs somewhere to build an all metal phone.  I could have bought either, and I bought the Life One X.  I haven't regretted it for a second.

For less than a quarter the price of the leading Android phones you get one heck of an amazing phone. It has enough RAM (2GB) to keep from swapping under heavy use (something the Moto G had a real problem with, given its complement of only 1GB RAM), a fast 8 core CPU, a stunning full HD screen, and absolutely minimal bloatware along with being thin and lightweight. Minor downsides include lack of 5GHz band wi-fi and NFC. Big deal. Power consumption, once I downloaded and installed a recent update, is shockingly minimal. This device sets the bar for price/performance. No reason at all to buy a phone through your cellular service provider - get this instead and save yourself $$$.

Just received it today, haven't even activated it yet and I'm already impressed. Huge screen, amazing resolution and colors. Feels heavy for it's size which I like. For $150 you get a well built phone with up to date technology, a case, charger, screen protector and headphones. Yes, the screen protector is a bit narrow for the phone, but it's really not needed unless you're really rough with your phone. If anyone is looking for a phone that looks and feels like the iPhone, without being financially violated, this is the phone to get.

Update: 3/1/16 This is by far the best phone I've ever had, though I do have a few complaints. The first was the issue with MMS messages. We set up our phones with Cricket and after spending over 30 minutes on the phone with them, the only resolution to the problem was to use Google Hangouts to send and receive MMS texts. The second problem is that setting a custom ringtone does not work. I've searched online through forums and tried every suggestion and it still defaults to the factory ringtone, despite all settings correctly set. Lastly, I ordered the white one for myself and the back gets very dirty and it's impossible to clean. I tried Clorox wipes and Magic Erasers and neither worked. I ended up switching to the folio case it came with just so it doesn't look gross. These are minor issues since the phone functions perfectly well. I just wanted to share my experience so others are aware.

Overall, I like the phone.  However encountered the following software issues:

1. Unable to connect to WiFi router if SSID broadcast is not enabled.  Tried "Add Network" option but it reported authentication problems with WPA2.  But WPA worked with SSID broadcast disabled.

2. Used Pattern as Screen Lock.  It worked okay until I encrypted the phone.  On reboot, the pattern input area was only thumbnail size in the upper left hand corner.  Was not able to draw the pattern and had to reset the phone from recovery screen.

3. There is no Users option in Settings.  Selecting User from Quick Settings shows contact information like on KitKat, instead of the expected option to switch users in Lollipop.  Don't know if there is another way to create multiple user accounts.

4. The SD card shows up as the first storage device.  i.e. Internal phone storage changes from sdcard0 to sdcard1 and SD card is sdcard0.
Have to update shortcuts if SD card is added or removed.  The apps are installed to SD card by default.

I'm completely over this phone. Bought it a few months ago when I was desperately in need of a newer and better phone, just wish I had done a little more research on Blu and their shotty phones. The life one x was great at first, did everything it with only a few quirks to it, the squeaky back,slow charge etc. Only now am I wishing I had saved money for a better unlocked phone. After just three months, the firmware in the phone is bad and it doesn't even start up now. I've tried factory resetting, clearing cache, everything. If you're looking at this phone, save yourself and go look at better phones not made by this company. (That is if you consider Blu doesn't even actually manufacture them.) I had so much hope for this phone but upon receiving the first one I had battery issues right away. On full charge it only lasted a couple hours and it would take nearly 12 hours to charge to 100%. I did an even exchange and once I got the second phone it was the same issue all over again. Two bad phones in a row doesn't seem like bad luck to me. On top of it all the operating system was a little annoying to navigate. Everything took more stars that is should've to open or close.

For powerful hardware, I expected better performance, clear that the price is a bargain, but the quality is not the best, at 3 weeks of use, the battery does not respond 12hrs and volume buttons disappeared and has not a single knock.

I accepted this BLU Life One X in exchange for a fair review and I've been using the phone for several weeks now. Here are the things I like about this phone:
1. Excellent 5" screen. Very sharp with rich colors. I enjoy reading on this phone.
2. Battery life is very good. I will often have around 30% battery life at the end of the day even though I am a heavy phone user.
3. Adding this unlocked phone to my AT&T account was painless. Reception, internet and wifi are very good on this phone, equal to my AT&T phone.
4. The price. Can't argue that you get a decent phone for the money. Plus if you are a fan of unlocked phones, this is even better for you.

The camera is an in-between item. It's not bad but tends to take blurry pictures if you aren't carefully still. Perhaps it lacks image stabilization?

Cons for this phone:
1. "Dead" spots. Often I have a small area on the phone, about the size of a fingertip, that will not respond to touch. Imagine you are playing solitaire and the card in the corner cannot be moved. This usually clears up if I restart the phone but eventually comes back. Often a picture from Facebook messenger appears on my screen, as it does to indicate a message from that person. Only there is no new message and that picture will not go away. This is extremely frustrating even though it doesn't seriously change the functionality of the phone.
2. Cases. I'm not crazy about the case that came with the phone and there really aren't any other options out there. Perhaps there will be more when this model has been around longer. Who knows? Not me.

Is this a good phone? It depends on what you are looking for. I'd say it's not an exciting, top of the line phone but it is a reliable, functional phone that won't exhaust your budget too much if you are looking for an unlocked smart phone with a large screen.

I'm just your average user. I won't be able to break down specs, etc. I've only used Android phones. The last I really liked was my GALAXY S 5. I did not want to pay that kind of price for a phone again this soon the way technology just constantly offers us new items. So when my daughter bought one of these and told me the specs were comparable enough to the S5 I loved I decided for the price to try it.

There, of course, are differences. The battery charges quite a bit slower. There is lag occasionally but very occasionally. Overall, I like this phone. The only other issue I've had has been calls disconnecting due to that sensor at the top of the phone, the face proximity thing. Apparently, it's not perfect. But it does work pretty well.

I don't use the screen protector. I've always been a Zagg fan and last I looked couldn't find one. These are not good. But to get a phone, case, and protector for the price is unheard of.

Perfection? No. Good for the price? Definitely.

Frustrating.  *Have followed the advice given in another owner's post.  Have made one call so far since adjusting settings and had no issues.*
I do like the manufacturer's decision to upgrade to the Gorilla Glass 3 on this model.  It's great.  The BLU Studio I had previously had some really soft glass.  Even the screen cloth that came with the phone scratched and made swirls in the glass that couldn't be removed.  Very good upgrade.

After a month the volume keys fell out and when I contacted BLU customer service, they stated that it would take around a month to fix. The charge rate on this phone seemed to degrade week by week to the point where the phone would take twice as long as it was supposed to recharge. The power consumption is weird, it seems that this phone just falls apart, because just running spotify for about 15 minutes it uses about 30% of the battery life. This is with no other raps running on the lowest light setting. This is not worth the money and has been a regret every day after purchasing.

I love this phone. Only regret is that I didn't buy it during the $100 promotion (I was skeptical and waiting for more reviews). I was on the fence because I am a high end phone user. I'm "upgrading" from my LG G3 and I honestly like this phone more than the G3. The G3 BURNED through battery so quickly that I didn't even get half a day's worth in most cases. This battery seems to be much better but does take a long while to charge (about 3 hours in my case to charge from 25% to full). So far, I've gotten almost 5 hours of screen on time, which is awesome (the G3 would give me 2 at most)! The processor is also wonderful! Its much better than the Octa Core Qualcomm 610 that came with the Onetouch Idol 3 (which was a great phone but always micro lagged due to a low powered 1.0 GHz cores). I am selling both my G3 and my Alcatel Idol 3 because I love this phone! Some things I don't like is the fact that it doesn't have 5GHz internet. My apartment complex is overflowing with 2.4GHz congestion and I like to say in the 5GHz bands if possible, but it's not a big deal for me. I found out that using the given charger charges a little bit faster than the QuickCharge 2.0 charger I have from Aukey (which I find odd). The leather-like case is also pretty great. Almost feels like leather! I PUT A 64GB MicroSD card in the phone and it works well (make sure you format it first on the computer to a FAT32 format, else it won't work). I moved most of my apps on the MicroSD card and after installing about 100 APPS, I still have 6GB of free internal space available! Even with 100 apps installed, the battery seems to keep up well throughout the day. I get LTE with Cricket and MMS works after getting the right MMS APN from the internet.

I also think the build quality and overall feel of this phone is amazing. Compared to my LG G3, it's much lighter and narrower, which means I can easily get a good grip. The curved edges and the aluminum body is premium looking and feels great in the hands. The Gorilla Glass 3 also provides great touch experience because it's very smooth. The best thing I like about this phone is the price, I spent only $20 to get this phone because I had Amazon gift cards. Because it's so inexpensive, I can basically throw it away if it breaks by falling, so this will be my first phone that I won't be buying a better case for!

Update: 1/23/16
Ive been using this phone for about two weeks now. I still like it a lot. I installed about 150 apps and games and there's still 4.3 GB of space left on the Internal space (I'm also using a memory card and have moved most of my apps over to it). Battery life is great. I get about 4.5 hours on a single charge. Battery takes about 3 hours to recharge from 20% to 100%, which is fine for me. No slowdowns whatsoever. Overall, just loving this phone. And have finally decided to sell the G3 and Alcatel Onetouch Idol 3 because this phone will be my daily driver for the next 5 months at least!

While I'm still recently "out of the box" on this phone, the features for price are unbeatable by a wide margin as of this writing (Jan/2016), even at $149. Nothing comes close, not even for $100 more.  NOTE: contrary to several sites, there is NO gyroscope with this phone.

It's often compared to the Moto G 3rd Gen, which I used to own, yet has double the RAM, double the storage, faster processor and a 1080p display versus the Moto's 720p.  The BLU is generally the prettier phone, and it's thinner, if that matters to you, but neither are chunky.  It should be noted that despite superior specs, I've so far seen no difference in speed or performance with basic browsing, music, and mobile games, but the BLU may really shine with the next release of AndroidOS.

The Moto G 3rd Gen has a few features that the BLU doesn't, such as water-proofing and tons more case options. If you're accident-prone, these are worthwhile features. The Moto also has a better, louder speaker.  This is especially noticeable in the car using it as a GPS.  Battery life is also superior in the Moto: I routinely got 3 solid days on the Moto to the Blu's 1.5 - 2.

Another difference is software and hardware refinement.  The Blu has some serious annoyances. It often starts an app rather than swipes (too sensitive). It took several attempts to connect to my home wifi (but once connected seems stable).  It often switches to speaker phone from my ear touching the screen (very annoying).  Sometimes it gets warm in my pocket and I pull it out to find the flashlight has somehow turned on.  Other times it goes into airplane mode on its own.  Google voice commands only work if I speak toward the bottom of the phone and I have to speak especially loudly.  This makes voice commands especially awkward and limited.  On long drives I like to voice-command reading and replying to text messages and it went from passable on the Moto to painful on the Blu.  Basically what's kind of a cool experience/tool degrades to a kind of "nerd shouting at his phone" sort of thing.

Lastly, GPS reception is noticeably poorer than the Moto. I thought I had a bad phone at first, as while sitting at my desk it didn't work at all, but it started working when I went outside. I think BLU assumes people are using the combined GPS and Network locationing, yet most of the time, particularly when walking, I use GPS only to save battery.  Or I like to set up my directions before I leave the house/office rather than fuss in the car.  The weaker GPS in the BLU makes this a more frustrating experience.

In the end, if you're willing to trade some rough edges for some very impressive features and specs found only on much more expensive phones, this is a great choice.  If you want a more refined, smooth, "just works" experience and are willing to pay a small premium for it, the Moto is better.

Love this device for all things, but as a phone I continue to hit the touch screen with my cheek as I talk on the phone. Very frustrating. I hit the pause /hold button and if I miss that I end up hitting the voice mail button and call that while on another call. Also hard to find a protective cover for the 2016 version.

Excellent device.  Just not for me.  Great back-up phone (since I've a few phones).
Very high quality from BLU products.

I ordered this phone for the dual sim functionality at the low price of $100. Battery lasted long. Screen quality is good. Responsiveness is great. Camera quality is ok, nowhere close to a S5 or Sony Z1.
Cons: Bluetooth not working consistently nor does it work as well as my Samsung S5 in terms of distance.
It came with a screen defect. The top left corner stopped responding within 3 days of usage. Screen portion is dead.
The call quality is average.
The speaker is useless.
I am returning it as it makes so many menus unusable.
If it were not for the screen defect, this is a great $100 phone.

While waiting for UPS to pick up this return:

1. It takes a long time to recharge, far longer than a S5: 4 times longer using exactly the same fast charger at 2.0A
2. Camera worthless in the dark
3. GPS usage with Google Maps: map on google kept rotating around, apparently struggling to figure out in which direction I was walking
4. Worked well with the Honda Android Auto feature
Working good.
Great Phone, everything that I was looking for and more. Camera is awesome. Very pleased !!!!!!!

The biggest piece of overrated technology in a long time. I got in on the pre-sale so I paid less. I didn't like it. The speaker is bad. Really bad. I do a lot of calls using the speakers and had to kept asking the caller to repeat themselves because the sound was not clear. The battery is good. The camera is good. The phone as a device is good but as a functioning phone it is bad. Whenever I took a call using the earpiece, the screen would wake up and my face would press random buttons. I didn't like it like other people.

when i read the price i found 149.99$  and when i choose 2 phones i found $279.97 i thought this price for 2 phones and i bought it and receive  but i chocked when i found this price for 1 phone only.

while talking against your ear the phone switches to speaker. It is constantly switching the default memory storage and you get a message asking you if you want to use the SD card as the default memory storage. a couple of timesthe memory shows that is full and I have to reboot the phone to make it work properly again.

I really wanted to like this phone, but even with the great promo deal ($99) I received, it turned out too good to be true. I've been using it over three weeks now and will be returning it today.

I'll start with the positives:
-The 1080p display is good for this price point. It's not near flagship level and colors look somewhat dull, even on the "vivid" mode, but for a "pharmacy phone" it's very good.
-The phone has good specs for this price point
-The phone is thin and light

Now the negative:
-Battery life is actually horrible. One of the things that sold me on this phone was the professional reviews (e.g. Android Authority) that said battery life was great. Immediately after disconnecting from the charger (after being plugged in for 12 hours), the battery level instantly fell to 98%. I cleared the few running applications and left the phone sitting 10 minutes in idle mode with the screen off and checked the battery level again. It had dropped to 90%! Expect to the battery level to drop 1% for every minute the screen is on.
-The speaker is very poor compared to my 2014 Moto G and understanding someone using the speakerphone function is impossible.
-This phone cannot receive MMS (multimedia, pictures) via text! I tried both the built in Android and Google hangouts. I supposed there probably is a fix for this and I did calling BLU customer support, but their office was closed when I called at 3 pm PST on a weekday.
-The phone feels fragile, like it could bend or snap very easily if you applied moderate force or sat on it accidentally
-I experienced occasional lags and freeze-ups when multitasking.

In the end, this phone turned out to be too good to be true.
went power less after one week of use.... It's a dead phone even i couldn't recover the data on it.
Phone works great as expected.

I can not really think of anything wrong with this phone, I had a Galaxy S4 and the Blu is much better. Screen is so bright and clear and I even have it at 20% brightness. Battery life is very good. Fast, it is stock android and photos look nice.
I installed a 32GB card and it is possible to install apps directly to the card.. Nice!
Wasn't really expecting much from this phone but I needed something cheap that would get the job done. The BLU Life One X does not disappoint,
Its over all a great phone, battery life is not very long. but still a wonderful phone for the price.
I have little time to use but works well

I bought this smartphone as a replacement for my Blu Studio 5.5S which I bought one and a half years ago. This Blu Life One X is a great phone. I have had it for several weeks now. I can not believe the difference between the two.

I read all the reviews before I purchased it. Most complaints were the battery life, speaker phone and issues with Cricket wireless APN settings. Soon after I bought my phone, I received an update which took care of the battery issues. I also adjusted the screen setting downward (too bright), turned on the battery saver mode. Huge difference! The battery will last me all day and I am a heavy user. I also use this phone as a wireless hot spot since I live in a cornfield.

I changed Crickets APN settings, which do not work with some Blu phones, so I could get the MMS messages to work incoming and outgoing. First thing I did was chat with Cricket and had them push settings to the phone (didn't work). I then changed the default APN settings. You can change it back to default settings if you messed up or it didn't work.

To get to the APN settings I went to "settings",  clicked the "more" button,  clicked the "cellular networks", clicked "Access Point Names", then pressed "internet". I changed the settings to the following:

Name: internet
APN: ndo
APN type: default, MMS, supl
Port: not set
Username: not set
Password: not set
Server: not set
MMSC: [...]
MMS Proxy: proxy.aiowireless.net
MMS port: 80
MCC: 310
MNC: 150

Leave everything else un-touched. Make sure you save your changes before you leave the page.

As for the speaker phone I have no issues. I use it for all my calls. It sounds loud and clear and I come across the same way.

The photos come out beautiful. The camera is a little different then the one in the Studio 5.5S. On the Life One X you aim at something,  tap the screen to focus directly on what you want.  A green box will appear and the camera is focused. You won't be disappointed. There are several settings for your camera. I haven't tried those as I am a point and shoot girl. There is a flash for the front and back cameras. Oh,  don't forget to remove the protective film on the back camera.

I have streamed Amazon videos without any problems. They are bright and smooth. I also have watched movies from my micro SDHC UHS card with no issues.

I would highly recommended this phone based on price, the 2gb ram, the 16gb storage, the Gorilla Glass 3 screen, 1080p, etc. There is a lot of power in this thin nice looking phone.

Hopefully Blu will keep their promise of a Marshmallow update during the first quarter of this year.

The display seems that is about to die,the top part of the screen flashes constantly and every now and then i get vertical blurry bars which make the phone unusuable. I've been using the phone for just 2 months and this is happening, can't return it anymore....

EDIT1: The phone display is dead, and it seems like a factory defect, the screen is not shattered and the phone use was minimal in these two months.

Bought two, one is fine and the other.....
1. Phone will not allow me to assign ringtone.  It keeps playing the default tone despite being changed.

2. Due to (1), i reset the phone, it was taking too long to restore settings and i turned the phone off.  Since then I phone screen is blank.  I can only see and answer incoming calls.  I cannot make out of use the phone in any form.  Screen is blank.  I am frustrated.

I bought this phone not knowing who or a lot about this company. I did as much research as I could before pulling the trigger. After looking to see what my current phone carrier wanted to phones I decided to go with an unlocked phone. The transition was easy with not problems getting it to work. My real only complaint is the speaker. Calls are not loud and crisp and the speaker phone option is the same. All and all I like this phone.

This phone is amazing and that is coming from someone who in the past would buy every new high end smart phone every year.
I decided to care a little more about my money so this year to replace my Nexus 5 I did the research and went with the BLU Life One X 2016.
The design is flawless, I love how thin it is and the screen is really bright and good quality. The build quality has a premium feel, and the button layout is perfect, feeling great in the hand. After watching a few reviews the battery life was a concern but if you know android you know how to fix that which I did. Before the tweaks I got 9 hours and that's with Netflix, FB, IG, YouTube, Maps and about 400 text and a few calls..  The phone in a way reminds me of my Nexus 5, there isn't much of a learning curb as the UI is basically stock. When it comes to speed the phone is fast and can get even faster!!! Gaming is smooth and as well as browsing and Netflix looks great . The camera is better than expected, you can get some really great pics or really bad ones. Radio wise again this phone flies, and yes you do get T Mobiles band12 where its available. I have it in my area and it is consistently full bar LTE.... There is no NFC or Finger print Scanner but truthfully who really needs it? The only cons I truly have is that speaker is has little to no bass but the volume is definitely loud enough. Also I'm not a fan of flip cases even though the one packed with this phone is well done, wish there were more options.. This phone will be my daily driver for some time, I originally was going to grab the Honor 5X however my Nexus 5 decided for me by dying.. If BLU stays true to their word and update the Life One X to Android 6.0 it'll only get better...  Honestly this phone is a hidden jem for its price point, BLU has done a great job...

I used this phone daily for about 2 weeks and ultimately chose to return it.  My experience doesn't seem to jive with the rest of the reviews here but it's just what I experienced so take it as you may.

- Battery life was absolutely horrible. I tend to use my phone quite heavily and I have a lot of apps so I understand that I'm not going to be getting primo battery life.  That was never a problem until I used this phone.  In comparison I previously had an LG G2.  With the same apps and same style of use, my battery lasted me easily twice as long even a year after using the phone.  Maybe I got a bad one, I don't know but there's no reason that my phone would be down 5% batter 5 minutes after unplugging it. It was crazy!  In about 3 hours unplugged I'd be down to about 75% battery left. Regardless of phone age or apps running I've never experienced that kind of battery drain with any other phone.

- Charging was terrible. Again I don't know if I somehow got a bum phone but based on the other reviews here I'd guess not. I plugged this phone into my previous chargers phone charger, it stayed plugged in over night.  The next morning it had gained about 13% in charge.  When plugged in with the charger that came with the phone, it charged fully overnight.  I don't pretend to understand these things but I can't figure out what the difference is, it was super annoying though. I don't want to buy several of these proprietary chargers just to be able to charge at various locations, and frankly even if I did, the phone charges so slowly (even ON the proprietary charger) that it wouldn't really get me much.  I like to "top off" before I head out for a night sometimes, that was not an option here.

- Lag. I know this is crazy with the specs on the phone but anytime I had google navigation and spotify going at the same time, spotify just stuttered horribly.  I also periodically experienced keyboard typing delay.

- Reliability.  There was twice in a two week period that my morning alarm just plain never went off.  Why? Unsolved mystery.  I double checked all the settings, didn't change anything, and the next day it went off just fine.  No idea what that's about but yeah.

- The speaker is crappy and on the back of the phone.  It's super quiet to begin with but on top of that it's located on the back of the phone so if you leave your phone face up you pretty much aren't hearing anything.

So I sent this phone back and got a moto g 3rd gen, which is working out much better.
Best phone for the $$s that I have experienced. Graphics, speed, looks all great. Glad I found this on Amazon.

I got this for my wife to replace her old iPhone 4s. She loves the Apple phones, but we didn't want to spend 600+ on a brand new phone, and we needed it in a pinch.

The phone is very nice for the price.

It does feel a bit cheap with the back plastic case, and when you hold it there is some 'give' when you squeeze the case. Not a big deal, as we don't usually squeeze our phones much ;) The white does look dirty quickly, and is hard to clean because of the pebbling/leather grain look.

The camera is ok, but I think worse than the 4s's camera, which is sad. No stability control, etc, so you have to have a steady hand to get good photos.

The screen is great, nice and sharp, and responds to touch perfectly.

Aftermarket cases are hard to come by, but it did come with one (which my wife didn't like). We are still hunting for an alternative.

I'd buy the phone again. If you are on a budget, you can't go wrong.

Probably the best budget Android phone out there right now.  That means full featured, not cheap, dumbed down and/or bullt with low spec parts.

Pros: Lots of memory and accepts SD cards for even more.  Decent camera even indoors.  Not TOO much bloatware but some.  A few preloaded apps are only preloaded (not "installed") and can be deleted, rather than just deactivated.  Package is complete; a VERY nice integrated leatherette cover (replaces the rear cover), plastic screen shield, charger and cable are included.  You don't need to spend another nickle unless you don't have an SD card on hand.

Cons:  not a big fan of the BLU launcher app, and haven't had much luck so far in trying to turn it off completely and load another, but have only tried once.  Battery isn't replaceable.

For the money, the specs are great, performance is solid.  I recommend this for anyone that wants a full featured android phone with enough horsepower and screen resolution to play in the same league as the high end phones without requiring a second mortgage.

As with all tech, and cells especially, this review is only true for the next 20 minutes.  However right now, if you want to keep price low, keep all the key features of Android, have decent cameras and reasonable performance, you have to put this one on your short list.

I received the phone yesterday and it seemed great.  But when I inserted the Metropcs sim card, all I got was 'emergency calls only'.  When I try to select an available network, I keep getting ''Can't connect ti this network right now. Try again later'  This is for all the networks not just MetroPCs (I see AT&T. Sprint. T-Mobile, I get the same message).  So I can't use the phone to call or message.  It may be going back. Sigh.

Edit 01/13/16 - changed to 4 stars, got the phone to work on MetroPCS, just had to call to associate the sim with the phone.  Not 5 stars because I wasn't able to get the custom ringtone to work, even with all the suggestions posted.  Not a deal breaker though, still a very nice phone...it's a keeper

Important note:

There was some PR copied by PC magazine about Android 6 for this device, that it would be released for this phone first quarter of 2016, and that was the deciding factor on getting this phone.  There is no update, and I contacted BLU directly, and they acknowledged that there is no update.  They did not comment on if there would be and when even when I asked -- just ignored the question.  I am NOT happy about that.

I picked up two of these, for my wife and I for 100 bucks each.

Interface is satisfactorily minimalist -- no extra app stores or apps to kill.

Google's restore process worked great -- migrated all my apps to my new phone.... sadly, better than I wanted.  It migrated all the apps I couldn't remove from my S3 (preinstalled Samsung apps :)  ).  Got them removed though.

I don't understand the complaint about charging time.  I charge my phone completely in 3-4 hours easy.  To be fair though, I still haven't used the included chargers.  I previously bought the 60 Anear 6-port charger and have had great luck with everything I'm plugging in:

http://www.amazon.com/Desktop-Charging-PowerSmart-Technology-Compatible/dp/B011LSGMT2?ie=UTF8&psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00

As for handling.  It feels much better in my large hands than the S3, but the finish on the back is so slick, I can't rest it on my clothes at all without it sliding off.

Camera takes excellent photos.

Phone is darn snappy -- battery life is adequate, though I am coming off a double-sized battery for my old S3, so it is reduced.  Still it has been lasting all day, and I recently bought the 10,000 mAh USB charger from KMASHI, and it can charge this thing multiple times, and as fast as my wall charger, so I just keep it in the car with me.

Bottom line: Give me an Android 6 update, and I will be ecstatic.

____
Update 4-8-16

I use a bluetooth headset while at the gym.  The range on the bluetooth is decidedly less than my Galaxy S3.  I could walk half-way across the gym (one big open room, about 200 ft long total) before the audio would cut out.  Now I get about 20 feet away before it starts stuttering.  That may or may not be a good thing.  Sometimes I'd move on to the next machine without noticing I forgot my phone.  :)
Good phone works great. Good camera. Whish it would come with a hard case instead of the flip one it comes with. I can't find a shell  case for it yet.
Love the phone, hate that you can't find a good case for it.  If you made some decent stuff to fit it, I'd give it a 5.

For the price of this phone you can't go wrong, feels like a premium phone, just got it today and it's very impressive. Great display, and the speaker is adequate as well, though I did install speaker booster.

First, I should say that I am a very basic cell phone user, one that doesn't use the earphones too much, rarely run the battery down, don't worry too much about storage space, etc. That being said, I love the feel and the colors are vibrant when viewing pictures and internet websites. It's affordable and unlocked so you can put any plan on it. You can even use Google voice and have no plan at all! This is a perfect phone for kids, students, and grandparents who just need the basics of communication. It should also be good for travelers who can buy a card in another country and thus pay lower rates while visiting. Highly recommend!

The phone is OK, as far as you have kid gloves to handle it. This was my second Blu phone and both the phones faced the same end within a few days of me getting it. This one fell a couple of feet from my hand and the screen shattered. The specs say that it is Corning glass, but the screen is way too brittle. So if you are looking for a cheap phone with decent features, this is a phone to consider. But if you move around a little bit with your phone, then this is not that good an option because if it falls, you are certain it is going to get damaged. There is no option to get the screen fixed other than send it back to the factory and get it fixed. It takes 2-3 weeks plus the cost is similar to buying the new phone.

It's still brand new, so we'll see how it lasts, but...this was a gift for our son and we were all very impressed with it for the price. Great size, great screen, cover included, nice camera quality. Very impressive so far. Hope it holds up!
Seems to work well at a fraction of the price of big names. Too new to give 5 stars may update later.
Very satisfied
I wish I had bought two for the price of $99. Will hunt again for another discount. Awesome phone.
I love this phone! For the price I paid I feel confident that I got the best product possible. It has a nice slim feel, and it came with a flip case for the phone. I looks great and it works great.

It's not a top model and you shouldn't expect that from it, but it's on par with some devices that cost twice as much.
The hardware is rather OK (screen, camera, call quality, sound). The back cover is crunchy. Battery is very good in standby, though it drains quickly during calls. You can feel almost pure Android experience though it's not a big advantage as out of the box it's very primitive and not optimized (caller, battery usage optimization, etc). But that is why this phone costs so low.

Its a good phone for the price its fast battery is pretty decent comes with a lot of extras. I had a problem with my first one they immeditly sent a new one. Im a phone junkie.i would recomend this phone.
Great phone for the price. Very responsive.
works well, no flaws at all. Surprisingly fast too. The only thing is camera is a bit slow.

The Good:
This thing runs like a CHAMP.  There is barely any bloatware on it, and what there is, I've been able to disable/remove without issue.  People complain about the default keyboard, it took me 2 days to get used to it; I tried another keyboard after and ended up going back to it.  The battery holds up for what seems like forever.  I play games on it at work for a solid 8-10 hours (I "work" 12), and it has only ever died on me once.  Screen looks great, and the optional flip cover it came with is really nice; it works great with android, going so far as to show my media player and weather at a glance.
The Bad:
After the update a few days ago, it charges for 2-3% and stops completely.  It also randomly shuts itself off as of the last update.
The Ugly?:
I can't say for sure if this is an issue with the update itself, or if the phone has already started to die.  I know other people have had this issue.  I'm going to try and reset the phone to see if it improves, because I REALLY want to keep this phone. It runs entirely too well for it's price point.

EDIT: It is, in fact, the phone itself and not the update.  It lasted about 2 weeks.  Will try to swap them out, but as it stands, this thing is a melon that won't charge past 17%.

Initial Review 5/27/2016

So far I've had this phone for going on three days.  I'll write my initial impressions here and then update this review in a month or so to give a longer term impression.

I got this phone to replace an Amazon Fire Phone I was using on the T-Mobile network.  The phone had all of the features I was looking for in a phone, unlocked LTE, 2gb of RAM, 16GB internal storage with an SD slot, 1080p display and it was all relatively inexpensive.

Two problems I have noticed right off the bat are, inability to use alternate .mp3 ringtones for individual contacts, and even with SD card being selected for primary storage, downloaded apps get installed on the phone storage and have to be manually moved to the SD card.

The phone itself is very nice in my opinion, the display is very clear with nice bright colors, very easy to view outdoors.  I don't have the best eyes and I only have the brightness turned up to 50% or so in the direct sunlight.  The display registers input okay, not quite as reliable as the Fire Phone, there have been a couple occasions already where a tap has not registered, but it's nothing too bothersome so far and it could just be me fat fingering things.

The sound from the single rear speaker isn't the greatest but for me it isn't really a problem.  The only sound I usually have on is the ringer, the app volume is usually off on my phone and I can still hear the ringer clearly with this speaker.  Compared to the Fire Phone the volume and audio quality are lesser from the Life One X.

The overall feel of the phone is nice.  The Life One X is wider and taller than the Fire Phone, but thinner.  It doesn't feel as heavy or substantial as the Fire Phone, but it doesn't feel too light or cheap either.  The back of the phone has a nice textured "leather" finish which makes gripping it easier.  The bevel and surround metal feel high quality as well.  I personally dislike larger smartphones, I thought  my Fire Phone was a perfect size and I was having trouble finding a new phone that wasn't, in my opinion, too big.  The Life One X is a good size, it fits nicely in my hand and works great with single handed operations.

Operation of apps is relatively smooth, some apps seem to take a second or two longer to start initially than my Fire Phone did, but once they are running, switching between apps and running them is smooth.  To be honest I don't really play a lot of games, my kids do that more than I do when we are in waiting rooms or the such.

T-Mobile reception is good with this phone, better than with the Fire Phone, there haven't been any dead spots so far, though with my Fire Phone there were places where I couldn't get signal.  I haven't done a speed test yet but web browsing and downloading apps with WiFi disabled seems to be quicker with the Life One X.

The Life One X comes with a  decent amount of stuff in the box, it has the charger, a screen protector, a second phone back that has a flap cover, and ear buds.  I removed the original back and put the one with the flap cover on, it is of an okay quality and does it's job.

The Life One X has some other features such as smart gestures which can open the camera or turn on the led light by drawing letters on the screen, such as a letter C for the camera.  I have read some reviews which have said that having the smart gestures on may make the screen become active during phone calls, but I have not experienced this myself.

Battery life on the Life One X is okay, it seems to be slightly better than the Fire Phone.  I don't use my phone much during the day and it is at about 50 or 60% when I go to bed at night during the week.  On weekends I will probably use the phone more and would expect it to be down into the low 10s or 20% SOC.  For someone who plays a lot of games or uses their phone a lot during the day, they would probably need to charge it earlier in the day.

Charging of the Life One X can be slow at times.  With the included charger it seems to charge a bit faster than my Fire Phone, but charging via a USB port on my laptop resulted in no gains the charge percentage stayed at 51% after being plugged in for twenty or thirty minutes.  I haven't experimented too much with different chargers or charge rates but I will update this review in the future after I have.

Now onto the two problems I have had so far.

Trying to set a custom ringtone for a contact has proved impossible for me.  I have read in forums that people have been successful doing so, I just can't get it to work.  I was able to hook up my phone to my Windows 7 laptop (Windows 10 laptop did not work) and transfer mp3 files to either the phone storage or the SD card.  Once the files were transferred I was able to see them in the ringtone menu on the phone and even select them.  But after selecting them for an individual contact, I would still get the standard ringtone.  I attempted restarting the phone after setting the ringtone as well as creating a custom audio profile and then setting the ringtones, which did not work.  Currently I am using one of my mp3 ringtones as the general ringtone, but I cannot set tones for individual contacts.

The second issue that I am running into is not being able to download apps directly to the SD Card.  Even with the SD card selected as the primary storage installed apps will go to the phone storage and I have to go into the apps menu and move each one individually to the SD card.  While this isn't difficult, having to do it with every app that I install is an issue.

big WOW. I was very impressed with this Blue phone. It exceeded my expectation for $99 (sale price). the camera was amazing specially the front camera with flash for night selfies  :)
the screen brightness is superb very easy to read even in daylight.

I just received this device and this is by no means an exhaustive review,  but there are so many surprises already. First the phone feels great in the hand and the screen is beautiful. There are many features that are not spoken of on the product information that I believe are real selling points. First this is one of the few phones I have seen that has a notification LED at this price point. Second the cover in the packaging is a smart cover and not just some gel casing. This allows you to see the time and notifications as well as control music without opening the cover. When the cover is opened the phone unlocks. Lastly the front facing camera has a flash. Finally someone is doing it at this price point and there are plenty of more expensive phones without that. Android 5.1 seems to be smoother than the 5.0 on my previous phone but that could also be the 2Gb of Ram vs the 1GB of Ram which again you hardly ever see at this price point. I'll update once I put some time in.

Purchased this phone looking for an upgrade and I was very pleased. Great phone!!  Battery life is good, screen display is excellent and processor is very snappy nothing slow about it.  If there is one donwside to this device it's the speaker. Low quality but decent enough to get you what you need.  I would recommend for anything looking to upgrade. I would buy again.

Hard to complain about anything other than the lack of gyro. It is fast. It has enough memory for the average use and plenty through sd card expansion. I only wish they had released Marshmallow by now. The screen is incredible; If there were a gyro, this would be the perfect VR phone. Still, 3D movies are great through it, and you can ignore the slight pixelation pretty easily. Occasionally it gets very hot when charging at night. The included screen protector was horrible and didn't cover the whole screen. The device beautiful.

*Was* very happy with my purchase of this phone - this was my second Blu phone I tried (the first one Vivo XL stopped transmitting data after 2 weeks) and had several problems that have been listed in the comments. Screen turning on while being on the phone, overheating, unresponsive screen, after a couple of days it would become unresponsive, meaning I would have to press an app several times before it loaded it up, keys would be missed while typing, multitasking would crawl, press pause on the music and have to wait for the music to pause. It became frustrating using the phone and I went back to my Motorola Droid Turbo - Blu customer support, although polite, was very little help. They asked me to do a factory reset, which I did with no change, then they said they would email me instructions on how to do a 'hard factory reset' which I never received but found instructions online on how to do it, without any remedy. Thank you Amazon for having such a great return policy!
Phone has more than met my expectations. Didn't rate it a 5 only because neither of the two cases I got with the phone is usable, both obstruct the camera.
Bad phone  stopped  working  after 45 days

It's great value for the money, a very pretty and fast smart phone that almost looks like an iphone 6 from several angles.  Its one critical flaw is it sucks down battery juice like a full size SUV loves gas.  Guess I'll have to buy one of those battery recharger sticks for long days at work.

It is a Buggy nightmare.
At first it was fast, sleek, responsive, and just what I was looking for, then the problems started.
Just to name a few:
This phone doesn't allow for background apps and has no settings option that would allow it so you won't get notifications from some messaging apps even with the notifications turned on.
I was in a phone call and instead of call waiting it rang in my ear, and because I was in a phone call I couldn't turn it off or end the second incoming call.
the proximity sensor is horrible, I called my voicemail while in another call and both calls were active at the same time but I couldn't hang up with either.
This phone is great for a high school kid but horrible for an adult that needs to use it for work.  I was tired of apologizing to people that I was talking to so this phone was returned within 3 weeks of purchase.

I bought 2 of these (one black and one white) when it was on sale for $100 each.  I have owned few Blu phones in the past and decided to give this a try.  I've had both good and bad experiences with Blu devices in the past...I had bought Blu Life Pure Mini (both black and white) and loved it except for 4 things...GPS did not work, I couldn't do group message with any iphone users because the lack of MMS group option, lack of any firmware upgrades, and inability to add the memory.  WELL, this new phone fixed all those issues.

1.  GPS - very accurate

2.  Battery - I was worried first few times I charged the battery on this device because it took 5 hrs to get from 0% to 85% the first time...and first few times I was able to charge to 100%, it would drain down to 95% within few minutes of turning the device on.  After I went through few cycles of charging, I am able to do 100% in about 4 hrs and the charge seems to hold now.  I have no problems with the battery life after the few initial cycles.  I've owned LG G2 which had 3000 mah battery and it about the same, which is good.

3.  Screen - Very bright and impressive.  The glass is also very slick and has curved edges, like an iphone 6.  Touch is responsive and feels like much more expensive phone.

4.  Connectivity -  I had no problem connecting this phone to several of the Bluetooth devices.  It also connected to all the wifi spots I could find.  I did have some problems playing 1080p Youtube videos using the Tmobile LTE as it kept trying to buffer every 30 seconds or so...I used the Samsung Galaxy S4 in the same spot and it had no problems playing the 1080p videos.  I lowered the resolution to both 720 and 480p resolution and it didn't have any problems.

5.  Camera - for a budget phone, this phone has very good cameras.  Front even has a flash built-in although it really didn't help brighten anything up past few feet.  Camera is fairly quick and pictures came out great.

6.  Speaker - The rear mounted speaker is very small...it's hard to hear anything if you have some background noise.  It's not horrible but it will give you a bad time if you rely on your external speakers for lots of things like music or conference calls...I was able to increase the speaker volume slightly by swiping 2 fingers down from the top and on the lower left corner, picked the "outdoor" option under Audio profiles.

7.  Overall value - For $150 this phone is really hard to beat.  The feel is really nice (except for the back plastic cover but when a TPU case comes out, it won't be an issue) and feels almost premium.  I'm upgrading few of my back-up phones (Samsung Galaxy S4 and LG G2) with these 2 phones and I feel like it's really an upgrade.  If this phone had a finger print scanner and guaranteed upgrade in firmware, they won't be able to keep this phone in stock for $150.  Like I posted earlier, I was able to pick these up at $100 each and this phone can't be beat.
Nice phone. Charming HD display

Well this is my first review and I will do because I think it's worth mentioning a couple of things about this phone that people have not mentioned and might make you change your minds or not.

Look and Feel: Light, it weighs nothing but good construction, but in the rear, the cover has a few sectors that are like open and gives the impression that is not perfectly adjust to the phone (not alarming). The edge of "metal" does not appear to metal, but rather a plastic alloy with who knows who, who gives some sense to metal, but it is okay. The power and volume buttons, are in good positions, and give good tactile feel, easy to push and give a sense of quality.

Performance: Excellent for the price, with 2GB of RAM and a processor 8-core Cortex A53 (like Snapdragon 615) can move any app smoothly, Facebook, twitter, whatsapp, Instagram, Vine, snapchat, Amazon app, all Google Apps and more, multitasking goes well and you can switch between apps without problems. Sometimes it hangs, do not know why, maybe it's incompatibility with Mediatek processor, high load, or just a crash, nothing serious but happens. Although for that price I do not think you can ask more to this phone, for example the competition, moto G 2015 has a Snapdragon 410 are 4-core Cortex A53 and 1GB of RAM, and moves well, here you will receive better or equal performance. Some casual games are also run pretty good, I do not think they have a problem with that.

Battery: (This section is the one that has disappointed me and I'll tell you why). The 2900mAh battery is great. Quite large, which can last the whole day with average use, some youtube videos, much whatsapp, vines, instagram, snapchat and facebook, text messages, calls and some other basic stuff. I've gotten from 6am until 830pm, about 4 hours of screen time. You may ask, what worries me or do not like. The charging time of the battery. 4 to 5 hours to achieve 100% load battery of this smartphone and I do not understand why. The charger that comes with this phone has an output of 5V-1A which seemed to me to allow me to charge my phone at 2:30 minutes approximately, maybe a little more, which obviously was not. Then i think, well, the battery is large enough, perhaps with a charger that has an output of 5V-2A can achieve a better result, connect it to my Powerbank Aukey QC2.0 and nothing. Ok this phone does not have QC2.0 but the powerbank can make use of an output of at least 5V-2A when QC2.0 not present. But no, this is not the case.

The truth is an excellent phone, for me it was perfect and unbeatable with that price, $ 99, but, for me, this failure when is charging, makes me leave this review somewhat angry and disappointed. Concedible to me is not having to spend 5 hours a day charging the phone to use it as I want. Maybe not a problem for some, for others maybe yes, but I think worth mentioning. You must know what u face before buying this phonet, I unfortunately did not read anything about it only good reviews about the performance and all the good price and the phone but nothing said nothing about this little detail which is pretty big for me .

Ok, I just received this item last night.  Perhaps I'll revise this review over time.  However, for the fantastic price, I am getting a phone which is a marked improvement over my $359 Oneplus One I bought just over 15 months ago.  Call quality is excellent.  Bluetooth connectivity is easy and excellent.  The dual SIM feature will be a godsend, because my company has been pressuring me to carry a second phone and I'd rather not.  64gb on a removable sd card is more than enough.  2gb of internal memory is adequate as well.  The screen quality and brightness are excellent, and though others have complained, the sound is plenty loud (though not in Stereo).

I no longer believe that the few new and esoteric features made available in high-end phones in the last year justify 3x the price or more.  This phone more than does the job.  I am a fairly high-end user (I often download documents and spreadsheets for review), and this phone meets all of the basic requirements to be my "daily driver".

Of course it lacks the additional software of the overpriced phones but still delivers. Whit this purchase I don't think I can buy a $700 phone anymore.

A month and a half in and the phone started going black multiple times.  Would have to hold power button down to restart. Reset and it still did it so not app related. Hasn't been dropped. Warranty is very short. With so many choices in the budget phone category, think twice on this one.

The phone drops your signal every two seconds. Makes it hard to call/text/do anything....

Touch screen is VERY unresponsive. While viewing a page, trying to scroll up and down you'll inadvertently "click" on things you never intended to select. This unresponsiveness makes texting unbearable.

First, I just want to say that I really wanted to like this phone. I love when companies like BLU come out with a device with amazing specs for very reasonable prices.

I used this phone for about 3 weeks, but then decided to return it because of quite a few issues. The first thing I did when I got the phone was set it up and download the OTA update, which was suppose to improve battery life and a few other issues. However, the issues I ran into were:

1. The headphone jack made static noises. I used two different headphones as well as two different aux cables (one in my car, one in my friend's car). The static noises were constant with the aux cables, and the static noises came and went while using the headphones.

2. The bluetooth was extremely choppy. When synced to my car, the music would continue to play on my phone, but would have choppy playback through my car speakers. My previous phone (Alcatel Idol 3) did not have this issue, nor did my other friends' phones when played in my car.

3. The screen was jumpy. Sometimes when I turned on the screen to swipe in my password the screen wouldn't properly register my touch. I would have to turn the screen off then turn it back on again for it to work. Also, when typing on the keyboard it was often jumpy, requiring to type --> delete a word or two I did not input --> type some more -- > delete another word or two I did not input, etc.

4. I would set my alarm volume to the loudest setting. However, if you reboot your phone once you have your alarms set, then the alarm volume would return to the original settings, which was the lowest sound, and you will not hear your alarms in the morning.

5. The battery life was not the best, but it was not absolutely terrible. Charging times were ridiculously long however, even with the update.

6. The speaker was terrible. I did not mind when using it for music, but when using speakerphone the other caller's voice would be pretty distorted making it hard to understand what they were saying.

7. The camera was all right, but took blurry pictures if you were not outside in a lighted area.

I did like: how thin and light the phone was, the accessories that came with it, the fact that it did not lag (even though I downloaded 20+ apps), the screen quality, and the notification light. The front camera also had an LED light which is not something you see on too many phones except flagship phones.

Again, I really wanted to like this phone, but after too many issues I decided to return it (thankfully Amazon has a great return policy).

For such a low price, this phone is outstanding. However, don't think that this phone can outperform the high end android smartphones. The phone lags a lot of sometimes, but in the end you have to keep in mind that it is indeed a budget friendly phone. However, as a budget friendly phone, it kills all other budget phones in the market.

Excellent budget phone -- much better than another well rated budget phone -- the Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime.  Crisp, bright display, responsive hardware, near-stock Android 5.1.  Compared with the Samsung Grand Prime:

--  Lighter, slightly taller and a bit wider
--  Much clearer HD screen
--  Gorilla Glass 3 screen (Samsung does not note special glass)
--  Faster and seems to multitask much better
--  Bluetooth streaming audio better quality and more volume
--  Dual-sim capability
--  FM Radio
--  Nice case is included.  Also like the texture standard back compared to the slippery Samsung.

Some downsides so far:

--  No VOLTE or WiFi calling capability (Samsung does)
--  Phone call quality not as clear
--  Onboard speaker weak and unclear  (streaming audio is great, however)
--  Camera shutter response is slow and delayed with flash on
--  Placement of the camera lens annoying -- easy for finger interference
--  Low light pictures grainy
--  Video poor at 1080p with noticeable choppiness -- 720p recording is better  (Samsung video is smoother)

Both are very slow to connect on phone calls, which is strange.  For those on T-Mobile, this phone does support Band 12, like the Samsung.

Someone said that the HD screen on the Blu Life One X is comparable to the IPhone 6s -- it is not -- both the 6s and the 6s Plus have superior screens.  But for an sub $200 phone, this is an excellent GSM phone.

My review is based on the price point and features of the cell phone.

After testing the data speed and graphics processing of this phone, I am impressed with the performance. The voice call clarity is excellent and my callers commented on how sharp the audio was at their end of the call. The phones weight and touch feels comfortable in the hand, and it did not get hot while operating. I also like that you can change the navigation/back button to be on the right or left side.
The Display is very bright and clear and easily compares to my sons IPhone 6 Plus which costs at least 3 times as much.
Battery life is relative to what you do with the phone, but with medium to high use (voice+data), I am able to get the advertised amount of charge which for me averaged about 16 hours, but could easily be extended by using the power saving options in the settings.

The only challenges I had with the phone was related to the Android Lollipop OS, which after investigation would have occurred on other cell phones running  the same OS. (FYI- when using custom ringtones with lollipop you will need to place the custom ringtone in the phones ringtone folder using a file manager app or connecting to a PC and using windows explore). Note: BLU will be upgrading the OS to Marshmallow in March.

I highly recommend this phone for the value based on it's capabilities.

For the price, you simply can't go wrong with the BLU Life One X.  Enjoy!

This phone is a winner in every way.  I have a lot of phones; you could almost call me a collector.  I got this for my wife who was always having non-issues with her Meizu Note 2 (just wait until they come to the US) and wanted  untainted Android, not the highly worked over Flyme interface of the Meizu that was baffling at times. The LOX gave me that simple interface and is buttery smooth and never falters or stutters. I had it up and running and tweaked for power usage very quickly. While I admit that there are always some units in any production run that get a faulty component, I wonder how many issues reported in these reviews are from people who maybe need to dig a little deeper for a fix rather than trash the phone right away. Of all of the Android phones I have had over the years, and the six I have at the moment, not a single one of them came with a bad component.  I had some confusing issues no doubt, but never sent one back.  Not to say it can't happen, just never to me. Now, whats to like?
* The shape and size is just great. Easier to read than a five inch without being any wider and easier to text on than a 5.5 that can be a stretch in landscape texting and a stretch to get in some pockets. It's about as big as you can go for a one hander. The 5.2" screen at that pixel density puts it in high end territory. Yea, I like Amoled but it's not a game changer for me.
* Build quality is right on par with the best of them. Just about all phones are made in China, even the iPhone and manufacturers have been in heated competition for years and it's just plain hard to find a junky phone at any price point except the very cheapest. The Gorilla glass screen protection utilizes the 2.5 arc design which is a very nice design touch and adds to the quality build. Decent sized bezels add to the look.
* The included flip case is really quite nice and I put it on for my wife after I set the phone up. It is not white like the phone, rather a cream color with umber tones that make it blend with the gold color of the aluminum body frame. The phone comes set up with the cover mode activated and that effects the action of the proximity sensor. One of the common complaints with this phone is "bad" proximity sensors. If you are not going to use the cover, head to the Personalize section of settings and deactivate it. While there, put it in pocket mode to increase the ringer volume when the cover is on or when the phone is buried somewhere.
*Connectivity is great. Strong wi-fi and bluetooth connections. Have not tried the GPS yet but have three other Mediatek 64 bit powered phones and their GPS performance is right there with the Qualcom offerings. Best of all is the antenna performance. I live in a crappy area for reception and it's always been a bit dicey getting any decent signal. I am using Cricket and LTE Discovery is reporting  -99 Db LTE reception on band 17 and I am absolutely thrilled as everything just works faster including MMS messaging which is often shaky with Cricket. GSM signal strength is also much stronger. For many people, this should be reason enough to consider this phone. Like many others, the default Cricket APN settings were wrong so I immediately made the changes to that APN.
*Sound is right in the middle of the pack. Not totally crappy and not totally great. I used engineering mode to boost the speaker output a bit and it worked out well.  With quality ear buds like the Xiaomi Hybrids, you can tell that Blu did not take a shortcut with the DSP circuitry.
* I have not really run the camera through its paces but in the few shots I did take, focus times were lightening fast and so is the shutter speed. The pictures all looked plenty good to my non-professional eye.  This is one spot where the high end phones will have an advantage as they simply have better sensors, lens and photo processors that are too expensive for this phone.  If I have any changes in my opinion, I will update.
*As for the battery life, so far I have nothing to complain about.  I got it fired up at one on Saturday and it showed 63% available.  I pushed it really hard until I went to bed at 10:30 and it had 38% showing.  I fully expect more than one full day with moderate use and personally could not drain it in a normal day unless I turned on GPS, bluetooth, Google Now and had notifications pushing for Whatsap and Facebook plus watching a lot of video. Charge time?  I don't care as I have to sleep every day so it goes on the charger then. This phone uses a lithium polymere battery vs lithium ion used in more expensive phones like my Zenfone 2 (my favorite) and should not be over amped. In fact, the lower charge rate will probably help you battery last longer and extend the phone's lifespan.
I ask you again, what's not to like?
Nice for the price came from a I-phone not missing it at all .

I love this phone. I have always been a fan of Blu and their phones and this doesn't disappoint in the least. First off, the phone runs on near stock  Android 5.1 Lollipop skin, which is a step above some other skins that Blu has stuck on other quality phones The phones display is perfect for one handed use and gets really bright and falirly dim. And for the price, the 1080p HD, 5.2 in. screen is unbeatable. The front 5 megapixel camera takes great selfies and the flash that comes with it works great. The rear 13 megapixel camera has great detail and is an overall great camera. If you are looking for one that rivals an iPhone or a Samsung Galaxy s6, this won't, but for $150, the camera is great. The 1.3 gigahertz octa-core processor works miracles. It is surprisingly quick and snappy with little lag. The two gigs of ram in tow help that along very nicely. It comes with 16 gb of storage onboard, but I have an extra sd card already installed. The audio quality (which often gets overlooked) is pretty good. The audio jack, which is located on the top of the phoen, gets too loud for me to put it on the loudest setting, which is a huge plus for riding in cars or flying. The given headphones do their job, but I will going off to the store soon and getting a better quality set. The right side fits fine and the left one doesn't seal in my ear. I am an audiophile and that drives me insane. The bass needs to be boosted for me and thankfully you can do that in the provided equalizer found in the music app through the settings. The speaker is somewhat quiet, like others have said, but it should not be a deal breaker. You can still adequately hear it for ringtones and videos in many different environments. The build quality is great and rivals high-end phones. The faux leather finish on the back is very Samsung Galaxy note 3 esque, which is not a bad thing at all. It adds good grip and doesn't pick up fingerprints at all. The air-brushed metal frame and the 2.5D curved screen really adds to the phones experience. The buttons on the side are metal (or so they seem) and have a nice clicky-ness when pressed. The phone comes with a high quality flip-cover case that does its job. It overlaps on the sides protecting it from bumps and minor falls, but don't expect it to protect it from concrete or hard floors. The notifications, time, and music player can be found through the opening in the front of the cover. The screen can be turned on and off a couple of different ways. It can be turned on by clicking the power button, double tapping the screen, or opening the cover on the case. It can be turned off by clicking the power button, double tapping the home button, or closing the cover. This phone is loaded with plenty of quality features and rivals the Asus Zenfone 2, Alcatel onetouch Idol 3, and blows the Moto G 3rd gen out of the water. This phone is definitely the phone for people that don't want to pay out the nose for an amazing phone.

I am very happy with this phone, it performs very well (I am with MetroPCS). the camera is very good. Has plenty of built in memory. it doesn't come with very many unwanted apps. First, let me say that this phone is an incredibly terrific value, even if it were for sale at a $300 price point. (I mean that) Rather than tell you all about the goodness, let me start with the very few negative points of the phone.....if any are showstoppers for you, stop reading.

1. If you buy a white one, the rear soft-feel cover gets very dirty, very quickly.
2. The phone does not have NFC, so you cannot use phone payment apps like google wallet at the cash register.
3. The WIFI is not dual-band. Might be an issue for those who work or live in very congested 2.4 ghz wifi areas.  Not a problem if you don't.
4. The camera is very good.....but only fair in low light.

That's it.  That's all.  Now I will tell you just the high points of my experience with the phone.  If I don't talk about a certain capability, assume the phone is totally competent there.

1.  The 5.2 inch, 1080P display is brilliant and gorgeous.  Just a GREAT, GREAT display.
2.  The phone has 4G LTE Band 12.  If you are a T-Mobile user, that means you get their ultra-fast long range 4G data stream where it is deployed.
3  For a 5.2 inch phone, the overall outside dimensions of the phone are very manageable in your hand. Awesome feel and balance.
4. At my usage level (High-moderate), the battery life is very good.....each evening as I shut it down, there is between 25-30% battery life left.  I have never had a low battery warning with the phone.
5. The phone is fast.

I bought one of these phones for my wife.....I got her a black one with a blue translucent case.  The phone's appearance is awesome.  My white one is pretty, but that back cover bugs me a bit.  IMHO, there is nothing about this phone to detract from a 5-star rating.  Please, please do not buy any Apple product until you handle this phone.  You will not regret it.....and you will have TONS of cash left over for H & B.  Peace!

At first this seemed like a great phone. The spec sheet hits all the right points - 2 GB of RAM, expandable storage, 8-core (!!!) processor, 1080p screen. But as I started using it, I noticed some quirks and problems that I believe are due to the odd Mediatek CPU.

Podcasts would not resume from their correct place. This happened even after restarting or using different podcast apps. If I paused a podcast and didn't resume within a minute or two, upon hitting resume it would take me back to a few minutes after the start of it. Luckily the app PodcastAddict includes an optional workaround for this very issue (the only podcast app I've found that has it). So that's taken care of.

Don't be fooled by the 8-core CPU. Demanding games cause slowdowns and stuttering. If you want to play games you'll have to turn off the music because otherwise it will slow down and sound awful. Even more mundane CPU tasks like adjusting podcast playback speed was enough to cause audio artifacts and skips in the sound. The audio problems went away as soon as I turned off audio adjustments.

I could live with those problems since there were workarounds, but what killed it was when the screen developed a dead zone, a vertical stripe right through the center making it nearly impossible to use. Luckily this happened just a couple days after I got it, so I'll be returning this phone and getting something else. I can't help but think the low price should have been a warning sign.

This is a great phone. It succeeds at giving you near flagship performance, and build quality at a fraction of the price.

Screen resolution, brightness, and contrast are phenomenal. Battery life is adequate for a full day of moderate to heavy usage. LTE and Wi-Fi reception are fantastic. Most phones in this price range have half the LTE band support the Life One X has. Both of it's cameras provide really nice photos in good lighting. The nearly stock, bloat free android 5.1 experience is very snappy.

Most of my gripes about the Life One X are minor. It does take a while to charge. As other reviewiers have noted,  it takes about six hours to charge fully, so, you'll need to plug it in every night. The loud speaker is underwhelming. It's really nice that it comes with a decent case and a screen protector. But my screen protector seems to be about two millimeters too narrow. It leaves a small gap of unprotected visible screen on either side.

Overall this is a great buy. I would purchase it again.
