I have only had this one for about a month, but here is my quick review. I am not into all the fancy features that most phones offer. I am not sure what exactly the Galaxy or Nexus or iPhone have as far as real nifty stuff, but if you just want a phone that:

runs quick
has all android apps
calls
texts
plays music

Than this is the phone for you. I have bought higher end phones and spent $500+ each time only to get a year, maybe two out of them (so about $250 a year cost). Then they come out with new tech, the once flagship becomes obsolete and its time for a new one. Waste of time and money imo. Before this I also had a blackberry and not only was it expensive and very glitchy but it didn't really have any apps. It was good at multitasking, calling, and emailing though (and even let you listen to music on youtube while you did something else, which this phone does not).

The phone is surprisingly fast. Again, I haven't had it for long, but assuming it doesn't have a major hardware failure (such as touchscreen), if I can get a year out of this phone with this type of speed and functionality, at $149 it is already a better buy than those expensive flagships.

The camera works fine. The Operating system works fine. I do not like the sealed in battery, but all new phones are coming out like that now.

Comes with a nice leather sheath and a screen protector. I already ruined the screen protector and I like this sheath but I am not sure where to find new ones.

I don't think BLU's customer service is very good, to be honest. I have emailed them and not heard back about some items... but, again, if the phone runs like this for a year, I would be happy. I have friends with S6's and Nexuses, and this phone is up there in speed. Maybe those are a little faster, but it isn't worth the $400 difference in cost in my opinion.

**Update 2-14-16**  After having this phone for over a month I still think that it is a great phone for the price, however, I think the Vivo XL is better (see my review of the Vivo XL).  The Life One X has a phenomenal screen, dual SIM, and expandable storage.  All features that are great.  However, after a month of usage here are my complaints.  1) The speaker on the back is bad, the Vivo XL has a much louder/clearer speaker.  2) The processor has trouble keeping up from time to time, which is expected at this price point, but the Vivo XL (which has the same processor) does not stutter nearly as often.  3). The proximity sensor does not work as it should on the Life One X.  I regularly found myself pocket dialing people or accidentally hanging up on people because the proximity sensor wasn't working 100% perfectly.

This is still a great phone for $149, but fory money the Vivo XL is the better buy.

**Start of original review**

A little background: I like to try just about every phone.  This includes high end, mid-range, and budget phones.  The Blu Life One X falls into the budget category for me.  Other budget phones I have owned: Moto G 2015 (16gb/2gb), Alcatel One Touch Idol 3.

To start, I purchased this phone for $99 during the promotional period on Amazon.  With that being said, I believe this phone is easily worth spending $149 on.  In my opinion this is the best budget phone you can buy right now.

I have had my hands on the Blu Life One X for just about a week and here are my thoughts on what is good, what is good enough, and what isn’t so good about the phone:

First the good:
The 5.2” 1080p display is excellent.  It gets very bright, and the colors are adjustable using the Miracast option in the display settings.  In my opinion this screen size is just about perfect, big enough to see easily, and small enough for one handed usage.
The battery life on this phone is excellent.  At the end of a long day of moderate to heavy usage I still have 20-25% battery.
The extras that come with the low price tag.  The fact that you get a pretty nice case and screen protector with the phone at this price is phenomenal.  Personally I dislike plastic screen protectors, but I didn’t pay anything extra for it, so I can’t complain.
The front-facing camera takes excellent selfies in every lighting setting.  The front firing flash helps this phone to even take great selfies at night.  Personally I am not a selfie person, but if you are, this phone takes great ones.
The build quality of this phone far outweighs its price.  It reminds me a lot of a Note 4 with the metal sides and pleather backing.
SD card expansion on this phone is better than normal.  Blu has found a way to allow you to default all your storage to the micro SD card.  With my 32gb high end SD card I now have 48gb of storage on this phone.
The software that Blu has put on this phone is basically stock Android.  This is important to me.  What they add on top of stock Android is useful and not bulky.  All of the extra apps can be uninstalled.

Good enough:
The 13mp camera on the back is decent.  It certainly does not compare to the quality of cameras on high end phones like the Iphone 6s or Note 5, but in good lighting it takes great pictures, and in less than ideal lighting it takes good enough pictures.
The video quality is also decent.  It will take 1080p video, but doesn’t include any kind of stabilization, so you will need to hold your hand still when shooting videos.
The processor on this phone will not blow you away with it’s speed, but it will also not disappoint you either.  I have yet to run into issues of significant lag with this phone.  Prior to this phone I had a Nexus 5x, and this phone honestly has less lag than the Nexus 5x, but still does not compete with the speed of my Nexus 6p.  This was the major flaw of the Alcatel Idol 3, it is a great phone, but the lag on that phone was unacceptable.
Call quality on the Blu Life One X is good, not great, but good.  I have no problem hearing those I’m talking to, and they seem to hear me fine as well.

Not so good:
The speaker for the phone isn’t terrible, but it isn’t good either.  I am all about front firing speakers, and I wish that this would become the norm… unfortunately it’s not, and the Blu Life One X not only has a rear firing speaker, but it’s only a average speaker at that.
While the battery life is good, as others have mentioned, it takes an abnormally long time to charge.  My solution… charge it overnight and it will easily last through the next day.

The final verdict:
This phone is the best budget phone you can get even at $149.  For $99 it feels like a steal.  As someone who has owned 80% of the high end phones out there, I feel like this phone is a real game changer.  Keep up the good work Blu, if you continue to make phones like this, I will continue to buy them.  This phone will not replace my Nexus 6p (which in my opinion is the best phone available), but for someone on a budget it is amazing!
Came in perfect conditions. The phone it's fast, great screen and excellent battery life.

Cons: has automatically hard reset 2 or 3 times causing me to lose photos saved to phone, head phone jack has static when plugged into audio in on my car, battery life has significantly diminished in just two months of owning phone (no longer lasts an entire day compare to first 2-3 weeks), charging port, which is reversed and not centered seems trivial, but is extremely annoying as it's very difficult to plug in when it's dark/night (ie bedtime), haven't figured this out despite it being my 8th android phone, but alarms (vibrate or sound or both) don't go off during silent mode - the screen just flashes

Overall: great specs for the price, but there are serious deficiencies that prevent it from even being a 4 star phone. Thank god I managed to get it when it was still $99. I've already returned one because of the headphone jack issue, appears to be the design of the phone.

The whole reason I bought this phone is because I wanted to upgrade from a crappy Galaxy Core Prime that I was stuck after my iPhone 5c finally broke down on me after almost 2 years.
The low cost of this phone attracted me, as I had read a few reviews that praised the phone as being one of the best budget phones.

First off, the call quality is good and the 4G LTE on T-Mobile works excellently. Below I will explain the other features of the device.

Packaging
The phone comes packaged with the charger, a set of ear buds, a cheap screen protector (the phone has Gorilla Glass) and a faux leather flip case with a little window.

Design
the phone looks kinda like a cross between a Note 4 and an iPhone 6.
It has a plastic rear cover with a fake leatherlike texture, and the frame is made from high-quality aluminum and feels very good in the hand.
It looks MUCH better if you actually see one than in the pictures here.

Display
The display is a 5.2 inch Full HD (1080p) IPS LCD panel.
To put it simply, it looks gorgeous. Colors are vivid and crisp, and the screen is also pretty bright even at minimum brightness.
In the settings, you can use Miravision to adjust the display. I like to keep it on Vivid Mode, it makes the colors really pop out.
I also noticed that the touchscreen is very responsive, which is nice.

Performance
The phone uses an Octa-core Mediatek chip clocked at 1.3 GHz with 2 GB of RAM.
For pretty much any task, the phone preforms very well. In the 3 days that I've used it so far, I've noticed no major lag and webpages load pretty quickly.
Gaming is also surprisingly good here. I was able to play Mortal Kombat X and Dead Trigger 2. They never lagged unless a bunch of stuff was going on at the same time, then it would slow down for a few seconds.

Battery Life
The 2900 mAh battery is unfortunately sealed in, but battery life is pretty good. I am able to get just under 5 hours of screen-on time with what I would describe as moderately heavy use.
Many other people with this phone are apparently having issues with the phone taking a long time to charge.
Using the included charger, I have only charged the phone once so far (from 21% to 98%) and it took a little less than 2 hours to charge. Apparently the slow charging is an issue with most people, but so far I see no real problem seeing as how the battery is good enough to last me the whole day with more than 20% to spare, so I can just charge it overnight no problem.

Storage
The phone has 16GB of storage (10 is available out of the box), and you can use a MicroSD up to 64GB.

Overall, I think that this is a very good phone.
I personally like it. It's not a match for a flagship like the Galaxy S6 or LG G4, but for $150 you're getting some serious bang for your buck here.

The screen saver come with the package will not fit. battery life get worse since the recent wireless system update, which suppose to improve battery life. BLU should do some more QA before releases update.
Another thing is, just stop including cheap headphone already BLU. it costs you money, and the included headphone is POS no one will ever use.
Overall it is an above average phone for $149, and it was a fantastic deal for the $99 promotion price tag when it was first launched. Also I start to see some after market accessory for this phone available, that is a good thing.
Hopefully this phone's battery lasts. I had bad experience with other BLU phone's battery.
If this phone last for a year, I will come back to make it 5 stars.

I love this phone and finally I have bought a Blu phone that can be connected to my Fiio E07K Andes USB DAC and Portable Headphone Amplifier Fiio E07K Andes USB DAC and Portable Headphone Amplifier Black with an OTG cable without having to root the phone and use the noisy headphone jack. For those of you who are serious music lovers, this allows me to drive my Audio-Technica ATH-M50 headphones or any headphones properly.with the best possible sound digitally from the phone. As for the normal phone functions they are great too and the included folding case is actually better than I thought it would be in use. I was not sure if I would have liked it but after dropping and smashing two previous Blu phones, I really prefer the wrap around case. It folds right bak on itself so you can use the phone normally. The phone and case which replaces the phone's rear cover is extremely thin so the folded back case does not make the phone bulky at all. It charges really quick in my opinion compared to my other phones. This is my first octo-core phone and it is fast enough for me. As usual the dual sim feature and now 4G speed for the data is superb. Web pages and streaming services work fine. Loaded with a 64 GB SD card I have all of the music and media I need for entertainment on the go. I am really happy with this purchase.

Positives:
- Nice screen
- Nice form factor

Negatives:
- The media player couldn't remember my place in any podcast from the Podcast Addict or Pocket Casts apps. Or even Spotify
- The screen quite often becomes non-responsive. To the point that I couldnt even unlock the phone with a gesture
- Audio quality on phone calls is just terrible
- Plugging it into my car's aux cable greeted me with tons of static that wouldn't go away

Really disappointed that I lost over 100 bucks on this phone. I'll never trust BLU again.

The Good:
I was actually quite surprised by the quality of this phone.  I was expecting a much cheaper feel.  It feels very solid in the hand.  I was showing some people at work and they were surprised as well given the price.The folio case and the textured back are nice bonuses.  I have been using the folio case while I wait for a slim case to arrive.  The phone works very well with it.  The battery life has been outstanding so far.  I am looking at 2+ plus days of my normal use on a full charge.  I will admit that I am a light user for the most part but I have a lot of screen on time checking messages and multiple email accounts.  Almost all preinstalled apps can be removed except 2 from BLU.  I have not noticed any heat issues at any point.  I run waze while driving and charge at the same time.

I am using the phone on TMobile and reception is good.  I pick up 4g almost everywhere I go which is an 80 mile stretch of mixed driving of interstate and county roads.

The bad:
It takes forever to charge.  No joke.  Don't be in a hurry and need to charge your phone.  You might as well plan on charging it overnight if it is anywhere close to low.  I have also been having some issues with swiping keyboards.  It starts registering my swipes as clicks and things get messy.  I have noticed it in other places as well.  I hope its software based and gets fixed soon.

The volume and power buttons are also placed weird.  I find myself constantly pressing the power button while handling the phone.  Since its pretty much in the middle of the frame, my car mount squeezes the power button if I'm not paying attention.  The micro USB port is also offset on the bottom which also caused issues for my car mount since it has a piece to rest the bottom of the phone on.  It's right where the USB port is.

Overall:
Seems like a good phone so far.  I am waiting to hold judgement until I have owned it for awhile.

I posted below comment earlier on January 22, 2016 about the battery drainage issue but recently I had an update on Wi-Fi software and it has dramatically improved the battery life now. Now I am revising the rating to 4 star now. Still I am holding to the below changes to keep the battery charge for longer.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I am using this phone for last 6 days and I have observed its battery charging time is very slow and drainage is fast.I did following changes to improve the battery life
1. I have disabled or uninstalled all default apps like amazon, google apps (except gmail, search, maps and drives), opera, touchpal, games, etc.
2. Disabled auto sync of applications
3. Turned OFF Wi-Fi instead using 4G.
I am keeping it under observation for battery life. If it is not improving then I have to return it without any choice.
Except battery I will rate this phone as Excellent budget smart phone although speaker volume is not very loud.
If I am satisfied then I will change the rating later.

All of my previous smartphones are in great shape after roughly a year and a half of use per device. This phone is falling apart after a month. Unbelievable. I'm furious.

I was extremely disappointed! I owned (and absolutely loved) the BLU STUDIO 5" C HD in hot pink, for the past few years. THAT phone was resilient, sturdy, fast, gorgeous and everything you want in a smartphone. Therefore, I had high hopes for this newer Blu model. Not only did the Blu Life One X not meet any of my requirements, it actually set a new low. Here's 10 reasons to skip this model, not in any particular order.
  #1. The advertised 13mp camera is awful. I haven't got a single clear, bright or sharp picture. I also guarantee that this phone DOES NOT HAVE GORILLA GLASS, AS ADVERTISED! This screen looks like it will shatter with the slightest mishap. It has major issues reading touch unless fingers are (very) warm. As you'd imagine THAT isn't fortunate for me, seeing as I live in Alaska!
  #2. The stock Contacts and Dialer S U C K. There is one thing both can do- call. You click a contact, it calls. There's NO option to edit Contacts or add pictures, to block or add ringtones etc., etc.!
  #3. The screen protector provided IS NOT for this phone, it barely covers the actual part of the screen that lights up, let alone the whole screen! Maybe 60% is covered... a strip down the middle. HUGE FAIL! Besides being annoying its also pretty pointless. The edges of the glass screen are slightly curved so its possible that's why the protectors suck, but i doubt it since they stick just fine. I know since I first applied the screen protector starting from the top right corner before I sat back and saw half the screen left uncovered and vulnerable! The keyboards enter and backspace are only partially covered so the majority of the time it doesn't read when they're pressed. Add that onto the already horrible touch point reading and this review really took forever to write!!!
  #4. There are no cases. Along with the phone you get a cheap white flip cover that caused both my husband and I to nearly drop the phone numerous times. I searched all over online and even accidently ordered the wrong one since there is a "Blu life One", " Blu Life One X", and " Blu life One XL" and even though they look identical, they are vastly different. So yeah, lets do the math...  No cases+ No screen protectors = Broken phone.
  #5. When flip cover  case is on there at first glance is an "S Screen", like the Samsung Galaxy S smartphones have. NO. It is only a black and white clock that sucks battery.  No options to even change the color or disable.
  #6. THE BATTERY is the biggest issue by far. Advertised is this amazing, huge battery with some ridiculously embellished battery life statistics from talk time to idle battery use. These "statistics" are blatant lies! While using the phone, the battery LITERALLY continues to drain EVEN WHILE PLUGGED IN TO CHARGE! You have to turn screen off to charge and not touch it for at least 3-4 hours to get a full battery. THEN it dies in 45 minutes if you're shopping online or otherwise using it, and thats with the screens display turned 100% down and dimmed, with 10 second screen shut off if idle. THAT IS HORRIBLE! And I am so serious. I considered maybe my phone was just messed up but my husband bought one too and he has the same issues.
Lastly, something that isn't disclosed before buying is that you cannot pull the battery, it's built into phone. This is a huge design flaw for an android. These types of devices are like a computer, everything continues running in the background even after you've closed it. Every once in a while you're supposed to PULL THE BATTERIES for 30 seconds before restarting. That allows your device (phone) the opportunity to restart everything so all the "RAM" being used wont slow your phone down, or cause freezing. All you can do with this phone is restart it and cross your fingers it will help. As they age this will become a bigger and bigger issue, mark my words.
  #7. The android installed is the WORST made and so far 60% of the apps I've used and relied on for years, dont work on it. This includes every widget so far besides the lame white google search WHICH IS PERMANENT on your home, no removing.  The not working widgets also DEPRESSINGLY includes all APW widgets (android pro widgets) , wallpaper setting apps like wallpaper wizardrii, volume controls, status bar replacements, quite a few launcher replacement apps though thankfully my HOLO works... Ram cleaners and app closing apps do not work, including the pointless one included on device. Pretends to but upon opening settings youll see all apps open for hours with large ram and cache stores in use.
  #8. There is no menu, back or home buttons. Instead at the bottom of the screen there are permanent icons for back and home ONLY (NO MENU!!!) and of course it comes laid out so they're backwards (so back is on the left and home on the right). Without the menu button you can't manage apps, launcher, pages, etc. To close apps you have to go the long way through settings each time!
  #9. There is only 1 home screen. Apparently android tried copying apple, so to get a second page added to your home screen you have to go to the apps, hold and drag over to add a page. You HAVE to have at least one app on each page OR it automatically deletes the page. HATE HATE HATE!!

Okay, I doubt anyone will even read everything I wrote since normally you don't need 9+ reasons to avoid spending money on junk SOOO I am bowing out. Don't hesitate to ask any questions though and good luck! - Lyndsey

It's just amazingly smooth for the SoC that comes onboard I was shocked I mean it won't blow out benchmark scores but hell it's all about the user experience I have a OnePlusTwo and lags and freezes at times I think I will get an RMA replacement I'm pretty sure it's hardware.

This is the most expensive phone I've ever purchased. And I bought it due to the nice reviews I read here. That said, I see no need to keep watering a tree that's had all it needs from many others. Instead, I'll share how to "fix" an issue that another reviewer had with setting downloaded ring tones. His problem was that his downloaded ring tone kept reverting back to one of the stock ring tones the phone comes with.

Here's the solution for that:

Go into Settings --> Sound & notification. There's a menu in the upper right hand corner. Click it and select Add Audio Profile. I named mine My Ringtones. Just give it a name. From this new profile, you can set any ring tone you like.

And that's a poor man's contribution to those who might run into the same problem. Enjoy folks!

I purchased multiple of this device, and aside from a shipping fiasco, they turned out to be a worthwhile device for the price. One of them had the buttons (volume rocker and power button) fall off. Dealing with BLU customer service has been acceptable. I'm not too annoyed just because the value of the phone overall isn't offset by this inconvenience to me. However, I still realize that it might for others.

I ordered this phone and have nothing but issues with it.  Amazon decided that a returned phone that had been sold to someone else was considered new.  How do I know this?  Because whoever had the phone before me had performed some setups and had created a password so only they could unlock the phone!  So, to make a long story short, I have a phone that is totally worthless!  Thank you Amazon!

I got this phone when it was $99. and have been playing with it for the last few days. Here are the pros and cons:
Pros:
1. Speed: I don't notice any lag when using the phone, thanks to the 2GB memory.
2. Display: The 5.2-inch display is bright and vivid.
3. Dual SIM: both support LTE, plus a separate microsd slot. Some dual sim phones use the second SIM slot as a microsd slot (Huawei P8 lite, etc).
4. Software: close to pure Andriod OS, no bloatware (Asus ZenFone 2 comes to my mind here)
5. Battery life: with normal to light usage, I can use it for about one and half day.

Cons:
1. Speaker: as the other reviewers mentioned, the speaker is weak.
2. Call Quality: the voice sounds a little muffled, and sometime there is some static noise.
3. Camera: sometimes it is difficult to focus, especially on white objects, such as the back of a check. I am having trouble depositing checks because of this issue (tried Wells Fargo and a credit union). I am not sure if it is because I got a defective one or it is a bug in the design.

I really like the dual sim and separate microsd slot design. However, the camera issue bothers much. If you don't care about the camera, this could be the best budget phone with dual sim support.

[Update] The call quality is a false alarm. However, the camera turns out to be a deal-breaker for me. In the end I returned this phone.

It is a very good phone considering its price.  However, the BLU web update errors out and there was little support from the help line.  There was no response to my 'web request' and on the phone I was recommended to return the phone to Amazon.

Blu will not reply to my customer service request!!! The phone is a decent budget phone. The new Lenovo vibe lite s is a lot better phone for $50 more...but it might not come to the states. Either way there are comparable phones out there with NFC and a company that stands behind their products and values their customers.

I had an LG G3 that stopped making and receiving phone calls. I do not have an upgrade thru ATT till December.  I needed a smartphone that was roughly the same size, used ATT, that supported the apps I use for school. I was just about to give up and spend  about 300 on a refurbished iphone 5s, which I didn't want. At the last minute I saw this one, saw it had generally good reviews, and bought it.

I also bought the 32 gig micro SD card because the phone doesn't have very much storage room. It's 13 bucks, I recommend you get one.

When I got the phone, it was packaged safely and was in the original box from BLU. It comes with the phone (obvi), a charger, some headphones, a case and a screen protector.

The phone was at 56% when I received it and it was just enough battery to put all my stuff back on my phone and have it set up the way I had my LG G3 set up.

Google Play had an error- but signing out and signing back in fixed it.

The phone is great. It's light, sleek, stylish. At a distance, it could pass for the new iphone. I got the white, which has a gold border. It's nice, guys.

It's well made, doesn't feel like a cheap prepaid or chinese phone.

Now, after the phone died I plugged it up to charge. It got stuck in a loop of optimizing apps which worried me, but after I unplugged the charger and plugged it back in it quit. The phone charges VERY slow with the charger it came with. I switched to the charger my LG came with and it charged completely in about an hour.

Call quality is great, the headphone jack works perfectly without any static. The speakers are a little quiet, but it's really not an issue. I hooked it up with bluetooth in my car, the call quality and music works great. I then hooked it up with a aux cable and the music quality was still great with no static.

This phone is great. I planned on just using it till December when I could get a 'real' phone, but I like this one so much I don't think I'll switch to apple or back to LG. I really REALLY like this phone. It's solid and for a good price. There really isn't anything wrong with this phone. I'd say it's just as good or even better than androids carried by ATT. I prefer BLU to my LG, my Iphone, Xperia, galaxy, etc. I go through phones a lot.

If and when I break this one, I will be buying another. This is just too good of a deal to pass up.
Love this phone and can't beat the price.

If BLU makes good on their promise to upgrade the handset to Android 6.0 then it is a super deal.

I got it on the deal of the day and so far I see nothing bad about it. haven't had any issues, has a good camera. If your looking at it that means you don't want to spend 400- 800 on a phone. So I think that anyone who is looking for a good phone at a reasonable price then they would be happy with this.

Thought I'd try switching back to Android and this seemed like a great phone to try out. I've been using Windows for the last few years and love them, but the lack of apps is annoying.

I'm also a medium-heavier user, I read yahoo sports, check out instagram, twitter, check the weather, watch a little YouTube(a couple short videos), browse amazon, ebay, and some texting.

On to the life one x, this is a really nice mid-range phone. The build feels good in the hand, light but not cheap. I like both cameras (but honestly I'm not a camera guy/camera snob) but they both take really good pictures. The screen is beautiful, actually they could have scaled that back to 720, which would have improve the battery life. Moving on to the battery, this to me is the biggest down side of the phone. Don't get me wrong it doesn't ruin the phone, but I was not impressed. Especially after reading and watching a bunch of reviews saying that it had "a really good battery life"... It doesn't... It's average at best. I take it of the charger around 7:30ish am and by 3:00 pm I'm around 35-43% and that's from doing what I stated earlier. Now maybe to some that's good battery life or maybe I'm jaded coming from Windows, both my last two phones wouldn't be at 35-43% range til 930-10pm. So if you do what I stated earlier and more, just be prepared to charge it again before dinner. If your a lighter user or don't mind putting it back on charge than no big deal. Even given all this it's still not a deal breaker if you looking for a nice inexpensive phone. I will say the touch screen is a little sensitive and I open/click on stuff quite often by accident (going to take some getting use to). I've read a few reviews about there being no cases, Check eBay...Wiko Fever 4g...there are a couple TPU cases. I will also agree with other reviewer's that the speaker is not that great, volume wasn't really a issue for me, more the quality, still use able and get the job done....just not great. I'm also having trouble sending and receiving pictures (might be a carrier issue or something might be wrong with my model) I'll updated that later when I find out what's up, hopefully its something simple. As of now I'm giving it 4 stars depending on the sending and receiving pictures it could go down to 3. And if you wondering why I gave it 4 stars, I still like the phone and the price (I paid $149). Now if this was a 350-400 dollar phone I'd only give 2 and only 1 of it can't send pictures. Just remember what your paying for, your not buying a flagship device. So don't expect it to act like one.

Update: I did end up fixing the issue, it was the APN, (if you don't know what that is, they're some really helpful videos on youtube and some great articles on google)  but after I changed/updated it the stock messenger still wont send or receive pics. I ended up downloaded Go SMS Pro and re-entered the APN thru that app and now it works...it still wont thru the stock messenger tho. But i just made that my default SMS and disabled the stock one. Now i'm good to go.
Update: on the battery life, like I stated earlier i'm switching back to Android and i'm still not use to all the little custom things that can be done or things that can be tweaked to help improve battery life. Once again some excellent videos on youtube, example system settings, push notifications, apps in the background. Since I've made some changes the battery life has improved, instead of be at the 35-43% range around 3 pm, its looking more like 4:45-5:20ish range. Which is still not all day, but it is better. Even tho its only about two hours better, its still something. And instead of having to throttle back how much i use my phone around 2:30-3:00ish now i don't have to worry til about 5.

This is an epic phone for the price you pay! Great performance! But I notice that the phone heats up if you try playing games or watch videos at high resolution for a long time. But it does handle multi-tasking very well! The other downfall is that there are no hybrid or any cases that can provide adequate protection for this phone online and case that comes with the phone does no job at providing protection! the phone dropped from 5 ft high and the screen cracked in the left corner and the phone's case came off, which is something you want to be concerned about.

This phone is crazy for the price. I had a Samsung Galaxy S4 that was constantly freezing and the touch screen was glitching all the time, so I knew it was time for me to upgrade. For $150 you get what you pay for, it feels so liberating to have a phone that works. You are just paying a $200 premium on bigger brands like Samsung and an even greater premium on products like Apple.
I'm relatively new the phone market, so this only my 2 cents. My parents both have iPhones, but I think this phone outperforms them in some ways, which is crazy considering the price point for this phone. If you want a budget phone, get this, otherwise your probably better off with a Google Nexus or something.

I really want to love this phone. It's gorgeous, thin, and powerful. Software is extremely buggy though. It constantly dropping WiFi connection. Camera app is stuck in selfie mode, and audio through the headphone jacket is full of static. Don't know if it's just my unit but I decided to return it after tolerating it for about a week. it's a shame that such beautiful hardware does not have the right software to drive it.
Love this phone!!!  85% the features and performance of the Galaxy S7 at 1/5th the price.  Highly Recommended!!

Updated 4/12/16
Unfortunately, this phone is becoming a bigger disappointment.  2 huge issues have come up:
1 - The phone is virtually unusable while being charged.  The screen has multiple errors when i try to type or enter my security code to unlock the phone.  Unacceptable and something that I have never seen in a phone.

2- While talking on the phone, the screen continues to activate because my face is touching it.  i have accidentally opened apps just because I was talking on the phone.  Again, not acceptable and I have never had this happen on any other phone.

I originally scored this at 4 stars and am now taking 2 stars away.  These are major flaws and no, I would not not buy this phone again nor would I recommend purchasing it.

The Life One X is replacing my Ascendmate2, and I have to say I am pretty happy with the purchase so far.

Pros:
- 2 GB Ram on a budget is a huge plus.  Enough to do multitasking and have multiple apps in the background without much stutter
- Minimal bloatware is included.  This is a huge deal, especially when you only have 16GB as your only option for space.  You do have an SD card slot which helps as well.
- Like other reviews have said, it's close to a stock Android interface.  Some may or may not like this, but it is certainly a smooth interface for this phone and I have no complaints on this one.
- Mediatek processor feels quick, and I've had no issues with any games running slowly or any other apps performing poor
- The screen is clear and bright.  I'm making an adjustment going from the 6" screen of the Ascendmate2 to the 5.2" of the BLU, but the screen is much brighter and crisper on the BLU.
- Nice perks of the included screen protector and the snap on case.  Something nice, especially at the price point.

CON
- I wish the phone would weigh just a little bit more to feel the "heft".  The phone is very light, but this is just a personal preference for me.
- The camera does not do well in low light situations.  Even with the flash on, there is a lot of shadowing that occurs.
- Battery life is average.  I'm a bit spoiled coming from the extra long battery life of the Ascendmate2.  Quick charge would have been a nice feature, but at this price point, I can't complain.

Overall, I'm really happy with the phone so far.  The upgrade in the processor and screen has been a huge improvement.  And for $150, I think it's a great option as a budget phone.
Great phone without bloatware.  I cannot say enough good things about this phone.

This is the first BLU phone that I have ever purchased, and I've been quite happy. For $149, I believe it's the best bang for the buck. It's very fast, and I have been able to multitask with different apps without much lag. The battery lasts about a whole day with average use, but I will agree with others that it takes a while to charge from 0%. I usually start charging when I'm around 30% anyway, and it takes about 1.5 hours to get up to 100%. The camera is ok, but you can't really expect much when paying $149 for it. I would rather have had a 5.0 MP with a great lens, than having 12 MP with an ok lens.

On Snapchat, it makes my videos look like something out of Sin City. I believe this has something to do with the phone, because my Nexus 5 didn't do that.

Overall, you can't really complain for paying $149. It's a steal at this price.

Had it on the night stand and knocked over an empty wine glass on it, The screen is destroyed! NOT impressed with the so called gorilla glass. The wine glass didn't even crack. The phone had not been dropped ever. It was only 3 days old.

Excellent phone for the price, Only issue is the slow charging rate of the battery but the phone does have a battery saver feature like most mid/high end phones. Quick screen response and play all apps I downloaded for Play store. Case is almost useless so buy an after market case.

Bought two, one is still working good although there have been problems with the in-call sensor not working as I thought it should and dialing/hanging up while on a call, think I have this figured out.  On the other the glass shattered within a week of normal use - no drops - and was even using the flip case that comes with the phone.  Now Blu is saying that this is not covered, essentially tough luck, buy a new one.  For a company trying to gain traction in this market I would think their customer service would be better.  If customer service was better I would give a higher rating as some defects are bound to happen.
Phone charges really slow. I've left it on the charger it came with for 2 hours and it will charge 5%. The phones really pretty though and I haven't ad any issues with it yet.

It has a decent IPS screen, but the contrast ratio isn't that great. Even when stress testing, the system din't throttle up all the cores and kept them at 1GHz. The CPU is advertised to clock up to 1.3GHz. GPU is underwhelming, nothing too impressive. The black pleather back doesn't fit perfectly and makes odd popping when handling the phone. The battery life is, as presumed, poor. 2900mAh with an octo-core and a 1080x1920 resolution just drain the battery in half a day on heavy use. On light use the battery lasts all day, but that's not too common. Overall factor in the price, of just under $100 on sale, and that makes the phone worth 4/5.

I am a former iPhone user but could not stomach $750 for a new one. So I made the jump to Android with this phone plus a 64Mb microSD card. I use my phone for apps, calls, email and texting. I don't do much with the camera, games or video. I do use it it quite a bit every day (1-4 hours). Android took some getting used to but I like it now. Not quite as much as IOS but it's close. The phone itself is really nice. I'd buy another one. In fact I'd like to get my spouse one.

Pros:
The display is simply excellent. Bright, even in sunlight. Really good resolution.
It is fast with no noticeable lagging.
Android version seems to be close to stock as far as I can tell.
Battery life, given my use, is excellent. I get 1.5 days all the time, sometimes 2 days on a charge.
Call clarity is really good.

Cons:
Charging time is lengthy. If I use the provided charger it is about 3 hours from 5% left.
If I use another charger, such as my old iPhone charger, it will take hours more. And sometimes it will not charge at all depending on the charger.
While calls are clear, the volume is too low for my taste. I have it at max for most calls. I do have some moderate hearing loss so factor that in for yourself. But my iPhone was plenty loud so it is not all me.
Two or 3 times in the month I have had the phone, bluetooth died. It took a reboot to get it back.

Overall a really nice phone. And a lot less than an iPhone.

So far,  I love this phone. I am using it with metro pcs...  I have read people complaining that the  can't get it to work with metro, not sure if they know this, but you have to go to the metro store to have it activated ate for use, you can't do it online with this phone

First off I now consider myself a BLU customer. I switched to this phone from the BLU Life One and man do I love it. The screen is very crisp and the colors pop. I started charging it around 7pm and it is now 10pm and it went from 24% to 72%. 3 hours and it's still not done. Im not sure if i just got a bad phone or if this is just normal. If Someone else who has one can confirm this is normal ill probably keep it, if not ill be returning it.

UPDATE (READ FOR CHARGING HELP) So I woke up and decided to switch the included charging cable with the cable from my lg phone i was using before and it so far has charged 20% in about 20-25 minutes. Im still using the included charger, because the lg charger made no difference. I guess the included cable is really bad, but switching the cable with another helped me A LOT. I went from 61% to 82% in about 30 minutes. Hope this helps the rest of you, let me know if it did! *Make sure to use the included charger and not a different one as it doesnt help, just change the cable* Ill continue to check it for about a week and let you guys know if this continues to work.

I wanted to drop a review to say how much I like this phone.  When I first got it, I wouldn't have put it at 5 stars because I had issues with the battery.  It took way to long to charge up, and the battery life wasn't great.  About a week after I got it, the phone notified me that it had an update available.  What a difference that made!  It now charges quickly, and I can go all day without needing to charge.

This phone has an amazing screen.  Video looks just amazing on here.  Both cameras are great, and both have a flash, which is great!  The sound is not that loud, but at this price point I do expect that you have to give a little bit somewhere.  It also comes with a great case and screen protector - something I haven't gotten with other brands in the past.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this phone.  It's well worth the price.

***Update: I've been using this phone for the past 5 months and still really like it.  I've even unfortunately dropped it a couple times with no ill  effects.  It still runs well, holds battery charge and charges back up well, and the display is beautiful for watching videos.  I still give it 5 stars and would say well worth the purchase.

Bought this during the sale and for the money spent I couldn't have bought a better phone for the money.  I do have a few issues though - and if I paid full retail price for the phone then these issues might concern me more... but I didn't.
1- The rubberized back plate doesn't fit completely flush to the aluminum frame on the corner used to peel it off.  I'm temporarily using the included sheath until my TPU case arrives from Spain, then that should take care of that problem.
2 - I've been noticing some phantom vibrations.  It will vibrate as if I have a message, but there is nothing there.  I don't know if its the phone or a malfunctioning app.
3 - The camera is slow and not that great, but I'm not a big camera user anyway - which means I haven't dove into any settings that could possibly speed it up.

I'm not thrilled about the non-removable battery, but I knew that going in.  However battery life is good and operation is fluid.  Bloatware is minimal.  Screen is great.  People complain about slow charging time but it seems normal to me - about the same as my old Nexus 4 but allowing for a larger battery.  I initially thought I would use the dual SIM feature with both TMobile for data and ATT MVNO for voice, but I wound up exclusively with Cricket wireless right before I received the phone so I never tested that feature.  I got sick of horrible battery life on Android phones and switched to Lumias, but eventually their shortcomings caught up.  This is the phone that put me back on Android.  After spending hundreds of dollars on phones in the past only to be disappointed in them one way or another, I decided I would NEVER spend more than a hundred bucks on a phone ever again.  Luckily I was able to grab this during the launch sale.

Very affordable price that has the feel, function and look of products 3 times more expensive.  After purchasing the product after already having used a Samsung Galaxy and an Apple iPhone, I wasn't expecting much from the phone due to price point.  After receiving the phone I was surprised at the look, feel and performance of the product because of the price. Memory and Camera are average, but again, more than I was expecting. Screen quality in sunlight is adequate so long as the brightness is turned up to highest setting.  The android OS is very close to stock so I happy that was the case.

Great phone I love it. Its cheap has good battery life, great display, but there are some faults. Nothing to major for me, but might be for others. The speaker is not the best in my opinion its one of the worst speakers ive ever had on any smart phone ive owned, but i usually use headphones or connect it through bluetooth so its not a big problem. As for the camera it good quality for the price, but definetly has some lighting problems. Again not a huge factor for me, but maybe for others. The phone comes with a case, headphones, and a screen protector which is just extra goodies. The one major problem i have with mine is that i can't set a custom ringtone for some reason even though an undate was sent to fix that problem it has not been fixed for me. The phone is also suppose to get the latest android os at some point.

I've owned iphone windows phone,  android devices and wanted a cheaper alternative.  I've owned this phone for over a month as my daily  driver and couldn't be more satisfied.  Phone is on the lighter side compared to other devices.  Battery life is fine. I get 1-2 days using DU Battery Saver.  It does fine with video and audio streaming. Screen display is excellent and speaker is sufficient. Call quality is good.  The phone is sized between a phablet and a small device at 5.2 in display and feels solid .  Fits well in the hand.  If you are looking for a reasonable alternative to a flagship device,  I highly recommend this Blu Life One X.
Some difficulty with personalized ringtones otherwise good phone

For the introductory price, this is a great mid-end phone. Bright screen, large capacity battery, reasonably fast processor are all the things I like about it. The most important thing is, it doesn't feel cheap or flimsy at all. It gives Moto E or Moto G a good run for their money.

It also comes with very stock Android with a few Amazon app, I am not sure about upgrade in the future and at this time, it is very usable.

A few things bug me:
- Included screen protector does not fit the whole display
- Doesn't have 5GHz Wifi support
- Nav bar take up more vertical space than stock Android

Currently I am replacing my Nexus 4 with this and I am more than happy about the purchase.

This was my 4th and last Blu.....the other three I was pleased with but this one had problems from day 1.  One was the stock keyboard which, when updated via Google Play became malware to anyone who isn't a savvy Android user. Because it shipped from Blu, it couldn't be uninstalled - you could only reset the app and deactivate it.  I don't believe Blu had anything to do with that app as several vendors got nailed by it but I would have expected a patch to remove it instead of making people live with that crap on their phone.

From the beginning - and what at last killed the phone - were battery problems.  Blu may have known this modal had issues because the only update I received from them dealt with the battery....which eventually shorted out and destroyed the phone. Before that, it would discharge at amazing rates.  Even with the screen off and phone in standby it would literally discharge at 1% per minute sometimes. I would have returned it but the problem was very intermittent so I wasted time determining if it was an app that was responsible.

In the end, it was the phone.  I just bought an Honor.....we'll see how that goes.

After using the phone for less than 4 weeks, the small power button on the phone decided to pop off while it was in my pocket. I've since lost the little fleck of plastic, and am required to use a nickel to turn the phone on and off / open and close the lock screen each time. I contacted Amazon immediately about a warrenty replacement, and they told me they wouldn't do anything for me and I should contact the manufacture. I looked up the warrenty info with the manufacture, and sent an email with all my info and the problem as they instructed. It's now been another two weeks and I haven't heard anything. There is no phone number to call. Basically, if you buy this phone, don't expect to be able to get any warrenty support past 30 days from either Amazon or BLU on this device. Your basicly out of luck and stuck with a worthless $150 phone.
The dual sim works with 4G in both sim.

So I bought this phone, because I needed a cheap android phone, something to replace the Life Play 2 that I had and I was happy to receive the phone.

Reason for giving this a 3 star review instead of 5, for the price bracket, is that I received the phone on the 5th of May, 2016 and as of the day of this review, May 25th, I have not been able to get any form of vibration from this phone. What I mean by no vibration? No vibration while ringing, no haptic feedback, nothing. I don't know if it's working but some how after a first boot, it didn't activate or the vibration motto just not working.

I haven't done any reset yet cause I have all my apps set up how I want. Don't want to bother with that again. The phone is great other wise, great screen, great sounds out of the headphone jack and speakers. Camera is better than what most say about it. The battery is good enough, all day battery life, for 2900 mAh. The phone idle bug does not do justice to this phone. Do hope BLU fixes that in the marshmallow update when it comes.

This phone has been in service for 75 days. It no longer works
- The battery will not completely charge and discharges in less than 2 hour with Wifi enabled, 4 with it disabled.
- It will not read the SD card, the card has been verified good in 3 other devices.
- The camera has stopped working.
- Attempting to access storage setting causes the phone to freeze.
- The phone will not start on many occasions, or will not shut down using the power button alone.
- The phone often crashes and drops to the Android command prompt where it must be commanded down with text commands.
- Periodically the phone will spontaneously reboot and attempt to download updates  This behavior continues for several hours.
- BLU support will not respond to warranty claims nor phone calls to service the product.
- Amazon will not assist nor honor its satisfaction promises.
 That's just a partial list. On the plus side the box the phone was shipped in remains remains rectangular in shape.

Not many phones have a front facing flash, especially under $150. I would say this is the budget Android version of the iPhone with a little extra (i.e. SD card slot, 2 sim trays, larger battery, ect). The metal banding around the phone is premium feeling and the snap on flip case is impressive with the quick view window. Blu has gained a new customer with this device.

P.S. Works well with Metro PCS LTE.

this phone is ok. it has 2 sim slots and an expansion micro sd slot. it's 4G as well and has wi-fi and blue tooth capabilities. however, two major things that i don't like: 1) non-removable battery. battery cannot be replaced/swapped; 2) cannot be used for selective ring tones even if ring tones have been downloaded and are in the ring tones file! overall it's ok for the price.
nice price, good quality

Notification light is small. Alarm clock choices are not loud enough to wake me and I am a light sleeper. The reason for my returning of the phone is the battery. Takes all day or night to charge and in about 4 hours of app use or web browsing and texting it needs to be charged again. And no I don't use my phone every second of every day but I do use it when I am waiting at the dr office to play games or text people and today was the first time I really took it out of the house and I used it well it failed that test lol every 5 minutes a battery percentage would fall. It shouldn't do that. I saw the iRulu V3 and it looks great so I'll try that.

It shut fown and now all it says is optimizing... Smh won't even start up. This is the worst phone ever... Its supposed to be white.. Most of the white in the back rubed off and its turning gold... The touch screen doesn't work most of the time the battery drains super fast then if it dies before you charge you have to leave it off while charging until at least 20% then turn it on and wait another 45 min while it says apps starting.. I regret getting this phone

Finally, I got this phone a few hours ago. I am writing this review based on a few hours' use, and will update or add new findings to this review as I use it more. Ask me any questions about the phone if you have any.

Background information
I am quite familiar with iOS, Android, Windows, OS X. I have been developing software.
Phones I own right now: Galaxy S4, Galaxy Nexus, Moto G (2013)
Phones I had owned before: Atrix, Galaxy S3, iPhone 5, etc.

Performance
I worried about the performance because it uses a MediaTek CPU which has a bad reputation. I did some basic stuff like installing apps, watching YouTube, or browsing the web, etc. It definitely is faster than Galaxy Nexus, and Moto G. It could be due to 2GB RAM instead of 1GB like Moto G has. I could not feel noticeable lag or slowness. It feels perhaps even faster than Galaxy S4 or Nexus 7 2013 for some tasks. I ran Geek Bench. Keep in mind total score is quite arbitrary value because of the weights used. One X's single-core score was a little bit lower than that of Galaxy S4. One X's multi-core score was a little higher than that of Galaxy S4. At this price point, I have no complaints about the performance as of yet.

I do not play games, but I just ran Asphalt 8 as a test. It lagged with High visual quality. It was playable bit still a little bit not smooth with Medium visual quality. On Galaxy S4, this game runs quite smoothly with High visual quality. Basically, if you expect you could play high quality 3D games smoothly on a phone at this price point, it ls like a person who wants to play Crisis at maximum settings on an Intel Atom netbook.

Look and feel
I like how it looks, probably one of the best I have seen for years. It looks thin and sleek, due to its rounded edges. Moto G feels twice as thicker than One X, and feels heavy. There is some sort of metal rounding around the edge, and the back cover is removable. The problem is, the narrow area between the metal edge and the plastic cover is a little bit recessed, so when you are holding the phone you can feel it. This does not feel good. Galaxy S4 also has fake metal rounding and back cover, but it does not have this problem. Also, the back cover plastic feels really thin and cheap. I am not a person who just hates plastic for being plastic. I never ranted Galaxy S4 being plastic. S4's plastic back cover feels solid and when you tap on it, it does not rattle. It seems that there is slight gap between the back and the back cover, and since the back cover is thin, when you tap on it, it rattles. It is not a big problem, but a little bit annoying. Even Moto G's plastic back cover feels a lot solid and high-quality than One X's.

Screen quality
I am very satisfied with the screen, especially at this price point! It is very bright and colourful, so it just looks good. Mine has no light-bleedings on the corners or any dead pixels like my Moto G, which has both light-bleedings and a dead pixel (could be a dust under the glass). Also its resolution is 1080p, miles better than Moto G.

The only small problem is, that the minimum brightness is too bright. I compared the minimum brightness with other devices' minimum brightness. One X's minimum brightness was the brightest. I would say, its minimum brightness is twice as bright than Nexus 7 (2013).

Loud speaker sound quality
I would say, an average quality for a phone. I watched many reviews before I received it, and I worried about the speaker quality, because some reviewers said the speaker was very tinny and sounded bad. I tested it and it wasn’t really bad. As a proof, I have recorded a video in which I compare the speaker qualities of four phones. Moto G's loud speaker was a bit better as its maximum volume is louder and it sounded a little bit clearer. But for watching YouTube videos (mainly talking), the difference not that noticeable unless you directly compare the two side by side.

A little bit disappointing is the popping noise of the headphone jack when playing sound starts/ends. I think this happens because internally it turns off the analogue sound output to save energy and then turns it on when playing sound. My cheap Lenovo laptop also has this problem. Moto G also has this problem but its noise is a lot milder. High-end devices (at least at their debut) like Galaxy S4 or MacBook do not have this problem. Anyways, this happens only when play starts/ends, not during the playback.

System language
It has about 20 languages including English, French, German, or Chinese. But it does not have Japanese or Korean. I am fine with English, but a small problem is there are no variants. I use British English, but there is only English which is US English. On Nexus devices, there are many variants of English, such as United States or United Kindom.

Undeletable Applications
There were only a few applications when I first turned it on. It had McAfee Security, Yahoo Weather, Opera, some Amazon stuff. First, I deleted MacAfee right away, because I think those kinds of applications are generally scams themselves (I also hate that John McAfee). Almost all could be installed or disabled. Here is the list of applications that are not part of Android or from Google and cannot be uninstalled nor disabled. When compared to phones from Samsung or LG, there is almost no bloatware at all.
-- BLU Help (just a shortcut to their web site), File Manager, FM Radio, TouchPal 2015 (default keyboard), Videos (seems to be a video player).

OS
Right after I turned it on, I checked for system update. There was no update. OS version is BLU_LIFT_ONE_X_V12_GENERIC_5.1_20151009-1848. The Android version is 5.1. Kernel version is 3.10.65.

Problems
When I touch the upper part of the phone, Bluetooth sound is complete stops. I have had many other phones and tablets, but I have never seen anything like this. So, basically, when you are holding this phone with the hands in landscape mode, you cannot listen to your Bluetooth audio.

Small good things
It shows small red light on the top left bezel when charging. I hate when a phone does not have a charging light, because then I would have to turn on the screen to see if charging is done or not.
I can turn it on by double tapping the screen when it is off.
Haptic feedback is acceptable. I think Samsung's the best because they feel like springs. Moto G's is worst because it is noisy and feels like some small motor is rotating. One X's does not feel springy like Samsung's but mild and soft, a lot better than Moto G's.
It has two LED flashes, one on the back, and one on the front.
The package contains a lot of stuff: LCD protection film, earphones, flip cover, charger, cable. I probably am not going to use them other than the protection film, perhaps. But they could be valuable to some people.

Small bad things
The USB port is on the left, not on the centre, of the bottom side. And it is upside down, like that of Nexus 7.
The edge is probably made of metal. When charging, I can feel slight electric current there.
The buttons are a little bit too pointy and feel cheap, compared to Galaxy S4. But when compared to Moto G, they are about the same quality.
There is a slight gap between the bottom of the phone and the back cover,especially near the concave area for your finger nail.
A++++ excelent
Very well put together. fast and easy to use. Enjoying it very much. 8-)

I just broke my Samsung S4 on the ATT network and had a dilemma of buying a $600+ smart phone or something on the cheap end.  Since the days of subsidized phones appear to be over I evaluated my options.  First I use the phone for work email and calls, listening to streaming radio over a hour car ride, android development, and personal use.  Maybe small games, some social media.

It really makes me question why everyone flocks to the expensive brands when I have this BLU phone for two weeks and I notice no change in behavior from my old phone.  The BLU phone does everything I need (plus) without all the ATT bloatware.  Ok, if you need the latest eyeball tracking crap Samsung promotes that most of us turn off after we play with it for 5 min then maybe this isn't for you.  It isn't loaded with features outside of stock Android.  It is way faster than my old S4.

This is a stock Android 5.1 phone with decent display, runs fast, decent battery, and is FREAKING CHEAP.  If I break it I can buy 4 more before I spend the amount of newer phones.  I might buy another just to throw it at someone text walking with a Samsung or Apple phone.

I can use it as a hot spot because ATT can't reign down their corporate policy on me.  It has expandable memory, and dual sim.  Battery has been good so far.  Wish it had removable battery.

The one negative is the camera.  It isn't very good.  I can take pictures and they look decent depending on the lighting, but wouldn't rely on it for important moments.  I take pictures of my kid with a DSLR, but if you use your phone as a primary camera then I would still look for a cheaper phone with a better camera.

I got mine for $99, and am very impressed on the build quality and performance of this phone.
I'm  giving it 5 stars for the price you can't beat it! The only issue I have so far is the ringtone not able to put my own ringtone in!
